Reviews.Title: “Great club service”
Reviews.Author: hurstie617
Reviews.Content: Great club service and location next to convention center. Lounge and restaurant in lobby worth giving a miss..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: Denmother123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Business ...was given top notch service, very clean room and friendly staff. Closest hotel to the CN Tower. Central location, walking distance to business (FINANCE)and entertainment district. Nice walk to shopping district. Right down the street from the Rogers Centre. Felt very safe walking downtown up until midnight. Wish I could have stayed longer to enjoy the amenities in the hotel. Lobby restaurant, lounge was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “It's The People”
Reviews.Author: S R
Reviews.Content: It was a crazy week...tons of people. But David Paes at the Front Desk made me feel like royalty. Bellman Wayne Morriss was helpful and Pauline at the Bar remembered my favourite. Nice to feel at home when you are far from home. And the beds, the pillows, the quiet rooms...but really, it's the people who make it. Couldn't be more considerate, friendly and helpful. The best.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly and Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: BlondieTravellerGirl
Reviews.Content: I had opportunity to stay at the InterContinental Toronto Centre (ITC) again recently while exhibiting at the Toronto Sportsmen's Show. I stayed at the hotel for 8 nights so had ample time to really get a sense of the place. Because of the length of our stay we had to bring our golden retriever along with us. The ITC's website states that they are a pet friendly hotel but I was worried that having our dog along would be a hassle. Right from the check-in it was clear that when the ITC says "pet friendly" they mean it! At check-in our dog was provided with a welcome package containing some doggie treats, a spare leash and admission to PawsWay at Queens Quay. The staff was very friendly and accommodating with our dog during our whole stay. The rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated and the beds are, fall asleep in an instant, comfy. The staff go out of their way to accommodate and are friendly and professional. One night, we ordered take-out from a local Indian restaurant. When the food was delivered we realized they hadn't included rice with our dishes. We called down to room service and asked if they could deliver two portions of plain rice to our room. Within 10 minutes, we had two plates of rice and were able to enjoy our meal. I would recommend the ITC highly for both business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MM2424
Reviews.Content: Great service, wonderful rooms and the beds are so comfy! Two great sleeps when I was there for business....I didn't require ear plugs for the nights I stayed there. Impressive at a downtown hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Jay71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the InterContinental as part of the second half of my business trip to Toronto. I felt pretty central as I was able to walk to a number of places downtown. Great view of the CN Tower and the Air Canada Centre and Rogers Arena were close by also. Didn't love the food options right by the hotel but found a number within easy walking distance. Quite enjoyed my room. Bed, pillow, and sheets were nice. Free wifi in the room with good speed. Good selection of channels on the tv. Washroom was nice with extended amenities and even a scale. Iron, ironing board, and safe in the closet. Coffee maker in the room with the prepackaged cylinders (I'm not a coffee drinker). Elevators were quick even though I was on the 25th floor. Found my interactions with the staff to be very friendly from the front desk to the doorman greeting me upon return. Housekeeping staff were nice in that they wrote thank you notes for my daily tip. Found value to be very good, particularly since I was able to get a corporate rate. Taxi trip to the airport was approximately $50-55 pretip. Would quite recommend staying at the InterContinental if you needed to be in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: aitutaki1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at Labour Day weekend 2011. Needed a meeting room for the entire day and we had exclusive use for 14 hours of a business conference room. Room on Club Floor was very well appointed with as expected amenities. Large room with a city view over the sky dome carparks and the railway marshalling yards!! Great night sleep and excellent breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Center make Porter Airline look good”
Reviews.Author: quecber
Reviews.Content: Send there bu Porter airline for a one night stay, all the personnal was realy helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony R
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great amenities! I didn't expect them to go the extra mile but Rania,I believe her name was, informed me we had been places in a contemporary room with a great view of CN tower and Lake Ontario!!! Made our stay extra special. Hazel on check out was friendly and made note of my preferences which is appreciated as I'll be back at this hotel whenever I can.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you try the Spa facilities”
Reviews.Author: NiMo416
Reviews.Content: Centrally located near to Union Station,The Metro Convention Centre, CN Tower, walking distance to all major attractions. The Spa at InterContinental, located on the 3rd floor is a devine little oasis in the city with great services and 1st class treatments. The facilities are spacious, clean with an indoor pool (4 feet deep), large jacuzzi, Himalayan Salt bath and steam room all available to guest. I liked the indoor pool temperature. This being the winter season, it was just right temperature for me especially with the sun streaming in from the floor to cieling city views. I was looking for a place to swim before spa treatments and the InterContinental fit all my spa requirements.The Spa uses Aveda products for the treatments. Sophia, the aesthetician was wonderful. The Spa service from beginning to end was satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a conference, big rooms, service spotty”
Reviews.Author: CD_Texas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over the PDAC. Superbly convenient for the convention centre. Rooms are nice and big. Bathrooms are quite old, shower in the bath with a shower curtain and pretty dark in the shower. Service was spotty - expected it to be better. Couple of examples - ordered room service and was told 45 minutes wait - took an hour 15 to arrive. Had an issue with my safe, no-one arrived or called until an hour and half later. When they did arrive, they fixed it quickly and efficiently. The air conditioning unit in my room was really noisy. On the plus side, breakfast ordered through room service arrives during the chosen 15 minute slot and the hairdryers are great.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet rooms in the centre of city”
Reviews.Author: SkylarC
Reviews.Content: Great staff, excellent location. Rooms are nice and quiet, Keurig was a nice touch. As expected parking was very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Geoff H
Reviews.Content: Great business hotel, close to all amenities, and sports venues. As a frequent Intercontinental consumer, this is in keeping with good business hotels around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: sandytoez
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in Toronto this weekend as we were in town to see a concert at the Roy Thompson Hall and staying at the Intercontinental Toronto was certainly part of the reason that we enjoyed our visit so much. We had a room on the 17th floor over looking Lake Ontario and the CN tower. Location was perfect just a block south of the venue in the entertainment district. Check-in was fast and friendly and we received a room exactly what I had booked with a King Bed Non Smoking. There were lovely views from the elevator hallway and from our room. The CN tower never ceases to amaze me. What an awesome structure both at day and night. Wonderful views. Hubby and I liked sitting at the window sipping a Drambuie and watching the men working construction waaaaaaayyyyyyyyyyy down below at the base of the tower, building what ever it is that they are building. They looked like little ants toiling away. We liked watching the planes land on the island, the white capped waves on the lake, the GO trains coming and going, the clouds in the sky. The bed had clean fresh crisp sheets with big soft pillows. We slept well but if you are a light sleeper I would recommend bringing ear plugs as there are lots of assorted noises, not loud though. The room was clean and large and it had a nice flat screen TV. There is a Keurig coffee maker, iron and ironing board, and nice crystal glasses. I hate drinking out of plastic cups. Lots of hot water for our shower. We were very comfortable indeed. The Azure restaurant in the lobby was nice but very expensive so we only stopped in for a night cap after the concert but it was a relaxing place to sit for a bit. We certainly enjoyed our stay and would stay there again if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Room size and downtown location are notable.”
Reviews.Author: LakesiderToronto
Reviews.Content: The Intercon is perfectly situated if you're attending a trade show or conference at the Convention Centre - you don't even have to leave the building. You're close to the Dome and the Air Canada Centre for big league sports and the downtown business core is a 3 minute walk away. And of course, the CN Tower is a minute away and some rooms have views of the Tower. From a business perspective, the meeting rooms are a little oppressive with low ceilings and there isn't a large ballroom onsite but that's partly due to the location beside the Convention Centre. The other big plus with this hotel is the guest room size...they're big! Lots of room for a king-size bed and a couch, coffee table sitting area. Due to the angles of the outside walls, the rooms offer extra privacy at the windows as well. The one restaurant in the lobby is slightly on the upscale side of average but there are many great restos within a 10 minute walk or a short cab ride, and there are some typical chain/touristy spots just steps from the front door. For a downtown business trip or a city visit with a family, the Intercon makes a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Club Lounge”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: Booked Standard King room @ CAA/AAA $155. Originally upgraded to 2 room suite on 16th flr. At check-in was recommended a better 2-room on the 9th w/lake-CN Tower view w/ Club access #925 Premier Suite. Terrific room with separate entrance-connected business lounge w/ 1/2 bath, large King bedroom/bathroom, lots of windows, Bose sound + LCD TV's in both. Comfortable, Clean, well stocked. No issues getting mini-bar refilled. Accurate billing, mini-bar & internet wiped w/o asking. Excellent Club Lounge - one of the best I've used. Stayed on a weekend. Personalized attention from great staff with lots of selection despite few guests. Good: All contact with staff were friendly and helpful. Seemed to try extra for AmB. Excellent Spa facility (except pool) and clean. Great restaurant w/ live Jazz band although short on waiter staff at nights. Bad: Small pool/hot tub area (still lg compared IC Yorkville). Easily overwhelmed and really need a separate area for paying Spa guests. Excellent value. Absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and great view!”
Reviews.Author: Gerry733
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for 3 nights on a business trip and the rooms were very clean and spacious. I was surprised at the quality of the mattress and pillows on the beds but happy with the sleep that I got because of them. I would definetely stay there again. The view was also great as I was overlooking Lake Ontario.

Reviews.Title: “did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: zak L
Reviews.Content: this hotel was definitely below expectations!! i booked a bi level suite and still had unpleasant experience. Staff was very rude and unhelpful untill they saw i had Royal Ambassador status. with that said room was decent. however overall it was a very disappointing experience! would not stay here again and would not recommend to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: europeeveryyear
Reviews.Content: Ungraded to a 2 level Suite without asking. Very Clean and the staff were terrific. Great location with easy access to the expressway. Only complaint would be that the Bathroom fixtures were not the same standard as the rest of the room. Great Breakfast Buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat It”
Reviews.Author: Gilmour9393
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in Toronto for years. I've been staying at this hotel quite regularly over the last couple of years. I have to say that this hotel and it's staff are truly wonderful. I've never had a poor time and I actually look forward to staying there. The location is fabulous. The rooms have been redone. The views of Toronto or the lake are spectacular. The spa is great. You literally don't have to leave the hotel. My wife and I have spent many weekends just enjoying the hotel and what it has to offer. It's everything an Intercontinental should be and more!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - changed my mind about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimosabi
Reviews.Content: A few years ago, I went to this hotel and the service was terrible. I stayed away because of it. But I recently returned, reluctantly, because I was attending a function and it was just so convenient to stay in the same location. I am glad I did. The service this time was great. The check in lines were very long because so many people were attending the same event but they processed us quickly and had someone making sure everyone in line was ok. The rooms look the same as they did a few years back although a bit warn in some places. But the room is a good size, the TV is nice, the view is great, the room was VERY quiet and the beds were comfortable. The shower was not as warm as I like it in the morning, but it was manageable. We did not eat at the hotel but we did try their specialty Martini in Azure and it is fantastic (and I am not a big martini drinker) although the price is not for the faint of heart!. I usually use valet parking but decided to self park this time. It was really simple and a lot less expensive. Unless you are carrying a lot (we could only find stairs to get to the hotel), I would recommend the self park. Rarely do I change my mind on a location, but this hotel is now back in my good books.

Reviews.Title: “Quick weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: RozMyDog
Reviews.Content: We booked one night's getaway at this hotel and found it to be very nice. Right downtown (only steps from Union Station - GO Transit and TTC)...in my opinion the rooms were modern and well kept, staff were very pleasant and accomodating. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Toronto location”
Reviews.Author: johnbalmer
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel....can walk to anything in the downtown area or to the ferry to the Island.....all the amenities and right in the middle of the restaurant/bar area.....close to the train and subway for ease of travel

Reviews.Title: “FAIL again...for the fourth time!”
Reviews.Author: Realt0rGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel didn't double book the credit card this time, (it has twice before)...and the restaurant was atrocious again! We have an annual convention at the MCC every January, where at least 75 of us end up after dinner for some drinks and to catch up. As per usual, the bar Azure was understaffed....over priced, and completely disorganized. A line-up of us waited (and I timed it on the TV) 25 minutes for a drink. The only reason I stay there is because generally I don't book it, I just end up staying with a colleague that books. The only good thing out of this trip, is that the valet was only 10 minutes, not it's regular 20, AND for the the first time again, we didn't get double billed for it. The shower in our room ONLY had freezing cold water, or scalding hot water. When we told the staff, they said "Oh. That's too bad." I highly recommend you stay elsewhere and pay the small cab fare to get to the Convention Centre if that's why you would book at the InterContinental.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place But...”
Reviews.Author: LinGal2001
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for a short stay. Elegant and open it was a little dark for my taste, but I could do it for two nights no problem. The staff "owns" the customer experience. It's really nice to be connected to the Convention Center if that is where you will be going.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: Weston A
Reviews.Content: I would not return to place but the metro convention centre is attached to the hotel it was extremmly expensive Pricing Azure restarunt $$$$ The hotel $$$$$$$$ not worth it Int0 dollars thats crazy internet

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel in the financial district in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: TiredCanadian
Reviews.Content: This is a great business hotel. The beds are very comfortable. Usually I can't sleep when I travel (hence the handle Tired Canadian), but I got my zzzs with no difficulty on the supremely comfortable king-size bed. This hotel is connected to the Metro Toronto Convention Centre and union station. The club level is very convenient -- with a nice breakfast, afternoon tea and nibbles before dinner with honour bar. There is a nice selection of DVDs to borrow from the concierge and the Bose audio system is a nice treat. The club level rooms are spacious and are completely spruced up. My only complaint (which is unusual for the Intercontinental) is that the handset on my work desk didn't work and it took two trips by maintenance to fix it. Since I had come to work and needed to make some conference calls, it did make the first part of my stay really stressful. Skip valet parking ($45 a day) and just park in the adjacent convention centre parking ($25 a day), unless you really need the car for ins/outs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in the Heart of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: weistk
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at this hotel for a conference, and have been very impressed with the level of service here, all of the staff are extremely helpful and polite. Did not have any problems at the bar with service, and did not use the restaurant as it is fairly pricy. The room is spacious with a large flatscreen TV and stocked mini bar. Bathroom is also clean and spacious. Beds are also comfy! There was a slight mix up on check in, as I was supposed to have a king bed but ended up with the two bed room instead. Also gave them a different credit card than the one that I had originally booked with, and he didn't pay attention so used the wrong one to confirm the room. I will have to check out in person in order to make sure that the charges go to the correct credit card. The only other issue that I have is being charged $9.95 per day for wifi service, already paying lots to stay at this hotel and I think that is highway robbery. That aside, the hotel and staff are fabulous and it is very conveniently located close to everything! No need for a car while you are staying here, lots of shopping, restaurants, public transit and landmarks close by. And if you are attending a conference at the convention centre, it is extremely convenient you don't even have to go outside if you choose not to.

Reviews.Title: “...wonderful introduction to Toronto (and Canada)”
Reviews.Author: view-with-a-room
Reviews.Content: Visit to Canada to complete the interview for NEXUS and to visit Toronto. Two night stay on a corporate rate w/ the associated benefits of the Priority Club loyalty program. The view from the room included the rail station and the downtown; both of which are a nice reminder of the working nature of Toronto. Watching the trains and people from the comfort of the room on a cold day is an interesting contrast to the typical scenic views. The airport express bus to and from is quick and easy and $20 each way. The hotel is one of the first to depart from the hotel and one of the last to depart to the airport so the trip is one of the quickest for the hotels serviced by the service. The rooms are very comfortable and the beds are very comfortable. Do not hesitate to visit the staff for information on a visit to downtown Toronto. The weekend stay included a Friday visit to to the food court and entrance to the tunnel system across the street with a wonderful assortment of options for dinner and shopping; only to visit again on Saturday to an empty food court and empty shops. Eaton Mall is the place to be on the weekend but the travels through empty tunnels to the mall is quite the contrast. The food at the hotel is high quality but pricey. The food at the food court across the street is also high quality and not so pricey. The breakfast buffet is $30 and too bright and loud for a breakfast -- too much light and too much music. The hotel lobby and hotel restaurant are very open and inviting. The staff are very friendly and inviting also. The club and associated club rooms are on the 8th & 9th floors. The club is nice and the club staff are also quite nice. Nice assortment of food and drink in the club. Breakfast is a continental breakfast ideal for a light breakfast but not so ideal for the cold Toronto weather. The breakfast included no hot items despite the cold weather and so found the breakfast buffet or room service to be a better option. No surprises on the bill so pleased with the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business, but never for leisure”
Reviews.Author: port-au-persil
Reviews.Content: The value is excellent if your are on a business trip. Rooms had been updated but not the bathrooms. Sound proof is average. Service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PhillyShaney
Reviews.Content: Me and a travel buddy came to Toronto to visit a friend we met on a trip in Spain. This trip was totally last minute and we found a great deal online. The hotel is stunning and the room was a nice size. The staff were friendly enough. Let me tell you that this location was AWESOME!! You are in walking distance to the CN Tower and you can take advantage of the public transportation to visit the neighborhoods and restaurants. I am not an easy going traveller and it usually takes much to get my seal of approval. It didn't take much for this hotel to win me over. I appreciated the level of service provided by the staff. If I were to return to Toronto - I would consider staying at this hotel again. Location, Location, Location is everything.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to convention centre”
Reviews.Author: ATRT
Reviews.Content: Going to the convention centre for an event? Then this is definitely the hotel to stay at. Friendly, professional service, great location attaches to convention centre and skywalks to union station and close to Rogers centre shopping and so many restaurants. Although the rooms are nice I did find them in need of some professional sprucing up. Lots of drafty windows, poor repairs and cracks around window frames trim etc. Room was clean and very nice size. Comfortable bed

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Average rooms”
Reviews.Author: mseifried
Reviews.Content: Just attended a trade show at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre which is adjacent to the Intercontinental Hotel. My experience was good and bad. First the good. Originally I had booked a King Size bed room and my situation changed a week or so prior to my arrival. I had called in advance and asked to switch and they told me that they were sold out and could not change..Was not impressed BUT when I checked in I told them about my situation and they were able to find me a room with 2 beds... So, at the end of the day they were accomodating Rooms are average size with a nice LARGE Phillips HD TV with lots of channels. I also found the beds very comfortable. The location on Front street is walking distance to lots of restaurants, Real Sports Bar, ACC and Rogers Centre and CN Tower BAD The furniture looks dated and the wallpaper in the bathrooms (does anyone use wallpaper anymore) was very old and peeling in spots. Definitely ready for a face lift Checked in around 2:30ish and room was not available and had to leave luggage with concierege Went to the Lobby bar at 5:30 after our show and the service was terrible. Took 25 min to get our first drink and almost 20 to get our second. Everyone in the bar was complaining and a manager eventually came over and apologized. Apparently the night before, one of the gents in our group was at this bar the night before and almost got into a fight with the bartender as the bartender tried to scam them out of some money....The hotel needs to look into the service aspect of this area for sure. Not sure what the room costs are as it was paid for by my company but they sting you $25 a day for parking in the attached garage. They need to build this into room price OR offer subsidized parking rates

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and comfy room, book it now!”
Reviews.Author: kryptogram
Reviews.Content: My boys and I stayed here in early January. The hotel is easy to find, just under the CN Tower. This great location is why I picked the hotel, but it was perfect for our downtown Toronto explorations. My advice is to get the breakfast package with your room. The buffet is really deluxe - they even have an omelet chef! Parking is under the building. If you are going to use your car, be ready to pay $45 for valet service. That beats the $25 per day flat fee of the self park, but only if you are going to go in and out with the car. We didn't need ours, because we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. The valets were helpful even though we didn't use them, directing us to the better deal. The lobby is spacious and well-kept, with a nice concierge desk. The clerks checked us in right away, with no wait. We were upgraded to a better room for free. It was on the 13th floor, an unusual thing to find in any hotel. We took it and had no weird things happen. The room had comfortable beds, a nice view of the city and lots of great amenities. We really liked the iPod dock on the clock radio. You could charge your device and listen to your own music. The room was clean and had all the supplies you need. We walked to the AC Center, Hockey Hall of Fame and CN Tower, all from the hotel. It is also really close to the convention center and rail transport. The restaurant is really pricey but they had some great Niagara wines. There are lots of other eating and drinking choices close by. It's a great choice for any stay in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, comfortable stay (as usual!)”
Reviews.Author: trvlwrldgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here over New Year's weekend 2011. We booked on the Club level (small upgrade price to pay for lots of extra service & food). As usual, the staff at the Intercon do all they can to meet your needs. The rooms are large & comfortable. Beds are always extremely cosy & soft :) We had a minor issue when we first checked in, as our room was missing a couch (sitting area had one arm chair & a large space where a couch should have been). A simple trip to the front desk & problem was solved immediately (including profuse apologies; I was almost embarrassed, as it really wasn't a very big deal). Grateful to have a room with lots of seating, as we were having friends over. I highly recommend paying a bit more for a Club level room. This will provide you with a morning breakfast (many different options for food & lots of warm beverages, juices, etc.); afternoon tea & snacks, and then evening cocktail hour (a wide selection of hot & cold appetizers & non-alcoholic drinks). You can purchase alcohol in the Club lounge if you like. This is very similar to what the Marriott Concierge level rooms offer, but even better! More food options. The staff are always super friendly & helpful. Vera particularly stands out. I briefly met her once when checking in & she remembered my name and our New Year's Eve plans for the rest of our stay. I really like extra touches like this, as they truly make the Intercon our hotel-home away from home. We will continue to stay here when in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Right Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Stayphanie
Reviews.Content: Best for business trip. Great location, chic and 2 minutes from the CN Tower.

Reviews.Title: “A new year to remember”
Reviews.Author: Matisa007
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i,went to spent new years eve at Toronto. What a wonderful idea !!! The 31 first we booked at our hotel restaurant Azzure,Amazing, the ambience was great,the food was excellent and the wine was very good.We will make it a tradition for every year to come.There was a fabulous band who played jazz. Thank you at all the staff of the hotel and restaurant for working very hard to make this new years eve spectacular for us. And the 1,we went a the spa relaxing... Thank you again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angee84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for the RIS convention in December 2011. I had a wonderful stay. The service was impeccable. Everyone I encountered from the bellhop to concierge to the maids were friendly and helpful. The hotel thoughtfully provided a list for convention attendees of nearby stores like grocery stores, coffee shops, drugstores, restaurants that fulfilled our dietary requirement, etc. The room was spacious and clean. There are a number of shops around in walking distance for food or shopping. It's also not far from Yonge Street, the major shopping area. I changed hotels in the middle of my stay for another conference and after staying at the Intercontinental, the other hotel was a disappointment. Next time I'll stay here for my entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: AyGur
Reviews.Content: It was a ncie hotel - rooms neat and nice; food was great; I lover their swimming pool esp. the view from the balcony. The biggest advantage - it was so close to all the key points downtown - museums, etc. and even TTC - were were able to get our business done and go to key points of itnerest in a short period of time. They also had a free internet connection, which was very handy. Consierge and customer service desk were very helpful. The only problem I had with this hotel is their callign rates- ridiculourly overpriced if you are calling out, and we were students back then. So, we even had to use pay phones downstairs to save money on these calls; or email people and get them to call us. I think when hotels have such high prices, or any prices on incoming/outgoing calls, they should post it on their websites, so people make proper plans. It was a very special stay though, and as I mentioned above, staying downtown as such convenient locaiton helped us to quickly realize and embrace the vibrance and beauty of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby but not much else”
Reviews.Author: Rachel C
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in Toronto for a concert and decided to stay somewhere close. When I lived in Toronto, I had walked by this hotel on many occasions and thought it was beautiful so decided to book there. The parking is really difficult to manage when you opt not to have a valet park your car. Checking in was a surprise as they told us we had booked for the night before. I stated that was wrong and they were still able to accommodate us as they were not at full occupancy nor were they the night before. I asked if we could pay in cash the next day and they said certainly. The room was from the spa package so we expected something nice but not luxurious. It wasn't much better than a Travel Lodge. The sheets were ripped, few towels and dated, scratched vanity in the bathroom. Mismatched furniture... some old and scratched, some newer. VERY poor lighting. The next morning we were shocked to see the bill shoved under the door charging us for a no show AND it was pushed through on my visa! The room didn't seem clean, the staff were few and far between and having to pay almost $800 for one night?! Never again

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: businessgirl_11
Reviews.Content: Everything one would expect from a hotel is here - with the exception of prompt service (which I've experienced at other InterContinental hotels as well). The rooms are beautiful, the lobby is large and spacious, the beds are immensely comfortable, and the decor is lovely. However when calling down to the front desk for something, they either don't bother responding, or respond way too late. The fact that this has happened at other interCon locations makes me think that this isn't property specific - which doesn't look very good for the brand. Regardless, this is a good hotel, and I would recommend a stay here if you've got the cash.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for an Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat58
Reviews.Content: I would rate the hotel as just "ok", but really not in the class of other Intercontinental hotels I've stayed at. The view (looking south) is terrific, and the property is very well situated close to many downtown attractions.Rooms are large and comfortable but the furniture was badly mis-treated and in poor condition. The bathroom is average - I would expct more from this prestigious brand. The pool, spa, and fitness area are clean and well maintained - a nice winter break. There is only 1 restaurant on the property, with a fairy limited menu - good for breakfast but that's it. Frankly, the main reason we stayed there was the great pre-Christmas price. But to say that we were "blown away" by an Intercontinental, would be an injustice. In fact, a staff member even admitted to me that the Yorkville location was a far better hotel for the money. If you get a decent room rate, you're ok here. But don't expect to be in the lap of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GTA_Archer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located right downtown Toronto. Very accessible to down town destinations. Hotel was clean, and staff very friendly. We got a corner room which was very nice and bright with lots of windows. The room service breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Locations - Some things very pricey”
Reviews.Author: heatherall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Years Eve, and bought the special package. The hotel is very nice, and clean. The rooms are very nice also. We requested a room with a CN Tower view. We really could only see the base, unless you went right up to the window and cranked your head upwards. The bed is very comfortable, nice TV, fully stocked mini bar (very expensive, but mini bars always are!) The ipod docking station and Bose stereo were nice touches also. The bathroom was nice, and the robes and slippers provided were a bonus. The rooms seemed fairly sound proof. There was a bit of a late night party in the room across the hall (it was New Years after all), and we didn't hear much of it except when people were in the hall. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We upgraded our package to the "Club Intercontinental" level, which gave us access to a special lounge with complimentary non-alcoholic beverages, snacks/appetizers at certain times of day, and a continental breakfast buffet. The breakfast (as far as a continental breakfast is concerned) was very nice. Our package included valet parking, but the regular rate is $40 per night. I made 2 local phone calls from the room, and was charged $1.50 per call. I would have just used my cell phone if I had realized they charged for local calls. Wi-fi is not free either. Lots of restaurants near by to choose from. We didn't eat in the restaurant Azure, but did have a couple of cocktails in the bar. The drinks were good, and ambiance was nice, but you can find less expensive cocktails fairly close by. I do realize that hotel bars are usually a bit more expensive than other places, so we should have known! All in all, it was a great stay. We would absolutely stay again, especially for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice for a Toronto stay”
Reviews.Author: Seagreen75
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times now and it's always lived up to my expectations. It's well located in the city, staff are very friendly, rooms spacious and clean, great breakfast. Some rooms have a pretty poor view of the base of the CN Tower next door, which is a bit of a disappointment, and when it's busy, there's often a bit of a wait for the lift. It's connected to the Metro Convention Centre next door, so it's easy to avoid the winter cold weather, which is a nice bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value with a few minor detractions”
Reviews.Author: spold905
Reviews.Content: Pro: Well situated, friendly staff, clean room, good view, good value, good breakfast, good choice of free tv, comfortable beds. Con: Poor lighting, especially in bathrooms which are getting in need of makeover and fittings seem strangely high set), showers need improvement (hate running around to get wet!). Not intuitive that if parking is included in your rate you must use the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Cynd113
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental during a work trip to Toronto. I really enjoyed my stay there- the rooms are fantastic, they have a nice gym and the breakfast was great. It's also in a good locatino within Toronto. If you are going for business or pleasure, this is a great place to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking hotel but looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Guitaro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental in Nov. 2011. Here's my brief synopsis: Pros: - Nice looking hotel and foyer - Good breakfast buffet - You can get breakfast discount coupons for the buffet (I found out too late) - Good customer service credited me with 10,000 points for my less-than-stellar stay. - I only paid the Government rate thankfully, otherwise I would feel this hotel was way over-priced. Cons: - Restaurant food was not great (my hamburger was not fully cooked and the beef dip was terrible) - They did not provide the type of room I asked for - The water pressure in the bathroom was not fully working (they fixed it after I complained) - The phone in the room was noisy. They fixed it and then it became problematic again as soon as they left the room (go figure...) - Room/plumbing noise was not the best so sleeping was a challenge

Reviews.Title: “Nice but One Big Drawback”
Reviews.Author: AAS
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews of hotels when I travel for business as I typically don't choose the hotel and am only at the hotel to sleep but I wanted to share my experience at here. I only stayed one night in December. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The conceirge was very helpful in recommending restaurants within walking distance and called ahead for reservations for us. Breakfast in the morning was included in my room rate included a buffet with lots of fresh fruit and a made to order egg station as well as the usual pastries and cereals. The room was very comfortable and my corner room was very large with a separate sitting area with a large flat screen TV in addition to the flat screen by my bed. My big gripe is with the lighting. The room was dark even with all the lights on. The bathroom was the worse, the lighting was dim and just awful for applying makeup in the morning. Obviously a man designed the bathroom lighting because no woman would have signed off on that. I thought it might have just been my room but a female colleage traveling with me noted how bad the bathroom light was as well, the men traveling with us did not notice.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: KarenKitten
Reviews.Content: Soft large beds = good. Mammoth lobby and unfamiliar/indifferent staff with lineups = bad. Both door cards not working for entirely unknown reasons that mysteriously fixed themselves without any explanation after going back down to the lobby after an already exhausting day and having to meet security on the floor to prove we were who we said we were = bad. Breakfast spread = bountiful. View from the King Suites - stunning. Blackout curtains = even more stunning! Bathroom - have a useable bathtub or none at all. I'm okay with just a shower, but let's not pretend that the puny bathtub is useable by merely having it in the room. If it's just there to catch the shower water, then install a more functional and modern shower stall with solid walls and not the floaty clingy curtain thing. Very very dated. And the colour of the fake bathtub dates it too - to the late 70's. Colour and decor - not to my taste but not offensive. I will probably return here - it's marginally closer to our preferred hang out spots in Toronto then our usual favourite place, but I do miss the staff that are familiar with us and the zen buddhist look and feel of the Cosmopolitian. If only the Cosmopolitian had soft king size beds and a better breakfast spread.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Jane T
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at the InterContinental as, while I am often in Toronto, I have always stayed at the Royal York Hotel. While checking in I was told I'd been given a nice big room; this without my even requesting it...I was thrilled. Unfortunately the front desk clerk failed to mention that the room was designed to accommodate guests in wheel chairs and that the bathroom was configured very differently..very high toilet, no bathtub , and a hand-held shower area with a handle that barely fonctioned. The shower area consisted of a slight slope towards the floor drain. I made sure not to where socks or slippers for fear of getting them soaked.The restaurant was very expensive and for the most part mediocre. It is a very dark hotel, not much lighting in bar and restaurant area at night and an overall very austere setting. Needless to say I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: danewf
Reviews.Content: We checked in nov 23,2011 the front desk person was a lady by the name of Hazel.she was super went well beyond her call of duty to help us.There were 4 of us they had wrong room assigned to us,she saw it was quickly changed.thank you Hazel.The gentlemen that handle your luggage are very friendly and polite.Valet parking is truly the best your car is always ready when you are they too do it with a smile.Thank you for great stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MeghaB
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night and it was great! Location, staff and pool and hot tubs were wonderful. The room was nice and renovated and had a view of the CN tower - only downside I would say is the tub still has marks from the tub mat - but not a big deal. I would highly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: Hurls55
Reviews.Content: An well-appointed hotel in the heart of downtown Toronto. Close to everything you need to see in downtown. The staff are friendly and helpful. The one drawback was the rather expensive buffet breakfast. The food was ok. Selection was the regular fare. The room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: angela1440
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night as a package deal during the Wine & Food Expo Long line at check in moved quickly, staff was efficient and very polite and helpful Stayed in room 505 on fifth floor Room was clean but lighting was so dark you could hardly see yourself in the mirror at night Can hear toilets flushing in other rooms Nice spacious room with 2 double beds, very comfy Get to the restaurant early enough so you donâ€™t have to wait in line, buffet was great and service was good too (bacon, omelets, scrambled eggs, pancakes, potatoes, fruit, meats and cheeses, breads and cereals) Valet parking said they lost my car, so we waited 20 mins to get it in order to leave

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: TNElvis
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Toronto for business at least a dozen times over the last five years for business. In all of my travels the intercontinental on front street is the best hotel for those doing business downtown. There is nothing overly spectacular about this property. It offers a great location, the rooms are nice (not luxurious) and the staff are professional. The lobby bar is nice and offers a good place to meet for a meeting over drinks or before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Merely Masquerading as an Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: prairieboy46
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Toronto Centre, where I have stayed many times, has finally got to me. I used to stay often because it was convenient to my work there. No longer. It's as if the scales fell from my eyes last weekend. The place is not up to the Intercontinental brand - it's a Crown Plaza with a few rushed attempts to give it greater gloss. The old tawdry place is now showing through. An Executive King room looks shopworn. The heating and cooling don't work well. And to add insult to injury, they charge $9.95 for daily internet access, even to their Priority Club members. To add further insult on my last visit, the waiter at breakfast spilled orange juice on my working colleague's papers. Sloppy service, shabby appointments, with Intercontinental prices. Avoid if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Club floor corner room "amazing"”
Reviews.Author: kylemech
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto last Saturday and was upgraded to a corner room for being a priority club member, the staff was amazing from the front desk,to housekeeping ,the wonderful 2 ladies in the club room(which is on the 8th floor) however you have to book to be on that floor for the special amenities. The azure lounge was great and its all about location, location ,location. You are 1 block from Union Station and within walking distance of many more things to do. I personally reccomend Steamwhistle Brewery,CN tower,Kennsington Market and Just plain walking or sitting in a pub or cafe and people watch, one of my all time favorite hobbies when traveling. Well worth the money. Thank You to your wonderful staff Intercontinental we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Off the list”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterplus
Reviews.Content: Poor rooms, electrics not working, hapless staff and stale breakfast. Expensive and really a waste of my ambassador fee to join if the quality of intercontis is going downhill like this

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MMG807
Reviews.Content: This is a very well appointed, modern and stylish hotel situated right at the foot of the CN Tower and across the street from Union Station. I was upgraded to a room on the " Club Floor" and it was fantastic - very clean, modern, high end fittings with a fantastic window seat. Lots of nice perks - free internet, one of the best continental breakfasts I've seen, complimentary soft drinks, water etc. I would highly reccomend this location to anyone attending an event at the Metro Convention Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: VonAdams_NY
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Toronto on the Go Train and the InterContinental Toronto Centre was within walking distance from Union Station. The InterContinental is located in downtown Toronto and is accessible by foot to everything. Our suite was large, clean & a corner room which we just loved. There was a window seat in our room also. At night the view was spectacular of the city. Their breakfast buffet at Azure was very good too. We went to the CN Tower (a must), Chinatown, Kensington Market & the Steam Whistle Brewery, as well as many different shops & restaurants. The Loose Moose served up very tasty sandwiches-The Original Buffalo Chicken and Waffle Sandwich as well as a great Chicken Club House sandwich.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay was just great!”
Reviews.Author: Ravs27
Reviews.Content: Had two rooms booked for a friends bachelor party dowtown for the weekend and the hotel ocation was just great. Walking distance to Rogers Center and Hockey Hall of Fame which worked out great for us and righ off the Gardiner so we could get out of downtown without much hassle. Will definitely book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Club level = Superb!”
Reviews.Author: EvandenBosch
Reviews.Content: I remained for 5 days at the club level, the hotel is nicely located, rooms are great and especially the congierce ladies at the club level are fantastic, you can ask them anything to arrange (like nice theatre tickets with a good discount), are friendly, personal and the lounge of the club level has a nice and warm atmosphere. Alm,ost all services are perfect in this hotel, the fitness room, valet parking, the only thing wich was really dissapointing in service was the hotelbar downstairs, had a quick dinner there once (well it was suppose to be quick, I waited for over 25 minutes for a chees plate, which they served after I finished my wine) and a lunch (got the wrong food). If I would have to compare the club level of the Marriott and Intercontinental, this last one will definately win!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: kujay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location downtown. 2-3 blocks from Rogers Centre, CN Tower, Air Canada Center and the Hockey Hall of Fame. Also right there is Union Station, so you can get to pretty much any other part of the city on the subway. It's a hike to the major shopping areas on Yonge Street and Bloor Street, but if you don't mind walking a few miles, it's not a problem. The room was very nice. Clean, modern, large bank of windows overlooking downtown. It's a high-end hotel, so nothing is included. Internet is $9.95/day. The restaurant/room service is pretty pricey. Self-parking is very easy and $25/day, or you can valet for $40/day. I actually think the $25/day is something of a bargain for big cities these days. The front desk staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful. Can't ask for anything more. The only issue we had was with water temperature in the shower. Both days, even with the water on a lukewarm setting, it would spike to scalding hot temps for 20-30 seconds at a time. I assume this is an infrastructure thing that would be expensive to fix, but it's a potential liability issue if someone were to get hurt. That aside, if I'm going to a hockey game or have any business downtown, the IC Toronto Centre will continue to be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, underrated value”
Reviews.Author: WorldAdventurer_7
Reviews.Content: As Platinum PCR and IC Ambassador members, we get great treatment at IC hotels. This property was no different and a great example of why we continue our loyalty to the brand. Likes: great central location; very nice views of the downtown area and lake; club level amenities are great (happy hour and breakfast); concierge service is great for first-time visitors to the city; friendly and accommodating staff (thank you Mike at the front desk); cool pool (even though we didn't use it); late night bar atmosphere (was pleasant to close out the night). Dislikes: we got a good rate (around 175 per night), but if this is really pricey I could imagine not liking that.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Al P
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially those who plan on catching a Jays, Leafs, Raptors game as it is located within a few steps away from the Rogers Centre and Air Canada Centre. It is conveniently located and reasonable priced. It is also right beside Union Station for those of you who would rather take the train instead of your own vehicle. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. There are restaurants located in the hotel or if you would like to walk across the street there is the Loan Star and also a variety of pubs along the street.

Reviews.Title: “A great say”
Reviews.Author: mvdk
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel often when we come up to Toronto to party and see friends. Some rooms vary in size and decor. Some can be fairly outdated but nonetheless, the bathrooms are always nice and the beds are always super comfy. The pool was very nice to swim in, not too cold or too warm. The hot tub was relaxing. It is in a great spot in the city, not far to walk to the Harbour and not far to get to the Eatons Centre. Check in and out is always quick.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kajah4
Reviews.Content: Great location and up to date facilities. disappointed that pool was closed when we there.. no advance notification.The room was large and spacious and yes was a suite. The proximity to all the sights is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit just fine”
Reviews.Author: JackcookOntario
Reviews.Content: I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. Clean. Convenient. Very helpful staff. I would not recommend the restaurant connected to the hotel due to its overpriced food.I highly suggest Joe Badali's nearby. Bathroom soap products need improvement!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks!!!”
Reviews.Author: JackieB00
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Intercontinental Hotel Sept 23-24 to celebrate her 16th birthday!! I want to say thanks again to all the staff. We stayed on the club floor and everyone was amazing. Make sure you visit the pool and sauna. Even without an appointment, they managed to fit us in so my daughter could get her nails done!!There were memories from previous visits over 10 years ago and the waiter in the main restaurant recognized us and made a special dessert plate to wish my daughter happy birthday. We had such a great time, we will be back to stay for the holidays Dec 24-26.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Agnes_Pierre
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Intercontinental on Front Street while attending a conference at the Metro Convention Centre. The hotel is optimally located; it offers elegant rooms and premium amenities. I stayed on the Executive Club floor and enjoyed wonderful breakfasts, snacks, even scones and dainty sandwiches at tea time at the Club lounge. My rate also included limo service to any downtown location between 7 a.m. and 12-noon. Although not inexpensive, the hotel provided great value. A very special thanks to Stephanie at the Executive Club for going out of her way to make my stay pleasant and providing exceptionally personalized service.

Reviews.Title: “Convention hotel and thats all”
Reviews.Author: michaelj2
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel attached to the convention center which makes if very convenient if you are attending a convention, but the rooms (at least the one I stayed in) are not very well fitted and seem to be somewhat tired. No laundry bags (had to call), no water, no bathrobes and although large seemed to be characterless. Not value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: traavel74
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over the last 2 weeks for 2 seperate business trips. Unless your company is paying for your bill, I would not recommend you eat at the hotel or drink at the bar as it is quite expensive. Walk 2 blocks north to King St and you will find lots of other eating and drinking options. The rooms are clean, good beds and there is wireless in the rooms, which is essential these days. But I have found that for a 4-5 star hotel brand like the Intercontinental that the showers at this location (old tubs, low water pressure, tired shower curtains) and the general feel of the bathrooms are below standard. Time for an upgrade. Overall a typical 4 star hotel and it does have a great location in downtown Toronto if you need to be close to the convention center or the financial core.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location.”
Reviews.Author: Redraisinz
Reviews.Content: This place is SO CLOSE to the convention center, that it is just one sliding door away joined inside!!! Fantastic choice for convention attendees. Very close to Union Station, the CN Tower, etc. Building looks very outdated on the outside (think 1980s), but the interior has been renovated and is very pleasant for a business hotel. No convenience stores within the hotel, only a fancy men's wear shop (the manager and the owner there are both very helpful). Service by all staff is top class. The rooms are pumped full of a scent that I am not sure whether I like or not. It is not offensive, but it is always "there". Some small details in the room we stayed in (room 1300 - the corners, back of the door in the bathroom, etc) were tired and worn. The spa and workout facilities look like an afterthought, although the service is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: traveller_spain
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a family trip 2 nights at this hotel. The hotel is very central at a walking distance of metro, harbour and most tourist places in this city. You have to park in the convention center, which is close to the hotel. Room is big, clean and comfortable. We got one on top floor which has great views. I would choose this hotel again if I come back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “The Location is Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: Frireland2010
Reviews.Content: Who needs a cab? From the IC on Front Street, you can walk to a lot of great places: CN Tower, SkyDome, Air Canada Centre, Hockey Hall of Fame, Union Station (if you want to branch out further on a budget) and there's no shortage of watering holes and fine restaurants nearby. My wife, daughter and I got a room with two double-beds and it was spotless. The front desk was very helpful and, unlike other luxury hotels I've stayed at, had no snotty attitude. We really enjoyed the spa and pool complex. The only downside is the steam room was not working. If you have younger kids or have an attention span like one, get a room on the south side. You can watch planes land at Island airport, the Tower and SkyDome light up and watch the odd sailboat on the Lake. (If there's an Ontario snow storm, disregard previous suggestion and hit the hot tub.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kinch1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable and the staff and customer service are great. We like the location of this hotel as well - its very central to downtown Toronto attractions. We will stay there for the theatre or hockey games. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: glennifer
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel for the Nuit Blanche festivities in Toronto. The hotel is located close to the train station and is walking distance to the Theatre District, City Hall, clubs & restaurants. Subway is a couple of blocks away. Check in time was adequate, staff were friendly, lovely modern room over looking the lake. No complaints and would stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Erin M
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay, beautiful, very clean hotel, great service, very helpful staff, really great location if you are visiting Toronto and you will be doing lots of touring around downtown, very close to all downtown attractions. All the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Loved it :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location for CNTower and Hockey”
Reviews.Author: cruisr
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here and I thought the hotel was beautiful. It is close to the Lake and literally the CN Tower was right outside my window. If you are a walker you can walk to a lot of places and you are close to the subway. Only drawback is that if you get there late the only option for something to eat is the Bar Menu or room service. If you want you can find places outside the hotel though. They have a cute area at the checkin desk that is just for kids to check in. Check in for adults was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: trave1gal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel previously, and you can't beat it's location. Steps from the train station, walking distance to most things, great views. I can't say I enjoyed this room as much as the last time I stayed here. The deluxe rooms are supposed to have the Serta Perfect Sleeper beds, which I fell in love with last time. This room did not have them. Also, the sink was VERY slow draining, I almost overflowed it every time I brushed my teeth. I used the hotel gym this time, and I absolutely loved it, it is the best hotel gym I have ever seen, it had everything I needed! We also had the free breakfast buffet, which was included with our room rate, and we both thoroughly enjoyed that, they had a great selection. As always, a great stay here, I would just select a different room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BTownMiss
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a few times and always have the same great experience there. The first time was to go out for halloween in the Toronto club district and the second time was to go to a Raptors game. We just live outside the city but its nice for a little get away every once and a while. Its a classy stay in the city close to all the major areas. Both times we went we booked through a travelzoo.ca deal so we ended up with a very nice room, the only weird thing was the room overlooked the pool. We got these rooms because we booked through the travelzoo deal so you probably wont get this type of view unless you've paid a largely discounted price. We thought it was the funniest thing ever because we walked in not realising, and opened the curtains to look down and see and older man sitting in the hot tub in a speedo rather than a city view. Great laughs! The pool and spa are beautiful.. lots of windows and light shining in if its a nice day outside. It's a salt water pool so your skin feels amazing after you get out. We've never eatten at the Restaurant 'Azure' but I design menus for them during Sumerlicious and Winterlicious and have seen the amazing menu items they offer for that wine festival so I'm sure the food is just as amazing at all times of the year. Its a very upscale place, probably not where you are going to take your whole family but great for a romantic dinner for two. I would definitely reccomend this hotel to anyone coming for a stay in our wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently an Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: BaconBreath
Reviews.Content: Having done multiple stays at this hotel on business, I cannot help but pass along how incredibly accommodating, and service oriented this hotel is. It does not matter if you are a celebrity (of which there were many this past TIFF), you are treated with impeccible service, which by far is what most business travellers look for. The Azure Restaurant is the perfect meeting place. The valets will handle your clients vehicles and charge to your room for ease of meeting, and any staff member is always quick to assist with any request. Their gym is also quite state of the art, although it would be nice if washrooms were present. This said, the spa is certainly worth a visit. Location is also ideal for tourists, although still a few blocks from metro and/or financial district for business travellers. Regardless, I have my favorties in Toronto, and this is one of them.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: guybeachbum
Reviews.Content: The location of the property is within walking distance to many of the great neighborhoods of downtown (some further than others) and close to some great shopping. The rooms are decently appointed, and what you would expect from a business/conference hotel. The lobby bar is OK, but better value can be found elsewhere. The property in general is in good shape, and well-maintained. I enjoyed my stay, and would be delighted to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelvancouve
Reviews.Content: The price was wonderful with discounted package. Check in was quick and the reception was extremely nice and helpful. I forgot to ask his name but I knew that he was from BC. We checked in early morning without any problem and we got a wonderful view room. We could see the CN tower and Roger centre. The bed was comfortable and the staff was helpful. I love this hotel. Close to hop on and off buses. If I go again, I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great for business”
Reviews.Author: Single_in_MTL
Reviews.Content: very well located downtown for easy access to meetings, great amenities on site for some after work relaxation at the pool and hot tub. clean & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Conference/Event Base of Operations”
Reviews.Author: Travel_time321
Reviews.Content: This great hotel is connected directly to the Metro Toronto Convention Centre which is so convenient - makes it easy to stop back into your room between sessions to pick up supplies, check e-mails and messages in private and "refresh". The rooms are well equipped, the breakfast buffet is terrific (fresh fruit, pastries, custom omelettes, etc.), and the bar has good variety and late night food options.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bluenoser11111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Toronto Centre (Front Street) location late August for a weekend getaway. We opted for the Club floor, as it includes continental breakfast, beverages all day, appetizers in the evening, sandwiches and tea in the afternoon, computer access and concierge services. The food in the Club Lounge was very very nice - we sampled jumbo shrimp, asian appies, phyllo tarts, grilled veg, cheeses, desserts in the evening....then, breakfast included boiled eggs, cheese, yogurts, cereals, fresh fruit, danish and bagels, selection of coffee and teas, espresso, etc....unbelievable! Cocktails, wine and beer were available ($) thru an honour bar system, however, other beverages including bottled water, pop and juice were complimentary. We were thoroughly impressed by these extras provided for the price of the room and we will certainly upgrade again when we stay there in the future. The room was very nice, comfy bed, quiet, flatscreen TV, nice amenities, nice size bathroom, etc. The hotel is downtown, near many stores, restaurants, CN Tower, buses, streetcars, entertainment, etc. We also treated ourselves to a few spa treatments while there, and thoroughly enjoyed them (Aveda products). We swam in the luxurious pool while there, and felt very refreshed. They also have a jacuzzi, which was popular when we were there. All and all, a very nice stay. The staff are very professional, helpful, efficient and consistently amazing and we would highly recommend this property to others. If you are wanting to be pampered, treated well, given value for your money, then, this is the hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in downtown TO”
Reviews.Author: patjack13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontintal TO downtown the Labour Day weekend, and could not have been more pleased. The service was great by all staff, from the bell hop giving us tips on Niagara Falls, to the concierge (Margarita Noel), who handled the smallest of details for my special requests (it was a special birthday for my husband). The breakfast buffet had a wonderful selection, the rooms were ready early, and were clean and spacious. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, the massage at the spa was great, overall, a great place to stay in Toronto. It was within walking distance of many great attractions, and if you were too tired to walk, a cab ride was not very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Quiet in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: NorthWillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental Toronto Centre hotel for 5 days of business followed by 4 days of enjoyment. Upon arrival, my Ambassador membership granted me a free room upgrade without asking, and the room we received was spacious and accommodating! The room service, concierge, and front desk were excellent; the door staff was always courteous. My only adverse consideration is the bar/dining area. Good quality but over-priced and the host/wait staff is mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: crford333
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel when UFC came to Toronto in May. We booked it through a corporate package and could not have been more pleased. From the moment we pulled up to the valet parking to the minute we left it was absolutely fantastic. Check in was a breeze, and although it was a jam packed busy weekend with all the UFC fans in the city, we were upgraded to a wonderful room on the 19th floor. Views were spectacular, and staff treated us respecfully and cordially. The room was beautiful, spacious with big windows overlooking the Skydome and the CN tower. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever laid in, and I slept like a rock both nights we stayed. We used the pool and hot tub - and would definitley recommend it to everyone who stays. It was a quiet area, we thoroughly enjoyed a quiet dip and the relaxing atmosphere near the spa. We are booking our next weekend getaway in October, and would like to try the spa and restaurant next time. Thanks to everyone at the intercontinental for making our stay wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Think we'll try elsewhere next time.....”
Reviews.Author: wyattnana
Reviews.Content: Arrived a bit early for our check-in and were met with very friendly and competent valet service. Found the reservation desk and completed all the necessary documentation and checked our small bags with the concierge. We were told our 'specific room' was not ready as yet and as we secured a King suite online, perhaps they are particular as to where you are slotted. I also asked if wi-fi was included but sadly no, a different company owns that right in the hotel so we would be charged $10/night for that privilege. In this day and age, when this hotel is close to the heart of the financial district, this is just ludicrous to add this charge! If anything, the room rate should be inclusive of this and not nickle/dime the customer. For those who need it, there's a Starbucks close by where you can utilize their free wi-fi. Finally our room was ready and it was on the 11th floor - not quite the view of the lake as insinuated by the online site. However, what was evident from the moment we opened the door - was the smell. And we weren't quite sure what it was. Layout of the room was very good, bed is comfortable albeit a bit too soft, older furnishings, fairly good bathroom lighting - but a smell. Not enough to make you wrinkle your nose but enough to wonder what it was. And I really miss not being able to open a window in most of these hotels. So we turned the fan on high to see if that would help with the 'smell' and went out to explore the city. Upon returning, the smell was still evident. We didn't mention it to the front desk staff thinking it may resolve itself but it never did. What made it even worse is the fan/air conditioning vent is situated in such a way it blows on the bed - which can dry your eyes out in a noo yawk minute. So we turned it off and spent a very restless night in a stinky room. After much thought we feel the smell most closely resembled someone who smoked in this non-smoking room and it was sprayed to disguise the acrid stench. The Azure (?) bar on the first floor was empty most of the time and while there was a little combo playing when we returned from dinner, the bar was still fairly empty. Not sure why when the hotel appeared to be fairly busy. There are several interesting places to stay downtown so think we'll try elsewhere when we return next week.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pauline S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was right next to the Convention Center, and on top of it's central location, it's a great hotel. The staff are friendly and the rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. My only complaint is the ridiculous cost of the restaurant at the lobby, VERY expensive! Otherwise, this is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: pds80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in August 2011. I will say first off, that the staff was very friendly and helpful, which is always refreshing to see. The hotel lobby is very large and pretty, and the elevators were quick. The lobby has a number of places to sit and relax as well. The room was nice and spacious, with a view of the CN Tower. The tower lights up at night, for an even more impressive view. The room was quiet the entire stay, no complaints. The rooms do not have a fridge to store your beverages, only a mini-bar, with the standard outrageous prices ($4.50 for a can of coke, miniature bottle of liquor $9.00). There are also no vending machines in the hotel for snacks and drinks, as I did ask at one point. There are ice machines on each floor however. You can also enjoy a bottle of water stocked in the room, for the hefty sum of $6 if opened. You could set the temperature of your room, which was fine during the entire stay. The maid service was good as well, with towels restocked and beds made each day. There were flat-screen televisions in the room, that had a large number of channels to enjoy each day, and an alarm clock with docks for apple products that are becoming standard in hotels these days. We ordered room service for dinner one night, and it came pretty quickly. The food (cheeseburger with fries, and grilled chesse) was tasty, no complaints here, as I am already well versed in the crazy room service prices and fees. You do have to spoil yourself sometimes. The room service is 24 hours, although the menu options become more limited depending on what time of day it is. There was also a free newspaper outside the door each morning. The checkout was great and quick. The hotel puts the bill and a form under your door at night, and you just put your room number on the form, and drop it in a box downstairs. The keycards can be left in the room. The valet parking was quick and efficient, although pricey at $40 per night. I will complain however that the hotel does try to nickel and dime you to death in some respects. I did not bring my laptop, so I am not sure of the wifi charges in the rooms. However, in the 24 hour business center, it costs $3 every 10 minutes to use the computer, which you have to pay by putting your credit card into a machine, which dispenses it when you log off. In addition to this charge, it is .75 per black and white page printed out, and $2.00 per color page. I wish all hotels would just go to free wifi, and no charge for the business center (excluding printing, as it would be abused). The shower was also not consistent. The hot water would go in and out, going from very warm to extremely cold throughout your shower. I am not sure if this was just our room, or was a hotel wide issue. One tip would be to skip the Azure restaurant in the hotel for breakfast. My girlfriend and I ate here one morning, and both ordered the $16 meal eggs, bacon or sausage, with home fries meal (toast included). The meal came out to $63 for the two of us, as they charge $5 for each for a very small glass of orange juice, and the same for a small cup of coffee. The coffee did have free refills, and $5 was removed from the bill as I do not drink coffee. Sixty-three dollars for a small breakfast, come on now, it was average taste, nothing special. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk from the CN tower and Rogers center, and a couple of sightseeing tours park their buses down the block from the hotel, which have offices where you can buy tickets. The hockey hall of fame and Royal Ontario Museum are about a 10 minute walk. Overall, the intercontinental hotel is a decent place to stay, but you may want to explore more options before settling on this property.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Eve H
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, the room was very large with view of the tower and the lake, staff very freindly, they organized very good seats for the theatre at face value, tour to the falls, Breakfast is 1st class as well as room service. Coffee machine in room very good. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: Jackie M
Reviews.Content: This was combination business and family. Concerts with my son on the weekend and work at the beginning of the week. The hotel was clean and well decorated. Our room had a nice view. I'd signed up for the events package which promised valet parking and free dinner every night (I'd checked online and not seeing an events menu thought it was the theatre menu- not). They did not have the vouchers and gave me a letter which I was assured I could use for every day of our stay. It did not go well; had to argue for what I'd contracted for. Not what I'd expected from this class of hotel. I was told that I could formally complain. I shouldn't have to bother with that. Disappointing. Room warm.

Reviews.Title: “All around good stay”
Reviews.Author: BNYFMLY
Reviews.Content: Right in the Entertainment District, close to the water, about a $10 cab everywhere else. Very clean modern rooms. We did the package that gives you the breakfast buffet and a late check out. Valet was $40 but very prompt and courteous. The elevator service was worth noting. For a large hotel we never had to wait for an elevator, even with full occupancy with a convention going on. All around excellent, we woul stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: dfillos
Reviews.Content: The room was extra large with all the comforts and a huge TV with more than 50 channels. The indoor swimming pool at the spa was a bit colder than it should while the jacuzzi was very hot which made it impossible to stay inside for more than 15 minutes. The personnel at the information desk was quite helpful giving us all the directions we needed for a tour in the city. Very beautiful hotel at the south part of Toronto next to the CN Tower and very close to the harbour. On the negative side: The two false fire alarms that made the residents angry since they had to get out of their beds and down the fire escape (i felt bad for those at the 25th floor!) at 7:00 o clock in the morning and at 17:00 in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for attending a baseball game.”
Reviews.Author: lkinfl
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel beautiful, it is in the best location to go to see a Toronto Blue Jays game. It is within easy walking distance of the ball park. I have been staying at this hotel for 3 years have returned because it is, as I have said, a beautiful hotel. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Azita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and were quite happy with it overall. Location - when booking this hotel we didn't know that, but were very happy to discover that our hotel was in a perfect location. Front street where this hotel is located was full of tourists even late at night it felt safe to walk. The hotel is very close to Union Station, about 2 minutes walk. made it so easy to move about the city. It is also very close to the waterfront, with many cafes and restaurant to sit and enjoy the pleasant weather.
