The room - first we asked for a smoking room. only 4th floor has got smoking rooms and they are not nice! especially the view is not there. you just see the opposite wall from your window, or part of the in-door pool! We changed immediately to a non-smoking room. it had a beautiful view of the water, the little island and also the CN tower. Bed - was comfortable. just one day it happened that we got a bed sheet that was slightly torn in the corner. but the rest of the days this didn't happen and all was fine. We used the pool and hot tub a few times - it was so refreshing after long walks everyday. Buffet breakfast - our only bad experience was at breakfast. we were like 15 minutes in when one of the restaurant servers came and asked us if we are staying at the hotel. to which we said yes. in less than 2 minutes he returned with the check. and though there were other guests who arrived with us at the restaurant, this didn't happen to the rest. we asked the F&B manager to explain. He wanted us to believe that this was their normal procedure and if the other servers have not done it they are at fault and will be reminded to do so! And that this practice was for guest's convenience! Other than that, rest of our stay at this hotel was pleasant. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Maureen1969
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and the service was terrific. The concierage directed us to some great restaurants and the stadium was just a block away. No bedbugs:) I would park my own car next time, not sure valet was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ALASKA
Reviews.Content: We had gotten this hotel on a Priceline bid a couple of years ago and vowed to return no matter the cost. Stayed here for one night in August, 2011 for a Toronto overnight. The hotel is lovely and conveniently located in the downtown area within walking distance to many attractions, eateries and shopping. Booked the hotel direct on the website and found a good weekend rate which included breakfast. We asked for, and received, a room facing the CN tower and loved the view. The room itself was super clean and the bedding was beyond comfortable. We did not try the business center or the wireless but did spend time by the pool which was quite relaxing. There is a separate spa service for those looking for a "spa day", we are keeping that in mind for future. In the morning, we enjoyed the buffet in the restaraunt, included in our room rate and we were very impressed. Food delicious, service was friendly, professional and attentive. In fact, everyone we met at this hotel was friendly and professional. We will be back whenever our travel plans take us to or through Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but too many small problems.”
Reviews.Author: Wendy M
Reviews.Content: Every year, my boyfriend and I take a trip to a different baseball stadium to watch our favorite team. This year, we chose Toronto, and the Intercontinental seemed to be the perfect choice, mainly because of its location (a 5-minute walk to Rogers Centre). While we enjoyed our trip, the hotel certainly wasn't the highlight. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: As mentioned before, the location can't be beat. Walking distance to lots of restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. The staff at the concierge were awesome; we are in our 20s and like to go out drinking, but don't like loud clubs. The concierge recommended great places that suited our tastes and they were always very genuine and friendly. It was very quiet, not a lot of kids running around. The pool was quiet and relaxing, with friendly staff at the spa. Cons: We are from the US, so using our phones while roaming in Canada is extremely expensive...nonetheless, they refused to budge on their $9.99/day wi-fi charges. This was very frustrating to us. The very first morning, after traveling the entire day before, we were awoken at 9:00am by loud banging and sawing coming from the room above us. When we called to ask about it, it was stopped, but it was still irritating to have to deal with. After arriving back at the hotel late one night, we ordered room service, but it never arrived. Decided to just give up when my boyfriend finally just fell asleep. Not once, but twice, the fire alarm went off. The first time it was as we were getting ready to go to a fancy dinner, and I ended up having to walk down 14 flights of stairs in high heels. The second time was at 7:00am, and the alarm sounded for almost 30 minutes. The room never seemed to be able to cool down, no matter how long we had the air conditioner running. Very unpredictable water temperatures when taking a shower. I understand a few of the cons are not the hotel's fault and some are simply bad luck/timing (like the fire alarm), but we were very disappointed because they tended to overshadow the hotel's good points.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, Room, Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: myluvoftravel
Reviews.Content: This InterContinental Toronto Centre property was outstanding in all areas. The common use areas are in pristine condition and spotless. There is a Kids Zone Room right off the lobby which has all the bells and whistles today's kids are looking for. This was an ingenious thought and shows this hotel caters to all. The location of this property cannot be beat, two blocks from Union Station, the metro, a 5-7 minute walk to the CN Tower, the Convention Center and Toronto's major league team facilities. The staff were exceptional - caring, professional, and welcoming. The staff did whatever it took to ensure guest satisfaction and a memorable stay. I would like to point out what a great staff there was in the InterContinental Club Lounge. These women were gracious, hard working and a joy to talk too. This staff really went the extra effort to make my stay and other guests a wonderful one. My room which was upgraded at check-in was smartly furnished, comfortable, relaxing, and lighting was very adequate. Room space was outstanding. All furnishings were in excellent condition, bed/bedding was perfect for a great night sleep. The bathroom facilities were very adequate and with all toiletries expected of a property of this caliber. Housekeeping had done a excellent job and room cleanliness and a dust free environment were found. Plenty of towels and washcloths were available. The pool/spa/fitness center mirrored the hotel. Big, beautiful, and a very well kept part of the hotel. The pool was the right temperature and big enough to swim. A nice large hot tub was available as well. There is a large changing room with lockers to utilize. I was able to get in two spa treatments and I would highly recommend Valerie as your massage therapist. She was fantastic and solved a back problem even my doctor and physical therapist could not. The staff at the spa were exceptional, welcoming to their facilities as well and took plenty of time to explain their offerings. Room service was called and my order placed, though a bit pricey, was very good and quite filling. I will say it was one of the fastest room services I have received. Upon calling for tray pickup, there was a door knock in less than five minutes. Never once did see trays, etc. sitting out in the hallway. The InterContinental Club Lounge was a definite added plus to my stay. As I stated earlier, the staff was awesome. The food offerings were delicious, plentiful, and staff constantly kept all offerings full. The view from the lounge on the 8th floor was towards the CN Tower and the lake. A beautiful view. All the newspapers and magazine offerings were there as well as a well stocked library of books and music. Complimentary computer usage was available in the lounge. All lounge guests are able to take advantage of the car/driver within a 5 km radius of the hotel subject to availability. I would suggest a reserving a time for the car if you know you will need it services. This was a great service. Overall, this short stay was a memorable one. I would highly recommend on your next visit to Toronto staying at the InterContinental Toronto Center. You will have made a wise choice as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinjld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right by the CN Tower and Rogers Center. It is a bit of a walk to the "happening" area of Yonge street. The rooms are very nice with very comfy beds. The internet was extremely fast. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: razorweb
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is pretty good - close to all the tourist attractions and not too far from the waterfront. Concierge was extremely helpful setting up dinners and after dinner spots. Those were the highlights. Now for the lowlights. Our room was musty smelling, the beds were lumpy and the carpets and finishes were dated. The shower could not maintain a regular temperature and looked like it belonged in a 1970's Soviet bathroom. The hotel rooms need some serious renovation. There was no view from our low floor rooms. The gym was laughably small and the men's sauna was out of order. Our friend requested a non-smoking room and the room reeked of smoke. They relocated him to another room just a door down from us (why didn't they do that in the first place even though we had asked them several times at check in?). It took over an hour to get them moved over as well. To their credit, they comped us a breakfast for the trouble (which was quite good, by the way). All in all, I would not recommend this hotel to my friends visiting Toronto. It seemed a stark contrast to the new construction popping up seemingly everywhere around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, helpful and clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chanie2011
Reviews.Content: My son and I decided to detour our trip back to Montreal and take in a baseball game in Toronto. At the last minute, I went on line and booked a night at the InterContinental Hotel. This was my first time staying in down town Toronto and was a little disoriented. When I got the hotel the doorman was so sweet and helpful in directing me to parking, offering to help with our bags and just being so friendly and welcoming! Although we arrived well before check-in, my on line reservations had been processed and our room was ready. The gentleman that served us was more than willing to answer all of my 101 questions about Toronto and how to get my baseball tickets etc. He mentioned to my son that he would love his room due to the view he would have of Toronto on his first visit. The room was very clean and well tended...all was simply perfect! After our quick tour of the city, we had time to jump in the pool before our baseball game. The pool and whirlpool were clean and warm and towels were in abundance...very relaxing atmosphere! The beds were so very comfortable! When we woke up the morning paper waited outside the door and the quick check out form was ready and waiting. The next time in Toronto you can guarantee we will be staying at the InterContinental Hotel. The price was very reasonable for a 4 star down town, close to everything hotel. I have no reservations about recommending this hotel for your stay! Thank you to the staff for such a wonderful and stress free experience! P.S: I cannot comment on the room service as we did not use it, nor did I enquire about kids activities, again not required)

Reviews.Title: “everything you expect”
Reviews.Author: Clouti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you expect from a quality hotel. Excellent beds, nice sized rooms, very clean, long corridor walk ...Hotel is a near theaters, CN tower and King Street W. but a bit further from shopping at the downtown malls (Eaton center and others)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation (hot front desk staff)”
Reviews.Author: SysCorpTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite for a weekend business trip, thoroughly impressed with every aspect of the hotel. I often have to travel under a pseudonym, which for once caused no complications. Received excellent and friendly service from the blonde at the front desk (who was pretty easy on the eyes, I might add).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Cgyguy30
Reviews.Content: Great restaurant in lobby. Rooms very clean and great views. A few doorman were distant and not really friendly. Front desk staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great extras and good value!”
Reviews.Author: UrbanMomChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 10th anniversary and couldn't have been happier! Staff upgraded us to a club-level room, and we enjoyed amazing breakfasts and snacks at all hours there. Didn't get a chance to try the tea but the spread for it looked terrific, too. The hotel room was ordinary but clean and comfortable, and the gym was well-equipped. Staff made stay extremely pleasant. Good value, too!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a Trash Heap”
Reviews.Author: iramey2850
Reviews.Content: We arrived from theU.S. after a long trip only to be told that the King room my husband and I reserved months ago was not available and that we would have to take a room with two double beds. the carpet in the hallway is all torn and worn out and had a bad smell. The room had torn curtains old stained and scuffed wood furniture and beds through which you can feel the coils with your hand. What a dump. We have been looking forward to this trip for two years and now it is ruined by this crappy hotel. The front desk clerk was oh so unsympathetic and condescending to add insult to injury. Do not stay at this dump. Go stay in a NICE hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: beach_bum6d9
Reviews.Content: What can I say, it was amazing! My friends and I booked this hotel for my friendâ€™s birthday, and it was beyond beautiful! We booked 3 rooms, and we all got â€œcomplementaryâ€� upgrades when we asked nicely! To be totally honest, we did not expect that at all! My room was huge with a king size bed and a huge bathroom, with a beautiful view of the lake! Oh we got the very top floor! The sheet and towels were very clean. The hotel even ended up sending a complementary piece of chocolate cake for my friendâ€™s birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Location and ambience are tops”
Reviews.Author: USAJoetraveller
Reviews.Content: While some Intercontinental Hotels can be very pricey and beyond the reach of casual travellers, their association with Priority Club's family of hotels can sometimes provide special deals. On a recent trip to Toronto I spent a few dollars more than other well known chain hotels offered and was vastly impressed with the service and overall hospitality shown by the staff at this property. It is practically in the shadow of the very tall landmark CN Tower ( a good reference point when wandering around the city) and one block from the domed sliding roof stadium. My room was quiet and spotless and the views priceless. The breakfast buffet rivaled any hotel's and the accommodation price included use of their pool, spa. sauna. Somehow the large number of rooms and guests did not make me feel like just another "number" and everything operated extremely well from the fast check in, quick elevators and sense of all around first class treatment. Look for the deals and you could become hooked for such luxury. The location is one block form the train station and airport buses stop there, too, right on Front Street, walking distance to the Entertainment area and Queen Stree West shoppping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!, Ok Location”
Reviews.Author: Chrisfoster2011
Reviews.Content: I know i am writing this review a little late but never late than never. Stayed at this Hotel in November. When i arrived from the airport coming Barbados my best friend had checked in the room for me. The Hotel's lobby looked very upscale and the front desk personnel were very professional. Although i knew my buddy had checked in, i was unaware of the room number so in went to front desk and they called the room to verify that i was the other party. All i was thinking was oh my gosh it is 11pm and i don't want any problems with this room because i am tired and want to go to sleep. Surprisingly when i entered the room it was pretty spacious and clean with a Fantastic view of the city. The mini bar was fully stocked which had everything from Oreos to Diet Coke. Everything well arranged and room was good which i was pleased about since in the picky one and my friend could care less if it was a cave with 2 beds. The following morning i ordered in-room breakfast which i found was a tab-bit pricey but to my surprised when it arrived, it came on a fully laid out dinning table!! from Table Cloth, flowers, appetizer fork, spoon, knifes i mean i wish i took a photo of how well this table was layed out, we were both impressed because out of all the hotels I've stayed in and that was the most precised room service table ever. It felt like if i was actually in the restaurant and all the hots were hot and the colds were cold. Was diffinantly worth the price if not even more, breakfast was AAA star awards and it was just Breakfast The housekeeping staff were polite and most importantly the room was always cleaned and all my mess looked alot better when i returned. After all of this being said, the only downfall to me was the places that i wanted to go such as Eaton Center, Church Street were not the easiest walk away, but were a bit far to walk for comfort. If your going to the CN tower, then ok! but if you want to be in the dundas hub... taxi would be the best bet although the cost of the taxi does add up. Overall great accommodation, good service but location is just ok for my preference.

Reviews.Title: “Underpromised and surprised”
Reviews.Author: Mats54
Reviews.Content: Stater Witherspoon wife and son and was (via email confirmation) promised an extra bed in our room. When checking in we got the message Thatcher tjis was not possible...vajade us some inconvenience. And then the room was not ready until 5pm. We were also charged 10 dollars for the wireless Wi-Fi that didn't worked so good. Frontdesk staff was slow and not specially service minded (see above), but the concierge was great and very helpful as was the doorman who helped us with transport to the airport. The room was clean an well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: chuck24
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Priceline. We were traveling with 2 children 10 and 9. I had called and requested a room with 2 beds prior to our arrival. We arrived at 10:30 in the morning rooms were not ready and we were told a room with 2 beds was not available. The Yankees were in town and the hotel was completely booked. The hotel stored our luggage and we we went sight seeing. We arrived back at around 7 and inquired if there were any rooms available now with 2 beds. Susan, the front desk person, was excellent. She very methodically went through what appeared to be the whole hotel checking on rooms. She found one with 2 beds but it needed to be cleaned. She told us it would be available in 90 minutes. We were very happy. We went out for dinner and Susan called 45 minutes later to say our room was ready. Susan went the extra mile for us and we were grateful. The room, the pool, the fun room, every part of this hotel was excellent. We loved the location being so close to Union Station, CN Tower, Rogers Centre and many restaurants. We found the Concierge service to be very helpful and informative of all the things to do in Toronto. They told us how get around by subway and bus. They were a tremendous help to first time visitors to Toronto. The only negative was the high price of parking. I would highly recommend this hotel and stay there again if we return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Sevenoaks60
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from Club floor concierge staff resulting in successful insurance claim for an item accidentally left on an aircraft.However,management attitude was less than helpful. Overall a very pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “A Little Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: ToSquareBob1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Saturday night to attend a concert at the ACC. I would have to say the location is best feature of the hotel as it is within walking distance of the CN Tower, Rogers Center, ACC and many shops and restaurants. We arrived around 3:30 pm, and figured on checking in, and grabbing a bite to eat before the concert. Our room was not yet available, and wouldn't be for a hour or so. My Priority Club Platinum status didn't help this at all, but hey, no problem. We will park the car and go for something to eat. We were informed that we could not self park our car as the lot was full; not sure how that is possible, so we had to valet park at a cost of $ 40.00. While I am sure that is compeditive in downtown Toronto, I really prefer parking myself. This also meant we had to get our bags from the car, and couldn't walk around to find a place to eat. Again, no problem as the valet parking attendant advised us we could leave our bags with the bellman by the front desk. Get to the front desk and no one is there to take our bags; so, we go to the hotel restauarant and have our late lunch. By 4:30, the ballgame had let out, and the line up must have been an hour to check in. Luckily the guy at the concierge desk was very helpful, and able to give us our room keys saving us the long wait. Now, by 5:00'ish, we finally get to our room. I was told we were "upgraded" but I really don't see where the upgrade was; the room was quite "standard" in my opinion, which is fine, but after 1-1/2 hours to get it, I guess I may have been expecting more. Regardless, thh hotel is clean and well maintained; room was also fine, but nothing more than what you would expect in a 4-star hotel downtown. All in all, the location is probably the only thing that will bring me back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff, will return!”
Reviews.Author: indiehotel
Reviews.Content: We chose the Intercontinental in Toronto Centre for one night whilst on a trip through Ontario. There were discounted rates and it looked a good bet. We were not disappointed. We travelled from Ottawa by train and the hotel is just a few minutes walk from Union Station and is right next to the CN Tower, so you could not get more central than that. The staff gave us a very professional and helpful welcome, and we were able to get into our room despite checking in a few hours early. This was ideal as we only had the one night in the city and had to meet a local friend in reception soon after we arrived. Our room (we had a choice of city or CN Tower views) was clean and spacious, with bathrobes included - much as you would expect of an Intercontinental hotel. The only criticism I would make is that the wi-fi is not free, and you would think that a hotel chain of this size could throw this in as they probably have alot of business travellers. I have stayed in much smaller hotels in Britain and have been able to log on for free. Perhaps this is something the group could look at? We did not use the restaurant but this looked very stylish and we imagine it would have been good. We definitely want to go back to Toronto for longer so would choose this hotel again - as we prefer to travel by train this is perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location!”
Reviews.Author: needatrip11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Toronto for the U2 concert, and stayed at this hotel at the advice of a friend who has stayed here before. We were thrilled with our decision. Check in was quick and efficient, and we asked for an upgrade, and were given a room with an awesome view of the CN Tower and Rogers Centre, and the Harbourfront. The room was clean, and the bed was super comfortable. You can't beat the location of this hotel - close to all tourist attractions, and plenty of choices for meals within easy walking distance. The only suggestions for improvements in the rooms would be to not have a lock on the mini bar so you can use it to store bottled water (the ice bucket is very small). And the bathroom could use another light by the shower - it was quite dark with the curtain closed. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: ksfireman82
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a night and it was great! The experience was all around top notch. The valet parking is a bit pricey, but not out of line with other hotels in this part of Downtown Toronto. I'm a platinum Priority Club member and they check in staff was great about getting the room upgraded to a suite free of charge as is part of the platinum level. The concierge was also great in helping get some reservations setup for lunch and dinner. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant which was quite nice and we enjoyed their Prix Fixe menu for Toronto's Summerlicious. The room was wonderful and we had a great view of the CN Tower, Rogers center and the waterfront. The staff went out of their way to take care of anything we needed. I don't know if we got special treatment for being platinum members or not, but I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a high scale hotel experience in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Hills211
Reviews.Content: We were on a week long road trip and included the Intercontinental Toronto Centre as the anticipated high point of our trip. While the hotel sits atop a multi-floor, underground public parking garage, the only way to get from your parked car to the hotel is via stairways. So you cannot get a luggage cart from the hotel to your parked car. To be fair, the hotel offers valet parking, but at a very steep price, even for a downtown city hotel. Although I have traveled quite a bit, this is the first hotel with a connected parking garage that requires the use of expensive valet parking in order to get your belongings to your room. An area of the parking garage, restricted to hotel guests, with an elevator or walkway to the hotel is needed. On a more positive note, we got a couples massage at the hotel's spa, and it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel and will go back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: Briggsycat
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at this hotel when I am in Toronto on business. The staff consistently go above and beyond. Front desk staff and housekeepers are friendly and cheerful. I also choose it for personal travel. Recently a group of friends was stuck in Toronto overnight when our flight out of the Island was canceled due to fog. I called and got 2 rooms on the same floor on short notice, a sympathetic ear from the desk staff, and friendly service from everyone we encountered. We had 2 birthdays to celebrate and the staff managed to rustle up a beautiful cake to be delivered to our room on one hour's notice. Truly amazing! The rooms are always clean and well appointed. And as an ambassador member, I enjoy wonderful perks every time (room upgrade, fresh fruit, water, late checkout.). I love staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: princessfiona81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in June 2011. On my first night there was a problem with drunk people in the room next door and in the corridors. The front desk quickly moved me to a club floor room (big thanks to Rick working the night shift on 25 June who sorted things out so efficiently). If you can afford it the club floor rooms are definitely worth it as the standard rooms are looking very tired and in need of modernisation. I went on the city tour and to niagra falls which was organised through Margarita at the concierge who was extremely helpful. The location is great for visiting downtown, the harbour and the Eaton Centre (about a 15/20 minute walk).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but let concierge run the front desk ... It could do better”
Reviews.Author: mikelima
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the hotel. The check in was flawless. Reception readily agreed to my request for a late check out of 4:00pm as a courtesy to us. The concierge was extremely helpful and friendly as was the front doorman. On the day I was checking out, I checked with front desk to make sure that my late check out had indeed been flagged. The first response I got was an abrupt "late check out is 2:00pm". After I asked her to check, she then responded that I had indeed a 4:00 pm check out, but this is normally only available to Ambassador members, which I am not. We went out for the day and on return at 3:15 pm we went to our room. Both our keys were disabled! I had to go to front desk to ask for entry to our room. I was asked to show my photo ID and then told that the key did not work because I had it next to something magnetic. What a coincidence that both keys (carried by 2 different people) were de-magnetized at the same time even though it had worked perfectly for the past few days. I believe that someone did not bother to extend our access and the keys were automatically disabled at a set time for security reasons. The insensitive way the front desk handled the situation, is not that of a great hotel. A great stay with the excellent offer of a late 4:00pm check out was totally marred by the subsequent attitude of the staff who made me feel that they had done me a great favor by giving me a 4:00pm check out. The Azure restaurant was very good for breakfast and so were the staff. It takes very little effort to be empathic, pleasant and helpful. It takes even less effort to be abrupt, insensitive and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Delusions of mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: tholland55
Reviews.Content: On the positive side this hotel is in an excellent location and the foyer is impressive and the rooms are spacious and well equipped. However it is in the service and the details that the hotel falls down. As an example when we arrived in a taxi with 4 heavy bags the doorman was too busy chatting up several attractive young girls to help up into the hotel. His shoes had not been cleaned ever I suspect (I am not ex-military). Another example is at breakfast only orange juice is available rather than a choice of juices. Similarly there is a fairly poor choice of offerings at breakfast and on some days even basics such as bagels were missing. On another occasion the maid knocked on our door to turn down the bed at 9:30pm when I had just gone to sleep. Newspapers were not delivered every day. Such occurrences should not happen in a hotel that charges premium rates and has pretensions of being a 4/5 star establishment. They do also charge for wi-fi (approx$10 per day) which Holiday Inn Express give you free. On a different note forget about ever joining the Intercontinental Hotel Ambassador Program as when you arrive they seem to come up with a grade of room that is not on the IHG website to upgrade you to and to keep you away from the Club Lounge. They even then tell you this is only available to Senior Ambassadors whatever they may be.This is the 2nd time this has happened to me in the past 12 months and there will be no more repeats as they will not be getting my money again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location to take in the sites of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: aliciaispretty
Reviews.Content: I first want to commend Rick at the Front Desk for his professionalism and friendliness during our check in. He greeted us with a smile and managed to have a conversation w/us that was not invasive as well as tell us about the best of Toronto all in record time. I was not crazy about paying $40 for parking but that is what comes w/most downtown hotels. We got an upgrade to a higher floor w/excellent views of Toronto. The room was a nice size, clean and modern. The hotel's location is it's best feature in my opinion(besides the views on the higher floors). The waterfront is w/in walking distance and there was a free outdoor jazz concert just a few blocks away. There were also a couple of food trucks right outside of the hotel which was a plus for me having a son whose a picky eater not to mention it is cheaper than ordering room service. I would probably stay again at this hotel. I got an awesome deal on it so I couldn't pass it up.

Reviews.Title: “Below Typical InterContinental Service Standards”
Reviews.Author: Honestray
Reviews.Content: We had planned this great weekend. The hotel location is perfect: Walking distance to King Street theatres (the Royal Alexandra, the Princess of Wales) and good restaurants (e.g. Le Saint Tropez). Lobby was spectacular. Room was very clean. Nice welcome at check in. We enjoyed seeing cuisine people picking up fine herbs on the hotel lower level roof. We like InterContinental Hotels and stay there as often as possible in different cities. For the first time ever in over 15 years, we had service issues. We had issues with AC, with TV remote control, with motorized curtain system, with timing of room cleaning. We had to call more than once to get issues resolved. This is unusual and disappointing. All in all, we had a very good stay; however, the service issues disappointed us.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: DaviniaW
Reviews.Content: Very efficient check-in and was in room before noon (left Montreal on Porter at 10.10!). Large well appointed room, good coffee maker, huge comfy king bed and great view of CN tower and the lake. Quiet room, rapid elevators and swift helpful service. Everyone very polite and friendly. Great breakfast - buffet and cooked to order omelettes/eggs (unfortunately didn't have time) - lovely lunch, speedily served. Even got the bill without waiting! Check out equally easy and efficient. Only grouse would be $20 with tip for a single single malt ..... But will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Suberb Staff”
Reviews.Author: freerain
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in the best part of Toronto. Exceptional Staff and clean rooms. Will go again. Right next to the convention centre and Rogers centre. Many great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious hotel in the heart of a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: SagaLEB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Intercontinental Toronto Center for three days on my way to Niagara Falls from Montreal. I can summarize my experience based on the below: 1- Hotel in General It is a luxurious hotel with a really spacious lobby and a smooth welcoming atmosphere in a modern environment. You enter the hotel to a huge lobby offering all the required amenities of food and drink. you can just lounge on one of the really comfortable sofas or just order a boor at the lobby cafe. It is a big building in the shape of descending stairs, more like a pyramid without any obstructions. the entire facade throws on the city center with its wonderful high rises or on the track of Central Station. Trust me you will enjoy looking at the trains. 2- Rooms Rooms are luxurious enough and spacious. They accommodate all your expectations and hold all utilities which one might be needing for his stay. The TV is a large LCD screen, rightly placed opposite your bed, making those early breakfast morning more and more enjoyable. Bathrooms are clean and neat, with splendid showers and tubs. In short the rooms live up to the famous Intercontinental standards. 3- Service I haven't used much of the hotel services. But I can say that the staff were very welcoming and really warm. The door men are just smiley and really helpful for any direction or facility you might request of them. I was smoothly and neatly welcomed at the reception by a wonderful young lady who just facilitated my check in less than 3 minutes. Just make sure that you get the room you confirmed. I confirmed a double queen and got a single King. It took them 5 minutes to switch me back to my original choice, but hey it is a mistake non the less, but rectified quite quickly. The only thing I can;t tolerate in hotels is the paid internet access. Chains like Intercontinental, and especially business hotels like this one should really start thinking about granting free internet access. It is paid a the hotel and I would say not at all cheap. Service is another thumbs up. 4- Location If you like the vibrant and dynamic environment of a modern North American city, then this hotel is rightly places. It is in the heart of the city center 2 minutes on foot from the CN Tower and the Rogers stadium. It is also 10 minutes away on foot from all the big attraction centers of the city, and taxis are just very easy to catch on the main street just at the front entrance of the hotel. Just east, and around 2 minutes away on foot you will find Toronto Central station which connects you to all of Canada and the US. Location is 5 starts by all means 5- Price While I reckon that the hotel offers all those thumbs up on all those scales, and even if it is an Intercontinental chain, there are other choices in the city, so the CAD 380/night is really not that sustained (and that's excluding taxes). Fairmont is just a block away and offers the same exact amenities in a 5 star atmosphere for very similar prices. I recommend this hotel for Toronto visitors who would want to be at the heart but try to negotiate at least your internet accesses.

Reviews.Title: “lovely break”
Reviews.Author: joanneeaves
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night break in toronto and decided to stay at the intercontinental.At check in we asked for a cn tower view room which they were happy to do,the hotel is just round the corner from the tower and the rogers cntr! The hotel was very nice we didn`t use any of the hotels amenities but had no complaints about our stay.The intercontinental is a perfect location air canada center 5 minute walk most popular places easily accesible!The open top bus tour next to the hotel,plenty of restaurants and an irish bar across the road.We loved the city but found it very expensive so take plenty of money!We went to canoe restaurant a brilliant restaurant 1st class service,perfect food views we`re brilliant if you are wanting to splurge for a birthday,anniversary you will not be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “First time at this Intercon, hopefully not the last”
Reviews.Author: ElectricalTraveller
Reviews.Content: I was here for a work conference, but brought my family (including small child). All service was top-notch from valet parking to check-in, to bags being brought to room. The room was spacious with a good work area and nice view. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom well stocked. The pool was clean and nice temperature, and the little waterfall is a nice touch. Hot tub is good and hot. Great experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gary1954
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything it stated in its website. The rooms to the spa and people who work there were very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic, and I would be back again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, efficient and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Heather086
Reviews.Content: We arrived at check-in just after 2 buses had disgorged arriving hotel guests. The check-in line stretched almost entirely across the lobby, so we decided to have a drink at the bar before checking in. We could watch the check-in process from the bar, and were very impressed with how quickly the reception desk staff processed everyone. The line was gone after probably less than 15 minutes. Our own check-in experience was fast and efficient, as were the elevators, the restaurant and bar and the check-out process. The bed was very comfortable and the room quiet. The buffet breakfast included with our package was one of the best buffets we've encountered in a while (we usually turn up our noses at buffets but we enjoyed this one). The hotel is large and not particularly charming, but the staff was friendly and helpful. The self-park and valet are both convenient and easy parking options. This was our second stay here, and we'll definitely be back. Our only complaint is the charge for a wireless connection. Really, these days, wireless should be included.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel, lacking a little character, very strong on service”
Reviews.Author: AZandDZ
Reviews.Content: Tied to the metro convention centre it does feel a bit like a concrete office block turned into a hotel but the staff are extremely welcoming and take good care; food is good and it's a good base for business of leisure in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “WOW "Just can not belive a Hotel Guest room to die for"”
Reviews.Author: David155003
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel for Business the rooms well appointed, clean, smell fresh, lovely beddings, nicely presented. Getting off the Elevator the clean look and into room the wow is wow. Certainly the best in the city of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spiked579
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, friendly staff, great location in core.

Reviews.Title: “A Luxurious Hotel in the Heart of Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Rebuilder
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Hotel is nestled in the heart of downtown Toronto, a stoneâ€™s throw away from the Air Canada Centre, Rogers Centre and the CN tower. It is a luxurious hotel with finely appointed rooms and all the amenities. We enjoyed the fitness centre at the hotel. It was impressive to see the CN tower while swimming in the indoor pool during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMom0
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Staff was fine. Not overly gracious, but pleasant enough. Room was wonderful and quiet. Modern updates, large flat screen, large vanity in the bathroom and very comfy bed. Connected to the convention center, which made it very convenient for me considering that's where my show was. Starbucks is a block away and a small convenience-type store is next to the hotel for drinks and snacks. I walked everywhere from this hotel...Rogers Centre where the Blue Jays play, CN Tower, Union Station. 20+ minute walk to Eaton Centre and Chinatown, but an enjoyable walk, especially in nice weather. Very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, OK Staff and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveller2011
Reviews.Content: I WOULD RATE 3.5 if option available! This hotel is more for business and conference travelers, however, for price, can find better accommodations. I travel to Toronto often and the city offers a wide selection of hotels. Most hotels stay in Toronto are very friendly and accommodating. I think this is a good hotel, but rooms and service not on par with other Intercontinental hotels, We had an issue with our room service food one evening, as it was not to our dietary request that they said they would accommodate.. When brought to there attention, they were somewhat dismissive, and at first offered nothing to rectify the situation. Finally they offered free breakfast for 1 person, while traveling with wife, how does this make sense?, sort of a slap in the face! The rooms are nice as we had a junior suite which was quite large for a JS. I find it uncomfortable being in a hotel were the service is mediocre as a luxury traveler, as a hotel is as good as its Service. I am not knocking the hotel, but for the average price charged per night there are other options that are more accomodating to the guest, rather than being there just because they are being paid to be there. If you are coming for a conference at the convention centre then it is good. If you are staying fo other reasons then check out some of the other hotes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic service and beds that are to die for!”
Reviews.Author: Llamster
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying here! The staff is accommodating and friendly, the club level is really great and the beds were so, so comfortable- will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Little value for money but great staff”
Reviews.Author: brianadcheryl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a combo of work and play. Beautiful lobby and restaurant, but room was cramped and average. Lots of rain in Toronto while we visited making us tempted to eat at AZURE but after one very overpriced meal, we decided to get wet and walk the neighbourhood for food. The best part of the hotel was the staff, all very smiley and helpful. But no wifi in room, business center was expensive to use and the room's bathroom needed some things fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel rooms, OK staff”
Reviews.Author: letsmakeadeal
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at this hotel. The room was really nice. The bed was great as was the shower. High speed internet worked well. (For me, these are the holy trinity of hotel features). The gym and location come next but I didn't use the gym so can't comment on it. The location was a little out of the way. I arrived in the mid-afternoon and had not had lunch. I went to the lobby restaurant/bar and asked if they had anything on the menu that didn't have bread or flour. The hostess kind of flippantly told me, I'm sure there are lots of things on the menu. No effort to help. I sat down, read the menu, and there was precious little with protein that didn't have bread/flour (sandwiches, burgers, a pasta dish) and nothing on there I actually wanted to eat. I got up and gave her the menu back and told her that I couldn't find anything on the menu that worked. Rather than say, let me take a look and see if I can find some option, or even better, let me go back and talk to the chef, she just looked a little miffed. I went across the street and had some sushi. So, no big deal, and she wasn't rude or difficult, just not helpful or proactive. One other comment that probably is general rather than specific to this hotel. I'm a Platinum on Priority Club but don't tend to stay in too many Intercontinentals. This hotel (and maybe all ICs) don't provide any special amenities, AFAIK, to Platinums. You need to purchase an $200 Ambassador package, which I haven't done -- I did it one year but didn't get the amenities that would have made it worthwhile so dropped it. My status on the website says Platinum Ambassador, but as far as I can tell that is of no value.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY”
Reviews.Author: DANISA74
Reviews.Content: I stayed over Easter weekend and was travelling with my husband, a 6 year old and a 3 year old. We booked because the Intercontinental had a fantastic Easter package and a ton to do for people with children. The check in was quick and efficient, the kids had their own check in area and received a great bag with a coloring book, crayons and toys.. that kept them entertained for a while:) The rooms are beautiful, bright, the club lounge a great place to relax and enjoy breakfast, afternoon tea and evening snacks. A kids room available with WII, tv's, slides, bowling, golf etc. The kids loved this room. The best part was that the kids were able to spend some time in the Pastry kitchen of the hotel to decorate cookies, they received chef's hats and a certificate. I must say I was very impressed with the hotel and without a doubt would go back in a heart beat. Oh and if you have time check out the pool and SPA - I had the most amazing 1 hour massage ever.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at First Rate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: linacre76
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at this hotel over the Easter Weekend taking advantage of the special which included room/valet parking/breakfast. Service was attentive and friendly from the time we got out the car on arrival to our departure. Our room was immaculate and well appointed. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Looking forward to our next visit to Toronto and a return visit to the IC Toronto Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 disguised as an Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
Reviews.Content: Rooms are barely upgraded Motel 6 quality. Big convention hotel (the crowd shows it). Checked in late one night- claimed to have only smoking rooms left (smoking rooms still exist in the first world in 2011 ??)- after i showed my itinerary confirming a non-smoking room (with some firmness on my part), a smoking room mysteriously became available. But only with two double beds (what business traveler wants two double beds?). Definitely would not stay here again if I can avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staycation/getaway”
Reviews.Author: meghanleen1981
Reviews.Content: We took a 24-hour getaway to this hotel even though we just live in Mississauga. We took advantage of the Easter package which included the room, breakfast for 2 adults and 2 kids, valet parking, and some other stuff for kids we didn't take advantage of since it was just the two of us. It was $199 + tax - which considering valet would have been $40 and the breakfast buffet is $26/person is pretty great. We enjoyed the pool all afternoon and even ordered lunch while sitting in our lounge chairs. The environment is very spa-like, so even though we were just hanging out, with the waterfall and the spa music, it was very relaxing! Plus the staff were very helpful. Our Jr. 1-bedroom suite was well, sweet! King bed was super-comfy, and the 2 TVs were amazing HD quality. Bathroom was traditional marble, but had great toiletries, and quality hairdryer, and a great little Keurig coffee maker. Not to mention how nice it is to have a bathrobe provided! We were on the 13th floor (#1337) and the view of the CN Tower, Rogers Centre and over towards the Island airport was great. Gorgeous big windows and the curtains on tracks behind the crown mouldings were gorgeous. Buffet breakfast was amazing, lots of different choices, and incredible service. A lovely spot to relax, read the paper and just enjoy. All in all, a great getaway for hubby and I, and we'll definitely look for deals there again if we're wanting to do the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “An amusing time”
Reviews.Author: straight08
Reviews.Content: My son was on spring break from college and we decided to take him Toronto. We picked this hotel because of reviews and the closeness to everything in City Centre. We arrived at the hotel around 7:30 Pm. Right around 11:00 Pm the Fire alarn went off, with an anouncement that they were investigating it, this went on for 10 to 15 minutes. My husband and I were on the 7th floor and my son was on the 20th there is 25 floors.Then the anouncement was( it is on your floor please exit building). I exited in my pajamas and my husband was dressed. Once we got out to the street there were many people dressed for bedtime. The firemen were there and after about 15 minutes we were able to go back in. The firemen said it was a false alarm. During our stay of 4 days a few employees said that that happens occasionaly so be prepared for that experience. The room was clean and nice. All of the staff we enteracted with were friendly. We did not eat at the restuarant. There are so many places to choose from to eat in the city that are walking distance.We did drink at the bar. The bar has 2 TVs and a friendly staff. The drinks are comparable in price to any hotel bar. The maid staff did not always replenish the coffee I took a drink out of mini bar and it was not replaced either. The pool was nice it is a saline pool, the steam room are male or female. I did not get to use the steam room with my husband. They have a spa I got my nails done I was pleased. their exercise room is open 24 hours. You can walk almost all the way to CN tower indoors. Our experience at The Intercontental Hotel City Centre was good. If you plan to fly there and you have three or more people get a taxi the taxi cost 55.00 and the airport shuttle is 19.95 per person . We had a great time in Toronto and would love to go there again. The weather was cold and it rained alot but we were busy the whole time there so many things to see and do there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: junebug1984
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the center of downtown so the location is great. The pool is salt water which I loved and the hot tub was a good size. Parking is 25 per night and its underground. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and beds are very comfortable. You can ask for a room with a view of the CN Tower which on the lake side. This hotel is pricey but I thought it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable hotel bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: trave1gal
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel while in Toronto for the Yoga Conference. It was extremely convenient staying in the hotel attached to the conference centre, but I wasn't expecting such a great room. I booked a King Junior Suite, and it was a beautiful room! A wall of windows looking out at the lake, lots of room, and clean. The bathroom could use a little updating, but the bed was perfect. I have stayed in a lot of hotels, and this was the best hotel bed ever. I want one! The bedding was great too. The room was unbelievably quiet for such a big hotel. The staff was all very friendly and accommodating. It was a very easy walk to and from the train station, and convenient to everywhere I needed to go. I will definitely stay here again. Thanks for a great visit!

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: MrWonderfulToronto
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean and reasonably sized, has new building feel and lovely lobby. Connected to Metro Convention Center. Bad news: Beware of restaurant. Their signature Parmesan & Truffle fries are made with Frozen potatoes. They obviously don't care. Good news: There are 100s of better ones within a 10 minute ride. This hotel is clearly better than the Sheraton, The Hilton and the dumpy Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Mungo888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights during a conference in march. As such location was 100% perfect as I did not have to go out in the minus 10c climate to get to my meetings. Room was a good 4 star in my opinion, bathroom a poor 4 star - but adequate. Clean throughout. But certainly not 5star. Breakfast (included) was excellent and service at the hotel (which was 100% booked and as such stretched) very good.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Experience You Could Ask For!!”
Reviews.Author: Snufflebubble
Reviews.Content: On February 4th, we stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel in Toronto. That evening, my boyfriend (now fiance) took me to the CN Tower (about a 5 minute walk, indoor) and proposed. When we came back we were looking for some ideas as to what to do on such an exciting evening, not only did they provide us with a map and several excellent choices, they also sent champagne and some desserts up to our room with the words "Congratulations" written on the plate in chocolate sauce! Throughout our stay the staff of the hotel was incredibly helpful. Plus there was the added bonus of the luxurious hotel room, amazing salt water pool and spa, and the BEST continental breakfast I have ever had. I would stay here again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: coleco76
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and it was great. Took the GO Train from Burlington and the hotel is next door to Union Station. Check in was breeze on Saturday afternoon for 1 night. I had selected the Luxury Weekend Package with breakfast & Superior room and was upgraded to a deluxe room corner room on the top floor - nice touch. When we unlocked the door to the room (2500) my wife & I were startled when I heard a voice in room but it was just an employee announcing his presence and was just finishing up filling the mini-bar. Minor hiccup to a wonderful stay. Did not have time to use the amenities so I cannot comment on the facilities now, however on my last visit the hotel Pool was refreshing. The hotel is in the middle of the Entertainment district and allowed us to walk to where we wanted to visit (Queen Street, Rogers Centre, Real Sports, Scotiabank Theatre) and we took the subway from Union Station to places that weren't walkable. The Breakfast Buffet was $26 each but since we were given vouches at check-in there was no charge. The buffet was your typical buffet: eggs, bacon, waffles, fruit, muffins, toast. Next time I need a hotel in Toronto this will be the place.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience planning for a group stay”
Reviews.Author: Gail258
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel through on-line bidding for 7 rooms which worked very well. The bidding experience was very positive. The staff were professional and responsive to my inquiries. The hotel amenities were excellent with great city views on the higher floors. The group all enjoyed the stay at this hotel. Good access to the Rogers Centre and a major shopping centre is not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: atcboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a couple of days at the IC Toronto Centre. Hotel lobby is quite nice with a small front desk area. Parking is on the side of the hotel not at the front (coincidentally Front St.) Check in was very smooth (thank you Mike) and checkout as well (Jacqueline). This is the most genuine caring staff that I have come across in a while. I have never been asked if I was happy/satisfied so much. Good job. We had a Junior suite with club access room 900. Room was nice with a view of Lake Ontario, Rogers Centre, and CN Tower. The only downside of southern exposure was the railway tracks. This however was not a big problem as I love trains......the wife......not so much. The club lounge was very nice. Soft drinks all day, afternoon tea as well as evening hot and cold munchies and honour bar. Location adjoining convention centre, Next to train station, and Rogers Centre, and Air Canada Centre. Excellent location for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Invasion of privacy ! Luggage "rifled through".....avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussienando
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week in December and after staying for 4 nights, I returned to my room around 10pm only to find a man trying to enter my room. When I asked him what he was doing he said he was security and they didn't know whose room it was. Well, after being in the same room for 4 nights, the answer should have been obvious. Upon finally getting into my room (around 20mins later) I found that my luggage had been rifled through with underwear displaced. Very, very unsettling and "creepy". The following day I checked out and requested an explanation. Although given Lisa Elliott's (Guest Services Manager) business card and assurance she would "explain" what really took place, it is now 2 months later and I'm yet to hear. Will not stay here again (the Hilton is fantastic but was booked for this trip).

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: WT123
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel 3 weeks in advance, stayed here numerous times, top priority club member. Plane was late by several hours, so arrived at hotel at 2:30 in the morning. Gave my name and they said they need to get the manager, she came out and informed me they had no rooms available! In my 40 years of traveling around the world I have never had that happen, they confirmed I had a reservation but they had rented out my room!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: ErnieScar
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here for a trade show and the location couldn't be better. The rooms were somewhat dated and the tub in the room looked both old and dirty. The staff were excellent from the front desk through to the servers in the bar. Prices in the restaurant and bar were outrageous but what do you expect at a downtown Toronto hotel? Walk across the street and pay half as much for better food. Overall, I would stay there again but don't expect any "wow" factor with the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: Capriscorpio
Reviews.Content: As the name of the hotel suggests "Toronto Centre" it truly can not get any more central then this. We were right in the middle of everything we wanted to do. It was freezing cold during our trip but we still were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go since it was so close. We went to the Air Canada Center which was about 7-10 minute walk. The CN Tower was literally right in the back yard 1 minute walk Eaton Center for shopping was a 20 minute walk, we cabbed home though since we shopped longer then planned, a cab was less then $10. Hockey Hall of Fame 7-10 minute walk We flew with Porter and their free shuttle from the airport dropped us off about a block and a half away and we walked back to the shuttle stop to take us back to the airport on the way home as well. We never ate at the hotel because it was very expensive and there were so many restaurants right outside the hotel. Everything there seemed overpriced as far as food went. Room was average, we just had a regular room and based on just the room it was a little pricey however for us the location was worth the extra cost as it saved us on transportation. We also had a beautiful view of the CN tower which had a very pretty light show in the evening. The beds were a bit small but comfortable. The shower was not great and could use some more pressure. Service was excellent and there was always someone to greet you when you came and went as well as open the front door for you or assist with any bags. We certainly plan to stay here next time we are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and super service”
Reviews.Author: MakingContrails
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a business trip that included attending a conference at the Metro Toronto Convention Center. The service was excellent, from check in to check out, every employee was attentive and professional. I asked for and was given a deluxe king room that faced the CN Tower with sweeping views. The room was an interesting shape, at a bit of an angle with corner-style windows, so my view was amazing. The room layout was very functional, and the furniture was modern with a flat screen TV, chair and work desk. The bathroom was large and elegant. The gym was not huge but had a variety of modern equipment including ellipticals, treadmills, and a few weights. The concierge desk had some excellent dinner recommendations and he even asked how we enjoyed his recommendations when returning to the hotel. The restaurant in the hotel was pricey, three of us ate the breakfast buffet one morning and the bill was over $100 after tip. I think there are too many restaurants in the immediate area to settle for this restaurant unless you really did not want to go anywhere outside. I would highly recommend Real Sports Bar which is next to the Air Canada Centre, just about a 5-10 minute walk away. Great food, a two story HDTV, and a lively atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: in31
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel for business travel in Toronto, with everything one needs when visiting on business. Great breakfast and great winter rates.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more.”
Reviews.Author: probate1
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel, perfectly located (for my purposes) close to the train station and the Glenn Gould bench statue. The hotel was busy during my stay due to the Toronto Film Festival. Even so, the staff was gracious, friendly and helpful. One tip: I called the hotel directly to get my reservation and found that the room charge was about $100 less than any of the travel web sites "deals". Also, because I had dealt directly with the hotel, my room was upgraded on arrival and I had a gorgeous view of the sun setting over the city. Absolutely perfect in every way.. I am now booking more often at the IC in other cities because of the comfort and staffing at the IC in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental as I remembered 15 years ago”
Reviews.Author: thefoureyedpanda
Reviews.Content: If you stayed in an Intercontinental in the 90s, this place will not surprise you. It is a bit dated but well maintained and service is quite good. I had a potentially very good room, with lots of windows, flat TV but it was quite clearly a smoking room converted to non-smoking, which was not what I requested. It may be that the smell came from something else.This spoiled the two day stay. Were it not the fact that I was on a very tight schedule, I would have asked to change rooms and most likely a better review would be merited.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a great location with a filty hot tub”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlier1
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great spot not far from the subway and Go Trains. Just across the street (to the east) is a indoor path that leads to the subway etc which is great in the cold weather. The parking is very expensive ($40/night) but a 4-5 minute walk will take you to the Green P parking which ran us about $25/night. Our only complaint was the hot tub which had a brown bubbles floating in it and the sides of had the same brown greasy substance on it (easily rubbed off). It was in this condition both nights of our stay so clearly no one was checking it - not acceptable at this level of hotel! The pool on the other hand looked clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Jesse_1972_10
Reviews.Content: Front Desk Staff not very happy. Customer Service and friendliness has really declined. My last 4 Stays here have been fine but there staff just don't care. My latest room was very clean. (I'm allergic to dust and feathers) The ones before where very dusty and dirty. The staff say if there is anything we can do just ask. I've stopped asking because they only do the minimal that is required. I stay here only because it's close to what I need and the price is cheap.

Reviews.Title: “First Class and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: amandanicole1
Reviews.Content: Top notch property in ideal location whether for business or leisure travel. Close to all amenities that Toronto has to offer. Rooms were newly renovated, beds were comfortable, flat screen TV, service was inpeccable and breakfast buffet was plentiful. Will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but expensive add-ons”
Reviews.Author: PIgirl2010
Reviews.Content: I attended a 3-day conference at the convention centre next door and it was SO nice to have to walk only a few seconds (all indoor) to my hotel room. The hotel lobby is lovely, and the front desk staff were efficient and professional. The hallways are a little shabby - carpeting needs to be replaced, but my room was nicely appointed. The queen beds were well used and sagging in the middle, so I don't imagine they would have been very comfortable for two people. I like thin pillows so I was disappointed that the only pillows were huge, puffy things. I was very impressed with the doormen - mostly young-ish, uniformed men who couldn't get the door open fast enough - and I'm not even hot! My only real criticism was with the hotel dining room. I went there for breakfast and was shocked that a glass of fresh-squeezed orange juice ($7), two pieces of cold toast, 2 eggs and 2 very tough strips of bacon came to $25.99 with the tax - for ONE person! Breakfast aside, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience that surpassed all expectations”
Reviews.Author: rickb-ct
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a weekend at the Intercontinental and it was an incredible experience. Their staff went way above and beyond to make our stay a pleasant one. the conceairge bent over backwards getting us show tickets, the on site restaurant was first class, and our room was impeccable. Its a great location, we were able to walk to Second City and plenty of great restaurants and sights nearby - so there was no need to drive anywhere. Exercise facility was well equipped and the pool is stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- view of CN tower and skydome”
Reviews.Author: Point30
Reviews.Content: Checkin: Good experience- friendly staff. Issue: The only issue I have here is that I did not want to use valet parking. They would not let me use one of their 'carts' to transport our 4 days worth of luggage up to my room. As a result I had to lug this up all by myself, taking a couple of trips with my family. Regardless.....really there should be some available for those not wanting to use valet or bellmen services. Room: We were given 2 choices for a room......the first renovated looking onto the city, the other un-renovated- looking onto the CN tower. We chose the undecorated looking onto the CN tower- on the 19th floor. I thought the room was still very nice, perhaps some dust, but in general was clean and comfortable. There was a stocked bar fridge that we wish was empty to put some of our food in. The front desk said it was permissible to take the bottles out and use it- which was nice- however, I was a little stressed that they might charge us for something we never drank since the fridge seal was broken. The view: Absolutely amazing......the most amazing room that i've had during my stays in Toronto- looking directly to the CN tower and Skydome. Surreal. The location: Again great- very close to union station and therefore connected with every part of the city. The pool and hot tub: Salt water and relaxing......we enjoyed it with our children for the 3 nights we were there. Sleep quality: Good......except for our last night when we had teenagers or young adults screaming and running up and down the hallways both in the evening and then again in the early morning. I thought it would stop......it didn't- in retrospect I should have called front desk at first suspicion. I would recommend this hotel for other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Experience with a WOW”
Reviews.Author: Josiecan007
Reviews.Content: From checking in to checking out it was all easy and convenient. Staff was accommodating and friendly at all times. The Spa experience was truly splendid and the staff extremely professional. We enjoyed resting on the most comfortable mattresses ever...and the room was spotless and had all the amenities we needed. The staff WOWed us by leaving a bottle of champagne and cake in our room in honour of our anniversary. On the couple of occasions that we called for room service our request was acted on immediately. Location is great....we were walking distance to tons of restaurants and night time entertainment. My only regret is that we waited for our 11th year anniversary to experience the magic of Intercontinental Toronto Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing stay”
Reviews.Author: likemycomfort
Reviews.Content: Bought the breakfast package. brunch for 2 - could not order two extra brunch on-line for the kids. (Lucky in the end). Underground parking is actually in the Convention Centre not the hotel per say. Cost $23 day. $40+ for valet parking. Only two people on check in, so long line ups. Room was very clean, bed was AWFUL, you could see the lumpy mattress through the bed covers. It was not a restful or comfortable sleep. Our package also indicated robes and slippers, there was one bathrobe between 4, no slippers. I had thought the kids would enjoy this perk... in the end none of us did. The pool on the hotel website is nothing like what we saw, I have seen better at much lower valued hotels so this was very disappointing. Kids decided not to even bother using it. It was not as close as we hoped to what we wanted to do, other hotels would have been better for us. The brunch was pitiful, absolutely NOT WORTH $25 per person. Hot food was luke warm, not nearly enough choice for the money, fresh fruit bar was average as was the choice of two fibre cereals and danish/croissant/muffin stand. The waiter was OK but nothing to make you feel you'd been well looked after. Our package also included free wi-fi but we were charged for this on the bill, not once, but twice, fee for each child's laptop. This has since been refunded. Thing most people at the hotel seemed bugged by was the "ELEVATOR VOICE", who repeated at every floor that we were going up or down...duh!! In short, the hotel was OK for a night, have stayed at better for less $$ and better service and definitely a better sleep so we would not pay a repeat visit here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: Yegob
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel. I arrived early and requested a lake view, which was provided. I spent an incredible 3 hours at the Spa/Pool. The salt water pool is amazing, the massage was great (Tiffany, you are the best) the ambiance at the pool was so soothing with the soft music and sound of the waterfall.....totally relaxing. The front desk staff were wonderful too, especially Mike. I had one little problem with the TV, maintenance fixed it within minutes. Wow! I can't wait to come back to this hotel with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Selfish employees”
Reviews.Author: Macintosh868
Reviews.Content: Terrible stay. Stayed for 3 nights and wish I would have stayed somewhere else. For $825 I could have gotten a much better hotel. When I unloaded my bags from a cab, the door man was helping a drunk, well dressed couple out of the doorway, (I had some huge bags by the way), but let the door shut in my face and asked them if he could flag them a taxi, even after eye contact! I guess he was asking for a good tip. Then I asked for help at the front desk, and some little blonde haired girl working was the most un-knowledgeable person I've ever met. Room was okay, view was great. No microwave, locked refrigerator (REALLY? I JUST PAID $825!). One of the treadmills didn't work either. Almost forgot, my room is close to the elevator, and you can here it all day and all night. Congrats on taking my money, I will never come back. Everyone else I talk to who is visiting Toronto, will also be informed of how shittty your SERVICE is.

Reviews.Title: “SIR, WE ARE TOO BIG TO BE CRITICIZED!"”
Reviews.Author: mirsar
Reviews.Content: I had to spend a Sunday evening at the downtown Toronto Intercontinental before a Monday morning business meeting. As I drove up to the hotel there was absolutely no indication how I should find the underground entrance! After I finally figured out how to enter the hotel, I had to wait in line for at least 10 minutes (6:00 p.m. Sunday) before the single person working the front desk was able to take care of me and send me to my C$200 per night room. The rooms have been refurbished from the 1970s with bathroom fittings also from the same era! A medium sized Evian bottle in the room was charged at C$6 while all-day parking goes for C$40/day and breakfast at C$26.00. And all this for mediocre, impersonal, out-of-date facilities and services. When I ..........dared voice criticism about all this, the front desk manager's response was: "Sir, we are too big an organization for you to critiseze us!"; in other words, why don't I go..........fishing, please! To add insult to injury, I am also a Priority member of the hotel! Next time I'll try a Motel 6!!!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of dissapointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Asta72
Reviews.Content: Location/hotel If you are in town for either a conference or want to take advantege of all the restaurants/musicals that King Street has to offer itÂ´s a great location. If however youÂ´re looking for shopping and nice pedestrian walkways youÂ´re much better off up in Yorkville. Also, they charge a lot for internet!!! At this day and age that should simply be free! Especially considering that internet used to be free at this hotel... Room: We were first checked in to a one bedroom suite. Please do take note that they are located right next to the elevatorshaft (what on eart were they thinking???) and unless theyhave upgraded their elevator system stay clear! It truly sounded as if we were inside some Disneyland pirateship, thatÂ´s how bad the creaking and rattling were... We then moved to a bi-level suite which has a lovely layout. The only problem was that it was roasting in the room when we got there! Ok, so they swtiched on the air-con which is when we understood why it had been off....Now we got the epxerience of sitting in an airturbine instead. Rather desperate at this pint since we travel with a small child and came all the way from Europe the Front Desk manager (very good btw!) now put us in suite 1020. Ah what a difference! Very spacious and comfortable!!! Staff: Very un-even. We had a very poor check-in, housekeeping seem to answer to no-one and restaurant staff left a lot to be desired. But on the other hand, the staff at Club level were very good, the FD-manager very pleasant. Food: Not particularily exciting or fresh. We even had a meal that was so bad that we didnÂ´t have to pay. Nice space though, but beware if youÂ´re trying to eat while they have a small band playing. The soundlevels are ridicously high! Breakfast is just average. To think about: Please do consider why you are in town as the location of your hotel really matters! If youÂ´re in Toronto to be in the convention center the Intercon is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but the Spa was extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: Brushdaily
Reviews.Content: I live in the GTA but had the opportunity to stay downtown a couple of nights. The hotel was great overall; staff were very courteous and attentive. The concierge were key in helping us make the most of our 2 days / 2 nights in the heart of Toronto. But is was my experience at the Spa, a one hour massage, after soothing soak in the salt water hot tub were the best two hours of my entire week-end! I went back for a pedicure the next day because I loved the environment. The Spa is beautiful; filled with natural sunlight, serene ambiance music and the ever present scent of eucalyptus; very knowledgeable & pleasant staff. I live in the GTA, so I may not need to stay downtown again anytime soon, but I will definitely be back to enjoy the Spa again soon!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made my pregnant wife, child and I sleep in a conference room and damaged my valuable personal property.”
Reviews.Author: Gramani
Reviews.Content: Here is what happened: 1. We booked a double occupancy room because we travel with our toddler who is two years old and needs a bed. My wife was also 7 months pregnant. 2. We requested a late check-in, with an approximate arrival of 1 am. 3. We received no communication by phone or email that the hotel was overbooked and that there was no room for us prior to our arrival. 4. On arrival, at approximately 130 am, the front desk employee immediately left to go into the back room, presumably to speak with the manager about our reservation. When she returned a few minutes later, we were told by the front desk that unfortunately there were no more double occupancy rooms to fulfill our reservation, but that we were being given an extra large room with a King Sized bed and that it was a great alternative. 5. Upon arriving in the room, we saw a tiny Murphy bed that was pulled down in the middle of a conference room as our "King Sized bed in an extra large hospitality suite". There was no room for the three of us, and we were obviously going to have a very uncomfortable night. Many of the options offered as standard on our reservation where not present in the room we were ultimately given. 6. On calling the manager we were offered a 25% discount as compensation and told that "guests always stay in this room".
