We were also assured we would be given a complimentary breakfast for the 3 of us, something that frankly was included in our reservation anyway and wasn't actually a concession. We were also offered a cot for our toddler and told that as a concession it would be free of charge instead of being a charge of $25. This was laughable because these 'concessions' did not bring us near to the level of experience that we had booked and paid for. 7. At this point, I started getting worried about the suit I had deposited for safekeeping with the hotel staff earlier in the week. I left if with the hotel because I was going on a trip and was returning and staying at the hotel later in the week. I had originally planned to pick it up in the morning, but decided to immediately go downstairs to retrieve it. I received it back and it had been significantly and permanently damaged on the front right portion and left breast of the jacket. My wife and I sat in the room and examined the damage for some time, in total shock. I called down and was told by the night manager, who had made the nominal concessions for our room, to make an appointment with the desk manager in the morning. 8. The cot then arrived with no pillows. My pregnant wife slept on the hard and foul-smelling couch beside our toddler to make sure she would not fall off and we placed some other pillows on the floor to protect her on the other side. 9. Soon after the sun rose the fire alarm went off and we all went down to the street to join the other guests, after having had approximately 3 hours sleep. 30 minutes later, not one member of the Intercontinental staff had come by to update us on the fire alarm, nor was any staff member present during the entire ordeal. Finally a guest wandered by with a coffee and confronted the sleepy and now very angry guests (dressed in everything from pajamas to underwear still standing on the street corner) to tell us that everything had been resolved for some time. 10. Approximately 1 hour after the event we got lost in the hotel in locked stairwells with another family who had been directed by the only visible staff member in the lobby to take stairs located past the conference area. 11. After we returned to the hotel room we tried to fall back asleep. We heard a dripping noise and we noticed water leaking from the ceiling approximately 10 ft from the bed. After trying unsuccessfully to sleep, we decided to leave. 12. We went to use our breakfast vouchers that we given to us but were told that they had expired and that we were too late to use them. I have waited to post this review so that a fair chance was allowed to the hotel to resolve my concerns and compensate me for both my experience and the suit that they irreparably damaged. Unfortunately, I HAVE NOT BEEN COMPENSATED WHATSOEVER. The hotel refuses to take responsibility for the damaged suit and has not compensated me for the balance of my experience.

Reviews.Title: “We recently stayed here to celebrate our...”
Reviews.Author: snowball123
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and the staff and service where excellent. At check in I mentioned to the girl ( can't remember her name she was 20ish and was in training) that it was our anniversary she then organised for us to get a free upgrade which was excellent she was very pleasant and extremely helpful she even rung our room to make sure we liked it! Our room was amazing and when we went out for the evening and returned there was a bottle of champagne and cake with happy anniversary wrote in chocolate on the plate. We thought this was lovely and again the excellent girl on reception must have organised this for us. We made use of the full facilites including the spa were we had a couples massage again the staff were so professional ( britney and Robert I think there names were) we thoroughly enjoyed it. I would highly recommend this hotel as it is also very central to all the main attractions

Reviews.Title: “Not Great for Upscale Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: ILive4London
Reviews.Content: We go to Toronto on business several times a year and usually like to stay at different hotels as we haven't found one in TO that fits what we are looking for. We tried this hotel for the first time because of it's attachment to the Convention Centre. They obviously rely on this for a lot of their business and it's a good thing because we wouldn't go back otherwise. Rick at the front desk is absolutely amazing-- he really goes above and beyond, but other than that, the hotel really lacks for the upscale business traveler. I got to my room on check in to find the door OPEN (yikes!). Pretty scary. Upon alerting security they assured me they would take care of it. My boss said that there was a pillowcase just laying on the floor when he checked into his room? Odd stuff. The room is quite large and the sheets and duvet are top notch, but the mattress is old and so are the bathroom fixtures. Again, not what you'd expect for $229/night. One HUGE downfall with this hotel: they CHARGE for the internet. As a business traveler, I need internet but absolutely don't think it should be charged for these days. The restaurant is very poor quality. It may look good, but the service is slow (again, not ideal when you are on a business lunch), not friendly and the food is TERRIBLE! I've eaten there about 8 times, and this is always consistent. Last night, our dinner was so bad we spoke to the manager who assured us he would pass on the feedback. The margarita pizza is exceptionally not edible, and for $18!!! The hotel staff outside of the restaurant IS very good, so it's almost enough to make me want to go back, but otherwise, pass this hotel up. SO many other great hotels in TO that cater to corporate guests.

Reviews.Title: “..top notch service from check in to check out!”
Reviews.Author: Berringer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with InterContinental Toronto at the downtown location for TIFF. It was not my first time to Toronto or this location, but I had to write a review because my experience was so pleasurable. The front desk agent, Rick, was simply wonderful. He was polite, professional, knowledgable of the city and hotel, accomidating to our requests and welcoming. My client remarked that he felt lke he was "checking into a fine hotel in Paris." Top-Notch! The Spa was wonderful, although the pool was a little small. Loved that they have an area dedicated to Yoga in the fitness center. The view from the suite was amazing, bed comfortable, but rooms were average. The restaurants band was a surprise treat. The food isnt on the hotel's level - much to be desired, although the service was great (Trevor). Being from the UK, most hotels would provide breakfast, this property has a nice one, but its $30 with tip. I would recommend this hotel and will be returning for next years Film Festival.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bjmcisaac
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel about a dozen times in the past twelve months. Mostly on business trips, but a couple of nights with my wife (for shopping/watching the Bills play at the Rogers Centre). I am a Platinum Ambassador and the one thing I always find outstanding at this hotel is the staff. From the front desk service, to the concierge, to the bellhops - they all provide impeccable service. I stay in hotels about 40 nights per year on business. I have stayed at each of the three Intercontinentals in Canada (this one, Toronto Yorkville and Montreal) and, though each has its own charms, this one is my favourite. I have stayed in three different room types - standard (I am a smoker and have stayed in this room by choice a couple of times - with my ambassador status, each time they have been gracious enough to provide me with club access in lieu of an upgrade), deluxe and junior suite. The smoking, standard rooms are on low floors (I have always stayed on floor 4 of a 25+ floor hotel) and have not been renovated like the rest (I have found smoking rooms at most hotels to be the worst rooms in the hotel, likely for good reason). The deluxe and junior suites are great, I have generally stayed on high floors with great views and modern furnishings. The Club Lounge is very nice (although I was surprised that you pay for alcohol), and the continental breakfast is a nice way to start the day - particularly the smoked salmon. An example of the great service they provide - I had a late meeting that ended past 4 p.m. (my Ambassador late-checkout). My flight left at 6:20 p.m. I had the bellhop keep my bags at the hotel and asked for a limo at 4:30. However, my meeting ran late and I didn't end up at the hotel until just after 5 p.m. As soon as I told the bellhop of my situation, he literally ran to get my bags while another escorted me to the car (which was still there, more than half an hour later than I had booked). The first bellhop brought my bags to the car and the driver (during Toronto rush hour traffic) took a route that ensured that I got to the airport on time. I am looking forward to my next stay there next month.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sdahl
Reviews.Content: Just got home from TO, hotel is in a great location for the TIFF. Lovely pool and hot tub area. Everything was very good, only complaints are valet parking is $40/day and was not disclosed at check in even though at check out the guy at the desk said he told us, none of the 3 of us at check in heard this! (not good customer service) The chairs in our room were worn and sofa had stains on it so these things should be either cleaned or replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: DC_Born1990
Reviews.Content: I've been to different hotels in my 20 years of living but this hotel was the best of the best. The location was perfect the room was perfect and the view from the rooms were priceless. If you dont drive, Union Station is about 2 blocks away. You want to go sight seeing? Harbourfront is about 4 or 5 blocks away and the CN Tower and Rogers Centre are right around the corner. The service was excellent, there was not a question I asked that they couldn't answer for me. The spa is great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ragingragnar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 days in late August. The location is superb, almost attached to the CN Tower and definitely attached to the MTCC (convention centre). Also within a few minutes walk of the Roger's Centre. Ideal for all restaurants and bars downtown, including Queen Street West. My room (superior double) was one of the best I've had anywhere and had a great view of the CN Tower and Lake Ontario. Breakfast was excellent but typically expensive at C$28 before gratuity. I didn't check out the pool or gym but heard they were small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggiekoervers
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel in the centre of Toronto. Near all of the attractions and the waterfront. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good and plentiful. The room, what a view, the CN Tower and the lake, large corner windows, comfortable bed and lots of room. Service was excellent, would certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Coompa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a very enjoyable night at the Intercontinental, we had a little romantic getaway, away from the kids for our anniversary. The front desk staff were very professional and welcoming on our arrival. We used the concierge to book dinner and we were really happy with his recommendation. The hotel is very central and is an easy walk to most of Toronto's tourist attractions, theaters, entertainment district and countless restaurants. The room was modern and very clean and we had a great view of the CN Tower. The bed was extremely comfortable, I can't remember the last time I had such a good nights sleep. I would highly recommend the Intercontinental, the staff, the room and the location are exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel Staff in Good location”
Reviews.Author: jerliner
Reviews.Content: The location of the intercontinental is in a convenient good location but the staff and management at this place are the worse I have ever encountered. They are rude, sarcastic and so unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “was given the red carpet treatment!”
Reviews.Author: tonyr1616
Reviews.Content: from check in to check out i have to say that whatever need's i wanted or needed the staff was quick to accommodate. in terms of the cleanliness of the room, it was spotless and totally comfortable. i had a romantic evening with my girl and we really felt like king and queen for the weekend! highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, service and location!”
Reviews.Author: travelfoodie19
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean, spacious and quiet. The bed and pillows, very comfortable! Valet parking ($40/day) and self-park ($20) available; self-park should be free for hotel guests. Charge for internet ($10/day); should be complimentary also! Great location in the Entertainment District - steps to Rogers Centre, CN Tower, Steam Whistle Brewing, King St. restaurants, theater, Roy Thomson Hall, etc. Loved the beautiful lobby; front desk personnel and concierge very helpful; housekeeping does an excellent job; valets friendly and efficient. Azure restaurant too pricey; live entertainment on Fri night that I was there (3pc jazz band). Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is excellent. Great location, food and music and pool!”
Reviews.Author: sharlandjones
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We were really surprised to find a salt water swimming pool in the Spa. The view was great, we could see all downtown area as well as Lake Ontario, Ontario Place and the SkyDome. The food was delicious and we enjoyed the live jazz combo next to lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Indy”
Reviews.Author: Skunkworkscan
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight with two friends, Clean comfortable rooms. Nothing special but this is the second time I have stayed here and I would again. Lobby is huge and impressive looking. Small jazz band plays at the bar in the lobby also. Good location, minutes from Union station and the bars downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: sbpeister
Reviews.Content: We had a great corner room, with a great view of the water front. Hotel is located close to theatres and there are many restaurants close by. Parking is paid separatley and is a bit expensive. Internet is also at extra cost that should be included in this class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel by the Toronto Business District”
Reviews.Author: Shores84
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Union Station and was able to reach the hotel via the underground PATH system (www.toronto.ca/path/). The PATH system can be confusing to someone who is not familiar with it due to the convoluted networks and the unclear signages. But once you figure it out then you're all set because you can reach places such as City Hall, Eaton Centre, Union Station, etc. comfortably (useful during hot summer and cold winter days!) The hotel was not grand by any means, and the lobby area was just average. The reception person was nice enough, but not very warm. The housekeeping staff was really amazing though! He was attentive, fast and very friendly (I had made several requests and he offered to fill my ice bucket) The room was your average five-star hotel setup. I stayed in this hotel with 3 other friends. We booked through Hotwire and the four of us were assigned a room with two double beds. The decor was a little drab and somewhat tired, but the room was very clean. The bathroom was also average. The view from our room was amazing though (I like city view and a bit of people watching!) I checked out the fitness centre and the swimming pool as well. The fitness centre was small, but it had everything I needed. There was a poorly-lit yoga room in the back which I thought was a bit weird. The pool area was alright. They had a small pool, a kids' pool and a jacuzzi, which were all salt water. There were some metal palm tree decorations around the pool area from which water was flowing (sort of like a fountain). It was a good concept but the salt water had caused the metal to rust a bit. The pool area was located in their spa area, so visitors were asked to keep the noise level down. However, there were a bunch of kids in there during my visit and they were quite rowdy, but the pool attendant did not do anything. In terms of location, the hotel was located by the Business District, so it was a bit further away from all the action. It was, however, very close to Union Station where you can hop on a subway to take you to wherever you want. On the plus side, the hotel was very serene and quiet at night, so you shouldn't have any trouble catching some quality snooze time. Overall, I would say the hotel was decent and I had a pretty good time. It was not spectacular, but it was definitely above average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stl05
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, friendly staff. This hotel is located next to the CN Tower and Skydome. This is a nice location to explore Toronto. The only drawback is Toronto is not cheap. Meals and accomidations are costly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Intercontental Toronto Centre..”
Reviews.Author: FamilyAandW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental Centre for 3 nights as a getaway. I researched many options - the Intercontental offered the best options for the price. I booked early to get an online deal (one tip - go online and compare first. When booking by phone the seller neglected to mention the $199 package I was interested in with high floor and view. Instead, offered a higher priced package. It pays to research.) Location - great. 5 minutes to entertainment, hotels, subway, etc. by foot. Morning buffet in Azure restaurant included in the room - great options for food (lots of healthy options, and the usual fare with smoked salmon and other delicacies included) and good service. The concierge (Marguerite?) was extremely helpful - booking tickets to shows and offering advice to us out of towners. Room was extremely clean and very modern. I was on 17th floor with views of harbour and CN Tower. The king bed was fantastic - best sleep I've had in ages. No complaints whatsoever - and I'm very picky! I'd book again, and bring my kids too. I didn't see the pool area to know if it would meet their approval, but as early teens they'd appreciate the large rooms and the buffet. Views too.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here...ever!”
Reviews.Author: nyclegal33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for only two nights, thank goodness. Not only was the restaurant service lousy, but the staff seemed disoriented, uninterested in assisting customers, and completely clueless when asked a direct question. The restaurant was mediocre at best. I've had better meals at the many nearby eateries. I had the misfortune of seeing a staff member get reprimanded quite loudly and abrasively by what could only have been a supervisor. I'm there to relax and am paying for quality service, not a side show. They need to get better managers into the hotel or else this will be a common occurrence.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: fee57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 18th to 21st June 2010. Clearly a bad wekend to have picked the Intercontinental Hotel given that the area was cordoned off for the G20 meeting. The hotel was hardly welcoming at all. It would appear that the old Intercontinental Charm is long dead and this was reflected throughout the hotel. I went to the Spa at 2pm on the 20th June and there was no one at the front desk....I waited for 10 minutes and eventually the Asst Spa Manager came out, not even a word of apology. The Spa was well kept except for the showers that had dirty grouting and the steam room that could do with some better cleaning. The Spa service was good though. Generally, not the place that I would return to....it was not friendly and there was nothing to suggest that my business would be welcomed again.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious, centrally-located budget buster!”
Reviews.Author: Marcello74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on a combined business and leisure trip. My wife joined me for the first two days and night, then left me to my conference (next door at the MTCC) for the rest of the stay. Check-in was high-class. They allowed us to park ($40 for valet) and check-in early, and the process was smooth in both cases. A package had been sent to me earlier in the week and the front desk made sure I knew where to go to get it. This is a small thing, but in some hotels picking up pre-shipped material is arduous and stressful. Intercontinental has the process down to a smooth professional transaction. We had a junior King suite, which consisted of a spacious bedroom open to a small living room, a hallway and the bathroom. For two, it's just enough space. For me alone, it was ample room to spread out and relax each night. There are two 32" flat screens in the room(s), as well as a desk/workspace with free regular tethered internet, or wi-fi for a price. Luckily for us we had a spectacular view of the CN Tower, SkyDome, Island airport, and harbour. The room was decorated nicely, with slightly upscale furniture/carpets, and even bamboo flooring. I found the walls a little bashed up and aged -- wallpaper is starting to peel -- but otherwise it's modern and comfortable, if not totally luxurious. Cleaning staff were attentive and kind, taking great care to return the room to its pristine state each day. Staff throughout the hotel were courteous and professional, effiecient and pleasant at all times. The downside? Intercontinental's pricing is high. Room service and restaurant prices are utterly excessive ($22+ for a two-egg breakfast), which makes it necessary to go elsewhere for all meals. If you can upgrade to the Executive levels for $20 a night, getting free breakfast and wifi, it's more than worth it. I couldn't justify that to my company, so I had to scramble to get food outside of the hotel each morning. Other than that, my only beef was with the elevators -- we were on the 24th floor (of 25)...and each time we needed an elevator it was slow to come, and then made countless stops on the way down. The hotel would be wise to dedicate banks of elevators to certain floors (ie one bank serves floors 3 to 13, the other 14 to 25). Other guests had the same comment as I did on this one -- at least it gave us something to talk about as we waited through the frustration. Finally, a correction on something an earlier reviewer said -- the hotel is in fact very close to the PATH system. Directly across Front Street from the hotel is an entrance to the PATH. So in any weather, you can get yourself around without getting soaked. Given its central location (walk to the Convention centre, waterfront and ferries, CN Tower, SkyDome, Entertainment District, Distillery District, etc), its wonderful staff, and its luxurious feel, the InterContinental is a safe bet for those seeking mid-to-high range accommodations. But be prepared, the prices will add up quickly!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Airbus_Guy
Reviews.Content: Recently finished renovations in part of the hotel mean that you can choose between the modern decor, and a more classic style. Odd shaped building means that some of the rooms are very very far away from the elevators (Rooms ending 00 to 14 seemed the furthest) Tried out the spa services - the pool was very cold! Staff were very nice and attentive; Breakfast buffet is nice, but very very expensive; choose a local diner or even Tim Hortons down the street All in a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “expensive but worth the money”
Reviews.Author: tonyXchurch
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for three nights and everything was excellent,, the position in downtown toronto near the c.n.tower and lake ontario was in walking distance excellent shopping close by and the hotel was run by very friendly staff .the rooms all very big and clean.the one fault was not enough lifts for the number of rooms

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...”
Reviews.Author: sjpaek
Reviews.Content: This was one of the preferred hotels for my business conference because of the proximity to the office but I found it be a lot nicer than I thought. From the exterior its looks a bit outdated but inside the lobby was nice along with the rooms. It has a modern look to it. Alot of my other work colleagues stayed at the Fairmont which is the complete opposite (beautiful from the exterior but the rooms outdated). I was happy with my stay (I only really went there to sleep). I never got a chance to check out the gym, pool or restaurant. I will note during my stay 2 of the elevators were broken and I would end waiting 10 minutes for the elevator. Aside from that the Intercontinental was great.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible noise, deceptive staff, miserable stay”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTraveler7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was convenient to the convention center. Worst decision I ever made. There was a LOUD jackhammer-like noise that the staff first played dumb about (hmmm...not sure what that could be?). When I persisted, I was assured that the noise was elevator construction that would end by 5 pm. When the sound persisted at 8:30 pm, I was told that the staff was well aware of the problem, but tough luck, they were out of rooms away from the elevator. It kept me up at night and tortured me (even TV on full blast didn't drown it out). COMPLETELY ruined trip - I couldn't work in my room, couldn't rest, couldn't sleep at night, couldn't even hear the TV over the awful noise. The lying and deception only made it worse. Seems like they keep moving people around because everyone in an elevator room complains. NIGHTMARE!!! In addition to that, the room was shabby, some items were broken, recently installed room safe was FILLED with debris, carpet was stained, lighting was too dim, and the TV was an old fashioned 19" tube TV (non-digital). I expect lot more for such an expensive hotel!!!!! I would never, ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but make sure the weather is nice”
Reviews.Author: WorldExec
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is a very nice hotel. The rooms are large and very comfortable. If you are at the convention centre, it is ideal or if you are visiting the entertainment district. If you are staying for business and need to get around town, hopefully the weather is nice since the hotel is neither on or near the PATH. The staff were not the level I expected for this type of hotel as the service was poor both at the reception, getting around the hotel and in the Ambassador club.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: BRPROC
Reviews.Content: in town for a show (little house on the prairie {okay so I'm whupped, but at least she enjoyed it}) very clean, modern hotel that lacks for nothing. as it appears to attract the business set during the week, you might try securing a good price on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great rooms, great pool, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: simeon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and was able to get a great deal this time. The rooms are spacious and the bed very comfortable. We had a good view South although because of the angled design of the hotel we could only view one direction. The pool and hot tob are very nice and were both at comfortable temperatures. The high speed internet costs $9.95 per day and was slower than dial up at times. Mulplitple calls to their Internet help desk accomplished nothing other than wasting my time. The hotel did refund the charges because of the problems I was having. The hotel is in a great location being only a couple of blocks from Union Station. The staff were all pleasant to deal with. Breakfast at the restaurant was expensive (over $50 for a basic meal for 2) and the service was slow. Lot's of other options (like Cora's) close by.

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: leazle2000
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that staying on the club level at the Intercontinental is definitely worth every penny. Instead of waiting in the long line in the main lobby, we went straight up to the club lounge and were greated right away. We got to sit down and go through the check-in process. (A treat when you are already tired from travelling) We got to our room and I was pleasantly surprised! I usually can't stand "hotel beds". You know the ones, itchy sheets, ugly bed spread, wool blanket...Well this was no hotel bed. The second we got to the room we both could not resist the urge to flop onto what was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on! Even the pillows where good! The room was clean (I even tested the top of the tv cabinet, because I am just that kind of person..haha) Later on in the evening we stopped by to ask directions to our evening entertainment and found some yummy snacks and appetizers set out in the club lounge! We sat and had a bite and chatted with Kristina, one of the club concierges. I usually don't mention people by name, but she ebodied guest service in a way that many hotel staff do not. She seemed to truly enjoy helping us and we had a great talk about the type of entertainment we could find in the city! She had an amazing understanding of what was around. I find many concierges just mention the typical/common restaurants, clubs etc...but Kristina seemed to grasp what kind of guests we were and she recommended the perfect spot! We had a blast! Breakfast the next morning was perfect. Not too heavy/greasy, but just enough to start the day. So thank you IC and thank you Kristina and other staff, we had a wonderful stay and will most definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: javachampion
Reviews.Content: Do not expect too much from this hotel. Typical rooms. Get a lakeshore view though and you'll see the CN Tower, Rogers Centre, Lake Ontario, Gardiner Expressway, and the railroad tracks leading to Union Station. Kinda cool. Staff and front-desk are friendly. Oh, and one more thing, seems like there are peak hours, from 5 to 7 PM, on their elevators. They're very very very slow during these hours.

Reviews.Title: “fraudulant use of our credit cards”
Reviews.Author: SKtraveler62
Reviews.Content: My 2 colleagues and I are from out of province and were attending a conference there and all 3 of us had our personal and corporate credit cards used for fraudulant purposes just after our stay. Visa seems to be aware that there is a problem at this hotel. Their security is lacking. A beautiful hotel, otherwise, but be warned only use cash!!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated room, needs reno, good location”
Reviews.Author: thenay84
Reviews.Content: Lobby looks great, and we were placed on the 21st floor, it was a "jr suite" which we got "upgraded" for free. I was surprised and was excited until I opened the door and went around the corner of the walkway in my room. It was really outdated, easily older than 15 years. Furniture was in bad shape and really needs a reno, stuff looked really worn out. The bed was comfy, probably the newest thing in the room . I will give a thumbs up for the view of the city, had about 9 windows in it, and was on the corner, stunning! The staff is good, but the crowd that was there when I was at the hotel had a bunch of rowdy 19-23 year olds throughout the building. The pool was nice size, it's saltwater, not chlorine based which is a good plus to me. However the tiling of the pool needs cleaning, look kinda dirty or need repair. I love the fact it had a steam room, many downtown hotels do not have them, and this was clean, good size and maintained well. Location is near union station, skydome (rogers dome now), cn tower, air canada centre, so would make a great stay if your doing anything involving a trip to either of those for the day/night. There are better hotels out there, but in this location and for the price I paid on priceline you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: sivanu
Reviews.Content: We had the meeting in their conference hall and it was very convenient to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: ChequeMark
Reviews.Content: Had to spend a few nights in Toronto for business and given the not so great experiences I have had with other dontown hotels, I decided to try another property. My apointments were around the convention center so I stayed a the Intercontental. What a pleasant surprise. The lobby is largeand a little cold but the warmpth of the front desk service made up for the chilly first impression. My room was clean and comfortable with a great view of the city. The bed was comfortable and the room was surprisingly quiet, a nice thing on a bustling city. Restaurant service was also friendly and the food was of good quality but typical of a hotel. I was not wowed by the overall experience but I was not disapointed. I received just what I was looking for. Good, clean hotel room, friendly service and at a reasonable price. what more can I ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sjf123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the interContinental for 2 nights. It's located on Front Street in Toronto and very close to Union Station, Convention Centre, and both the Air Canada Centre and the SkyDome. There are also lots of restaurants and pubs near by. The subway is a short 5 minute walk away. I was very pleased with this hotel, as it provided roomy accommodation, a great work desk and pleasant staff. The rooms are functional if not very glamous looking. The bathroom amenities smell wonderful, and I would have bought some lotion to take home if that was available. Overall, I was pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bbharrison78
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel. I was in a newly renovated room (except the curtain rod was coming off the cieling). The hotel was clean and comfortable. My only disappointment was that I called down to speak with the front desk and was told they were too busy and they would have to call me back. Nobody did, so I called down and hour later. I would just expect a large Full Service hotel would have enough staff so that every guest is taken care of. That is just my little pet peave. All in all though, stay here! The restaurants surrounding the hotel are great and the bus tour has a stop on the next block. This hotel is walking distance to the CN Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not as nice as I expected”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMofo
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto to see a Laura Pausini concert at the Air Canada Center and cashed in two free nights at this hotel. Got a room on the 23rd floor with two double beds. Beds were tiny and not very comfy. They were really squeaky. View from room was very nice. Room was very clean except for the two pubes that were in the bed. Ugh. Internet was $9.95 CDN but was very fast. Bathroom could have used more lighting and I have had nicer shower heads at a Holiday Inn Express! Room was huge though. TV was a tube TV, not flat screen and there was no light over the coffee making area. Employees of the hotel were all VERY nice. They will do a currency exchange at the front desk for a reasonable fee. There is also an ATM in the connected convention center. You can actually walk through the convention center to get down where the CN Tower is an all of the businesses along the way have an inside entrance. Ate in the hotel restaurant twice due to bad weather. Typical overpriced hotel food but tasted decent. About three blocks down (two past the CN Tower) is a 24 hour grocery store. For cheap coffee, the Timothy's coffee at the end of the convention center by the CN Tower has good coffee - and free Wi-Fi! This hotel was nice but I was expecting it to be a lot nicer since it is an Intercontinental. When I got back to the US I stayed at a Hampton Inn that was just as nice (with a nicer TV and bed). But the location was awesome - even Laura Pausini and her band were staying in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Docimprov
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental Toronto Centre on our vacation in August. We were very happy with our stay. Even though this is a large convention center hotel the staff make you feel like it's a small boutique hotel. We found everyone from the front desk personnel to the housekeeping staff to be extremely friendly and accommodating. The rooms were large with modern furnishings.The pool area was wonderful. My family used it each night, it was beautiful to swim laps looking up at the CN tower overhead.We found the rooms to be clean with one exception. My only criticism was when unpacking our luggage and putting our clothes in the drawers we found a half drank bottle of vodka in a bag in one of the drawers.(Not even Grey Goose...bummer..) We brought this down to the front desk, they profusely apologized. The only other criticism is the beds were OK not as comfortable as other hotel chains we have stayed at. We were able to sleep comfortably but I'm used to a plush pillowtop mattress. The location was amazing, close to everything. The Hotel's best asset is its' staff, they were extremely accommodating and kind, concierges were all extremely helpful with great restaurant recommendations. When it rained they gave us much needed umbrellas. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “found another reason to visit this gem”
Reviews.Author: Scottishlaird
Reviews.Content: Every so often, "She Who Must Be Obeyed in all Cirecumstances" decides we need a long lost weekend or so. Yup,up to the Intercontinental Toronto City Centre we go to join with our northern bretheren on their Thanksgiving holiday and some days afterwards. The reason? To observe Alfred Packer Day with our Canadian "family" ( the only individual to be hung for the crime of cannibalism in the states! I kid you not) No indecision here, it was the Intercontinental-- for the third time. As expected, everything was impeccable (no surprises there): from the "Directors of First Impressions' manning the "Intake", to the Stewards, Valets, Concierge, and that Fine Fireball of Professionalism, Mr. Kevin Bowen, Manager of the Facilities (in our last review, we suggested that Mr. Bowen be named "Employee of the Fiscal Quarter" or some such. Well, we have been informed that indeed he is now up for nomination. Go Kev!! Without reservation, we can state that the Intercontinental has once more exceeded its richly deserved 5-star ranking. Every aspect of the stay once again world-class without exception. And if anything, Mrs. Archibald's (Chief Concierge) eyelashes have grown to mesmerizing lengths (She of the famous dancing Scottish eyes and "come hither personality" (Gentlemen: you HAVE got to see her, just don't be too obvious while stareing and DO NOT DROOL-it's unbecoming). And as for the Azure restaurant, a "MUST TRY" addition to the menue is the pan seared scallops -- to die for!! (But don't chew or swallow: just place them between cheek and gum and savor them for several hours). Regretfully we did not obtain the name of the Chef but we are holding out for Sainthood for this young truly gifted lady (the Vatican has yet to respond to our e-mail). Room service: world class, Concierge offerings on the club Floor: to die for (Including a very interesting 12 yr old Glenlivit Single malt whiskey), the Spa: a live steam room that will induce halucinations after 25 minutes. The list could go on for 5 more pages but suffice it to say that this, the 3rd visit, reaffirmed our staunch belief that, bar none, the Intercontinental rules the field in every measure of guest convenience and amenities, and whatever is in second place is too far in the rear to be discernable. Oh yes,a final note: Mr. Bowen has advised us that the G.M., Monsieur Payette has introduced a Rewards Program for dedicated, loyal guests of the Intercontinental. Guests can now achieve "Marble", "Pearl", "Silver", "Gold", and "Platinum" status. As for us, Mr Bowen has informed that as a result of our loyalty and several visits for the purpose of "spreading the wealth" ( in the words of THAT distinguished gentleman, M. Obama), Mr. Payette has graciously granted us a status change from "Talcum" to "Cinder"!! And following our next visit in the spring, we have been adivsed to hold out hope for "Aluminum". We are reduced to complete, quivering, "humbility" by this singular and undeserved honor. One cannot praise the facility, the management, staff. amenities, and treatment sufficiently. For the perfect, and we mean perfect get-away, nothing but nothing is in the same class as the Intercontinental Toronto City Cebtre! Dr. & Mrs. Anthony Sumodi, Clan Grant

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the service and room”
Reviews.Author: gregdane
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were upgraded to a bi-level suite, but decided against it (we were here for our 15th anniversary and to see Kylie Minogue and didn't want to have to go up and down the stairs all day and night.) Staff moved us to a club-level room, with all the amenities. Also sent a lovely chocolate torte and bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary (nice touch!) New room was just fine, clean but no view... Evenings appetizers and drinks in the club were very nice, as was the full buffet breakfast every morning in Azure. One sour note: one evening in the cocktail bar we were surprised to find lots of litrtle 9 and 10-year old girls romping and playing- not what we expected at this level. But, the staff made it right. Next time we travel for a special event, though, we'll choose not to stay near the even itself but near where we'll probably spend most of the rest of our time: not much to do or see in downtown Toronto after dark, few restaurants and no convenience stores.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: morris10
Reviews.Content: nicely decorated clean rooms. comfortable bed. Stayed overnight to see Blue Jays play NY Yankees. Surprised that it was within walking distance of the Rogers Center where the game was played.

Reviews.Title: “Am I the King?”
Reviews.Author: nazz65
Reviews.Content: It's seemed to me, really. Cause of the fantastic features of this hotel: - reserved lobby - reserved breakfast room - lounge with private free buffet in the afternoon (all you can eat and drink...plus videos and more...) - special gift for my baby - spacious and confortable room . All this for only 215 C $ per night = 137 Euros (two adults and one child superior room and more...) In my Country I use to spent more for less... (last sunday in Milan 107 Euro (one person with bkfst....) and with non wiew or private lounge or spacious room....or.....

Reviews.Title: “dirty tub....no response from the staff”
Reviews.Author: panam747
Reviews.Content: It was 2 a.m. by the time I checked into the room. The room was nice: it faced the convention center and had the view of the Toronto Tower. However, there were quite a few curly hair all over the tub and basin. (I am bald as a mellon and had not used the facility during this discovery, so it couldn't belong to me). Informed by the front desk that room change was not available and no response from the staff or duty manager. I felt a bit creeped out during the remainder of my four-day stay. If the tub is visibly dirty, how clean could the linen and bedding? My stay also coincided with the Caribbean Festival, and the security had dificulty containing the partying guests. The location can't be beat if your conference is just outside and across the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: this place is way understaffed. Check-in was a really long wait because of the queue, and when I went back to get a replacement key, that took a long time as well. For a property with this many rooms, I saw a maximum of two people at reception, and one person at valet. Room service has a very small menu. The food is average, the pricing on the menu is high. A bottle of water in the room is $6. TV's are the standard issue non-LCD "tube" tv, and the wifi has a really weak signal on my side of the hotel. I couldn't use their wifi. There is an ethernet cable here, but when I tried it, it wouldn't work - and that's because it is not hooked up. Room temperature couldn't go below 22.5 degrees, and the room was a bit stuffy. The bathtub is standard super-shallow. All of the lighting is fluorescent, but not the nice ones that look pleasant, they're the ones that make you feel a bit like you are in a school classroom. It looks much nicer in the photos on their website!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting! :(”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherMW
Reviews.Content: The service on the front desk from Michael was outstanding, as was the service from the concierge, the 2 ladies were wonderful! The doorman! SUPER! But I found it was the lack of attention to the little details that stayed with me. The bathroom had black mould along the ceiling in the shower, the towels were like course sandpaper and the rack they were on was on such an angle it looked as if they would slide off. The ceiling vent in the bathroom had alot of dust and fuzz on it, bit disappointing! In the lobby where the public phones are located and where the phone books would have been, the shelves were very! dusty. I called down for foam pillows on the first night only to be given 2 what appeared to be cushions with pillow cases on them. We were on the 24th floor with a great view of the CN tower and the lake, awesome view and was very ! quiet! Overall, great location! Service...Fantastic, attention to small details....poor! We booked through hotwire, so for the price we paid, it was ....ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JoanJacksonville_FL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six night stay at this hotel and found it to be an excellent choice. Public transportation easily accessible, but there is quite a bit to do within walking distance. Stayed on the Club floor where the room was large and the service in the lounge very good. Great continental breakfast, tea service (3-5p), and evening hors d'oeuvres. Room was very clean and well serviced. Hotel restaurant, Azure, was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location and service”
Reviews.Author: Madelle
Reviews.Content: A great hotel and worth the money, in the centre of Toronto. We walked to the CN Tower (buy a pass all the way up to the skypod) and the Rogers Centre. Our package included breakfast and valet parking, plus a $25 gas card and welcome back packs for the kids. Certainly worth it, though it doesn't come cheap ... $500 for the two nights. Order in pizza to save money! While staying there go see Medieval Times (10 minutes away by car)... what a great show with kids! Room was spotless, 14th floor ... we had an even number room (I think!) and faced the railway. Though we couldn't hear it, I would request a room that faces the CN tower. Pool was excellent ... small(ish) but clean and the toddler pool attached was a nice touch. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JockMcCoy
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at the Toronto Centre IC. A peaceful and spacious hotel, with very good staff. Upgraded to a one-bedroom suite, with Club access - which was unexpected. The Club on the 8th floor is small, but manages to put on a good breakfast spread. Room had 2 minibars and 2 bathrooms. No in-room safe, but otherwise no complaints. Location is great for train/bus station. Next door to CN Tower. Easy walk to shopping areas,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Facilities and Staff”
Reviews.Author: canadianbelle
Reviews.Content: Over the years we've stayed at several hotels in the downtown Toronto area but never at the Intercontinental. We are very glad we did and will definitely return here on our next trip! We got a good deal through Travel Zoo for $99 CDN per night. It's located right on Front Street and within walking distance to the CN Tower, Union Station, Hockey Hall of Fame, Eaton Centre, restaurants, and the theatre district. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were well kept and clean.

Reviews.Title: “truely a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbwsbw
Reviews.Content: Having been in this hotel twice, both were upgraded. once was to the top floor suite, the other was the 2 floors suite. this time there was no hot water in the morning, and the manager came and escorted us to another room to have shower let us stay 2 rooms till u left. great breafast, good location, just blocks away from the station. taxi rank right outside hotel, convention centre just next door. great view of the tower.. surely come back again

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cici-la
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights, three days at the InterContinental Toronto Centre via a travel agent and got a decent deal for the two nights plus breakfast for both mornings. I had to wait a bit to check in since there seemed to be two big conventions going on and large groups of people were checking in. Once I got to the front, I was handled by the Front Desk Manager who was very proffesional. I innocently asked if there was an upgrade available from our standard room. The mgr did some computer whizzing and we ended up in the Royal Suite, which normally goes for almost $1000 per night. Needless to say, we didn't pay that much, not even close, but it was a FANTASTIC room. This was by far the best service we've had in a downtown Toronto hotel. Even if we didnt' get the upgrade, the staff were friendly, obliging and very pleasant. The breakfast buffet each morning was well worth it. We had great selection of food from smoked salmon to an omelett/egg station that made my veggie egg white omelettes :D. Every detail was great and even the fitness centre and pool were wonderful. This may not be a luxury hotel to those that are used to it, but I've stayed at the Fairmont, Four Seasons, and many other hotels in Toronto and this was by far the best experience I've had. My one and only complaint would be the elevators. There never seemed to be enough working and if you were the second person to get off the elevator, you better hurry cuz those doors want to shut and get to where it's going next, fast! The location was great too since we could walk to anywhere in downtown Toronto easily but we stayed fairly close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor in many ways- avoid”
Reviews.Author: Dugan1
Reviews.Content: I am not one to complain - no working phone on check in - ok ask them to bring a new one up fine- the bathtub stop is broken, now I cant take a bath so they move us to a renovated room a bit nicer, a pain to pack up and move but fine - next we notice the heat doesnt work in the renovated room - so we call and they will come up while we go out to dinner - they never came - we check out the next day, enough already. They charged us twice on checkin which tied up a credit card until we called the card company in the US, & now see that we have been double billed on the way out now that we are home so we called the bank, then the hotel, and they are working to fix things. Ok a few other things, that the people who gave rave reviews must notice since it effect everything. The buffet. The guy making omelets is in the middle of the buffet set up - so you have a long line because of the tie up in the middle to get to the second part of the buffet - if you dont believe me you will see - I waited online for 15 minutes at the buffet - what a crazy set up. The elevators also run oddly and on several occasions there were long backups at the elevator bays. If a baseball game just lets out - or some other event - good luck trying to get to your room. Very frustrating. these are ergonomic things that can be fixed. The people working there were pleasant, but this many things should not go wrong. you get what you pay for $99 canadian a night in my case. It has not been a good experience, probably my worst at a hotel since I rarely complain. I would blame it on the people running the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: tricia77r
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel. Modern, classy, very good service from staff. Close to CN Tower and we had a great view from our room on the 14th floor! We were lucky enough to get a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite and the price we paid online was awesome to begin with. Close to restaurants/bars and the subway. Food was good. Pool was relaxing. Room was spacious and clean. Would come here again for sure. If anyone is going to be in Toronto (end of June) and wants to do sightseeing, let me know. I have extra tickets for the Toronto Zoo, Royal Ontario Museum, and Ontario Science Centre. You can save a lot of money from me on hotmail. tricia77r

Reviews.Title: “This has got to be the Best Hotel in Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: paul_beam
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location; with a view including the CN Tower, the Dome, the Steamwhistle Roundhouse (and equipment), the harbour and the east end of Toronto Island -- has to be one of the best in the city. A lobby for reading, meeting, lounging and business, staff like you seldom find in North America for care, courtesy and actual solving of any problem. A clean pool and spa with privacy and grace. The Azure restaurant serves a buffet breakfast like you don't find twice in a year. The rooms are clean and the whole place is quiet. We thought for years that this was a large convention hotel, with all of the crowding, noise and confusion -- and we missed years of luxury and comfort in Toronto as a result. The InterContinental beats 2 King street, the King Eddy and the Royal York on all of the things that matter when you're travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for vacationers”
Reviews.Author: TML4Ever
Reviews.Content: I'm a resident of Toronto (living in a suburb) and came to stay downtown to celebrate my wife's birthday. We ocassionally will stay downtown when we need a mini break. This was the first time I stayed at the IC Toronto Centre and it is definately a great hotel, in a great location. I would highly recommend staying here if you are a vacationer as it's walking distance to many of the feature attractions. As well great eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling customer service from management”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer7943
Reviews.Content: I am speachless after the way I was treated by management at the Intercontinental Hotel, Toronto Centre. My reason for my stay was neither for leisure or business; it was an emergency situation that necessitated my stay. I originally booked the room for 5 nights off a discounted hotel booking website. It was an amazing deal in a time when I needed some good luck in my life. I recently had many of my belongings stolen; including all of my personal identification. Upon checking in, I immediately informed the front desk staff of my situation. Considering that I did not have any photo identification, (a requirement to check into most if not all major hotels), my mother accompanied me to check-in. She lives in another city and would not be staying in the room with me, however after staying at the near-by Hilton and Sheraton under similar circumstances, exceptions were made for me because they had her identification on file. The manager on-duty approved my stay and set up a system of me signing my name on a sheet of paper which would be used to verify my identity in event that I needed to replace my room keys or if I extended my stay and needed new keys cut. I did extend my stay - I had no choice and seeing as I had quite a few things in the room (due to my circumstance)... extending was expensive for me but helped ease some stress. I lost my key one late night and had difficulty with a manager on-duty. He could not find my signature, questioned what I told him about my signature identity-verification and told me to wait at my room for security. Security came after a long wait of me sitting in the hall outside of my room, asked me to identify multiple items in the room then let me in. I extended another week - paying the full rate without complaint. Unfortunately, I cam home late from work and lost my key, late at night a week after the first incident. The same manager was on duty. He remembered me but still would not budge in having security accompany to my room. I was able to recide the exact rate I paid for my room each night for the week. He brought up my lack of ID and questioned me on why I didn't have it (which is frankly none of his business, and gave me scripted lines on the hotel's policy on refusing guests with no identification. I was very frustrated and voiced my frustration with the situation - he even admitted to remembering me from the week-prior. The next morning I again intended to extend. I was called by the day's front desk manager who informed me that the hotel would be booked for the night. I knew this to be untrue because I had been monitoring the availability on the hotel's website. When I mentioned this a room suddenly appeared. Then my lack of identification was brought up. I don't understand why this suddenly became an issue, as I had been at the hotel for so long already and we made an agreement upon my check-in. To me - I feel I was treated poorly by the second manager because of my disagreement the previous night... sort of a "getting back at me" type of attitude could be detected. But I was told that a) I could extend and b) I could book online if I chose to for the next night or call in the morning to ensure a room would be free. I went to the lobby to pay for my night and immediately detected a sour attitude from the Manager. She was very very difficult with me. She made it clear to me that she had done me a favour by allowing me to stay. She again lectured me on my ID situation (after telling me on the phone that we could photocopy my one credit card and use that as identification). The way she was speaking to me, questioning me, repeating things that had already been talked about and dealt with - I told her that I found her customer service to be appalling. I am a very easy-going person and customer. I am not a confrontational person nor am I difficult to please... but I had to speak up; her attitude was incredibly catty and disrespectful. After I spoke up she refused to let me pay for the night. I asked for Head Office's number. After a few minutes of back-and-forth bickering at the front desk, in front of other customers, she finally let me pay for the room and after much hesitation, gave me Head office's number. When I tried to renew the room the next day I was told that my reservation could not be extended. I called the Head Office number that I was given the day prior. I told my story to the agent who picked up, only to then realize that the number I was given was not to a "head office"... it was the reservation line of the same hotel! The woman who took my call was very pleasant and passed me onto the hotel manager, Warren. Warren informed me that my stay could not be extended due to my lack of ID. I explained that moving out on such short notice would be extremely difficult and I questioned why it is an issue for me to stay (paying the hotel's full room-rate, ordering room service, generally being a good guest) now when my lack of id was a non-issue when I checked-in. His only reply was that it was a mistake. Well sir.... you made a mistake yet your mistake has caused turmoil for me. After speaking with the "head office" number, I was basically told that the hotel was independently owned and there really is no recourse for me - the hotel management's decision is final. Before these events transpired, I had nothing but good to say about the Intercontinental Hotel. The facilities are very nice, the service was friendly and efficient. But the lack of empathy, catiness, rudeness, and general professionalism by the hotel's management team and total lack of recourse for the hotel's guests upon receiving poor customer service is absolutely appalling.

Reviews.Title: “"We will be back"”
Reviews.Author: Romie_01
Reviews.Content: First, I must start from the valet parking, who's service was second to none. We pulled up to the front, shut our car off and retreived our luggage and were off to check-in. After receiving our room keys, we were off to get out 1 hour scheduled full body message. Joanne was amazing and almost had me asleep with her experienced hands, elbows and whatever else she used to get rid of all the tension and knots. We then headed off to Restaurant where everything looked mouthwatering. We started with the seafood platter and was disappointed that it was not available as a main course. After the seafood platter we decided to our meal, 14 oz steak for me and the Halibut dish for my wife. Sure enough, it was as we expected, "MARVELLOUS" The staff throughout the evening was very warm and courteous, always checking to ensure we were both comfortable and felt welcome. After dinner, we retired to our room which was very clean and spacious, 2 tv sets ensured we could watch what we wanted at the same time. I have never felt such comfort from a bed and pillows before, we were out in no time. The sunshine crept in at about 7:00 am and woke us for the first time since falling asleep. All in all it was a most enjoyable night spent and we look forward to returning soon. Thanks to all the wonderful Intercontinental staff.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of heaven not so far away..and the spa... GREAT MOTHERS DAY GIFT!”
Reviews.Author: bigred72
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky to stay at the InterContinental Toronto Centre on Front Street; we had a spa package and dinner at the Azure. All I can say is the moment we walked through the doors we were welcomed. The room was clean and large, the beds perfectly made and fresh. Our shampoo, soap, and amenities were generous. At the pool we met Kevin Bowen: Chief Engineer, Kevin explained the salt water pool and salt water hot tub, Kevin introduced us to Paola from the spa, who then explained our next day services. Our spa treatments were fantastic we had the Spring Bloom package; Luni took care of my treatments for the day, after we had cool fresh cucumber water and a lovely cheese and cracker platter. We were made to feel very much at ease and relaxed. All in all, our stay was number 1. I can not forget to mention, the turn down service from Jeffery who fluffed our pillows, placed melt in your mouth chocolates on our pillows and soft robes to put on. Thank you Jeffery. One more thing: dinner, waiters, staff, chief and live band topped our stay off. Scumpish dinner, great selection of wine and good atmosphere. THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “THE SERVICE WAS EXCEPTIONAL AND THE SPA WAS WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Whitby
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. We were offered a later check out as we were taking advantage of the on site spa. We enjoyed dinner at the restaurant in the hotel which was accompanied by complimentary appitizers, and the food was delicious. At the spa I had placed my diamond necklace in my robe pocket, which I forgot to put back on after I had left. 2 hours after returning home, I had realized my necklace was missing. I called the hotel, and fortunately enough they had found the necklace and it was returned to me. I was blown away with the honestly and friendliness of the staff. Our overall experience was fantastic and would go again FOR SURE! Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Exceeded my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Pakse
Reviews.Content: I booked a club king room - I have no idea what they look like because I have always been upgraded. I have stayed in club and non-club rooms. Club rooms are nice. But non-club rooms are perfectly fine. The club is quite nice, wonderful cold breakfast, afternoon tea and evening snacks. Staff is excellent. Only negative is the valet - I have now given up on using the valet (self parking is so much faster it's crazy - like i can save a 1/2 hour each morning by self parking). (Don't get me wrong - the valet guys are nice, polite, etc... just for some reason they can't get my car...) Love the hotel - the pool is to die for (salt water), nice fitness area (machines are in great shape) - they even have some dumbells (although nothing over 50lbs - so no squatting/dead/bench etc...) (The onsite resturant is overrated) Overall I love the place and always look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “March break”
Reviews.Author: toronto9
Reviews.Content: Fantasticâ€¦I booked this mini vacation during our childrenâ€™s March break. Three families.... 7 kids and 6 adults.and everyone had a great time. Something for all of us, the kids were taken care and the adults sat back and just relaxed. My first call was to the reservation departmentâ€¦and I lucked out big time with Miriam my agent. She gave me the BEST customer service that I have experience from the service industry, in a long whileâ€¦.customer service these days is hard to come by! From the minute we got there.. Valet parking (the kids comments "We feel like rich people" to the minute we left, everyone from every department went above call of duty, they have a great team working at this location. The rooms were clean and spacious. We will be returning soon. Paola

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: GetAway62
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a great March break deal that the hotel offered and we got more than we could have hoped for. We had a beautiful room that was quite large. The deal included brunch at Azure and it was very good - great apple juice! You can't beat the location of this hotel. It is within walking distance to so much. The hotel may not look young child friendly, but during the March break deal, they certainly pulled all the stops out for the kids. They had their own check-in, cooking class, video games, and bedtime movie room, complete with popcorn. The staff were terrific - helpful and friendly. We'll certainly be going back and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: marcool
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights at the intercontinental and it's been lovely. Almost no bad point. The only thing that turned me off in this hotel was the ice-cube machine in the corridor which made a terrible noise. Luckily my room was far from this machine but I couldn't help thinking about the amount of electricity consumed by this monster. All the rest was great. First the location is excellent. Right in the town center but still easy to jump on the highway even in the crowdy morning. The reception went very smoothly and they took very good care of me. The room: Very good size. Big bed, nice desk. Only problem is the glass on the desk which makes it difficult to use an optical mouse with a computer. Minot problem really... The TV is big and working great. The selection of food and drinks in the minibar is very good. The bathroom has everything needed and the right way. Nobody is replacing all the little bottles everyday. If it's not empty, it stays which is very good. Also I had one soap which lasted the whole week and it was just perfect. I hate when the clean ladies change everything everyday. It's ridiculous and useless. Same thing with the towels, it looks like this hotel took the right bend and switched to responsible travelers care. If you don't want your towel to be changed, it won't be changed. Not like many other hotels where they don't say anything or they do the opposite of what your require. The fitness room is nothing outstanding but of good quality. There are several (4-5) cardio training machines with TVs on each of them + some other (5-6) weight lifting machines or benches. I didn't get to go to the spa but it looks nice from the outside. The breakfast was excellent. A very good selection of fruits and pastries. Also all the usual bacon and eggs, pancakes and other bread cakes, cereals, oat, yogurts. The room service is good and fast. I was coming to meet some customers and some of them first stayed somewhere in Missisauga and regreted it. So they switched to the Sheraton Four Points of Etobicoke but they hated it also (too close to the highway) So I'm happy I choosed a very good hotel at first for a rather reasonible price.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could be better!!”
Reviews.Author: Summer1961
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff was courteous enough. I had 2 sixteen year od girls who had never experienced downtown Toronto so at check in I asked for a "high" floor and were told the 6th floor was all that was available but 10 mins. later front desk was giving a room out on the 17th floor, I was disappointed with that.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire and no complaints”
Reviews.Author: highwaydriver
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday for three days hoping to beat the Valentine's day crowd and people coming for the long weekend. I was happy when we were checked into a nicely decorated room with a flat screen television. I was sure because we were hotwire I was going to get something defferent. I researched this hotel before arriving and was expecting a luxury hotel not aimed at children but to business travelers which on a typical weekday it may just be, the hotel has one pool located inside the spa so I can't say it's aimed at kids, but this weekend the staff at every turn made up for it. On Saturday we went out for Dinner because the restaurant looked very busy so I can't say too much about it except that it looked very nice and had a life band playing. The staff were great the entire time we were there and answered all of our questions as we did activities around the city. Overall it was a very enjoyable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: HellsbellsDublin
Reviews.Content: I have read a lot of bad press about this hotel and our recent four night stay was quite the opposite. We did get a good deal on Hotwire and from the moment we arrived in the door, our stay was most pleasant. Our room was a 'Deluxe' which pretty much means standard, but had all the trimmings of a 4 star with bath robes, a king size bed, minibar, 24 hour room service, in room wireless internet access and plenty of space to move around. The bathroom was spotless. We were on the 19th floor with views of the lake and the CN Tower and we had a very peaceful time. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a comfortable well located hotel, and of course if you get it a bargain price - better still!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bookflyer
Reviews.Content: This is a well appointed hotel by the CN Tower, rail station and convention center. These three attractions are all available through skywalks, although the walk to each is a bit long and involves more than one escalator. The lobby is gorgeous and check-in was quick. I am a Platinum Elite level InterContinental Ambassador member so I was provided a room on the 19th floor without requesting an upgrade. The room was large and included a sutie-like extension. The bed was very nice but the drapes and carpet need updating. The bath does have granite countertops but the tub had 3rd generation caulking around the edges and should be stripped and recaulked properly. Water pressure was great but the showerhead was a very low end model and not as good as what is used in the Holiday Inn Express locations. The TVs are not flat panel in my room, surprising for a "five star" hotel. The bar was very nice but several bars such as Jack Astors, The Loose Moose, Philthy McNasty and Elephant and Castle are a couple of blocks away at best. I did not eat at the restaurant since there were better choices within walking distance. All staff members I interacted with acted professionally and courteously. The elevators worked well and were very responsive. The workout facility had nice machines but the layout was strange. The machines (two elliptical and three treadmills) had built-in TVs. Free weights and a nautilus were also available. It was included with the room and you can access it from the hall without needing to go through the spa. Internet access was around $13/day or you can purchase packages.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: sciencegirl
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to add my review after reading others. We just spent the weekend at the Intercontinental on Front, and we had booked it through Hotwire. Contrary to what another reviewer stated, they did NOT treat us poorly because we booked through Hotwire. In fact, when we called to confirm our rooms, they offered us rooms in the newly renovated portion, even though it was obvious we received a discounted rate. The rooms were very comfortable and well appointed, and the bathrooms were nice and clean. There was a CD player in the room, a big comfy desk, and chairs with a small table too. There was some minor wear in the bathroom and closet, but this is to be expected in any hotel. The staff there was extremely friendly and accommodating, and the lobby is just beautiful. We would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are a little tired”
Reviews.Author: turkskel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental overnight while in Toronto to see a concert. The check in was quick. A half an hour later, when we walked through the lobby, the line was very large. Glad we got there when we did. Our room was on the 16th floor. Our view was of the harbour, CN Tour and the SkyDome(Rogers Centre). The view was nice. The room was average size. The furniture is beginning to look a little tired and worn. The decor, while still looking modern, is pleasant. The bathroom was suitable. The finishings were nice, but there was mildew in the grout in the shower/tub, and the vanity was beginning to show some wear. If you are looking for a luxurious place to stay, I would look elsewhere. If you are ok with slightly above average accomodations with a nice view, then book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental Class”
Reviews.Author: Hockeywilltravel
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the InterContinental and I would stay at no other place when I am visiting Toronto. As soon as you enter the lobby you are consumed by "class" and the staff is professional and friendly. The rooms are perfect with every detail taken care of. What I like the most about this hotel is the pool and spa area. It has a "tranquil atmosphere" that melts all your stress away and leaves you refreshed and ready for whatever the City of Toronoto can throw at you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Above Average Service”
Reviews.Author: Uncommercial_Travels
Reviews.Content: My experience fell broadly in line with others' reviews. Great doorman, very nice lobby, decently fast check-in. Although upgraded, a smallish but very well-appointed room. Granite in bedroom and bath. Eighth floor view was of an office building 100 feet away or so and street-level construction zone. Room service was just excellent. Speedy and gave a sense of occasion to a 3AM hamburger. Had a beautiful morning watching the sunrise, Toronto commuters, and my huge TV. Very fast valet service in the morning. I wish I could have spent a month there. Downside: Much the same way I would not knowingly eat a meal prepared in a public bathroom stall, it is disconcerting to see coffee makers mounted next to the toilet in any hotel. Luckily, McDonald's feels the same way, so I got my coffee there instead.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: advisorToronto
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is rated 4.5 stars on hotwire - stay away. The hotel room was dirty, the drapes and sofa were stained, and the headboard was filthy. This is an old Holiday Inn and far below par. We stayed in an upgraded room that was supposedly recently renovated but the furnishings were shabby - a waste of money. When I informed the front desk about the state of the room, they said they'd call housekeeping - no apology, no offer of a refund for the upgrade - nothing. There are much nicer hotels in the area that are clean. Stay away from the Intercontinental - even if the price is attractive.

Reviews.Title: “WOW and WOW”
Reviews.Author: David067
Reviews.Content: I had heard about The InterContinental Hotel from a friend of mine, who had a great experience and I have to say, that I would highly recomend this hotel to anyone that requires, great service, great food, AMAZING location and an all around experience. The check in was seamless and quick, room clean, staff VERY friendly and I look forward to my next trip to Toronto. My family enjoyed the Indoor pool and my wife truly enjoyed the spa treatments...i get to pay the bill at the end, and frankly, it was well worth it. two thumbs up! 5 Star hotel and 5 Star service all the way. The Steinhouse Family

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: CEC8160
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an upgraded Junior Suite on November 1st and 2nd. The hotel and property is immaculate and the hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and the new upgraded decor is top notch. I had the chance to meet the Hotel Controller and she was a wonderful person to deal with. She refered us to a local restaurant where the food and atmospere was excellent as well as some othe local entertainment stops that were all within walking distance of the hotel. I will be returning there again. CEC

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel!!! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kmjfd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2006 after I got married. Fantastic hotel!!! The lobby and rooms are absolutely gorgeous!!! Somewhat pricey (but it is downtown Toronto), but definitely worth the money. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldkold
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved to be a major disappointment. I expected a 5 star hotel but instead found a glamorized Howard Johnson. The lobby was nice but with the exception of one male employee, the reception staff were slow and bored out of their minds. My room on the 7th floor had a nice view but the shower was ancient and took ages to have hot water, my sink wasn't working properly and had to be unclogged twice during my 5 night stay. The TV was old. The only good thing about this hotel is probably the location but one can find cheaper, nicer, better located hotels in Toronto. A total and unexpected disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect One-Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid1
Reviews.Content: My second stay at this property. This time got it for a little more than $100 US on Hotwire (their so-called 5.5 star property in the downtown area). Business type hotel and nothing terribly luxurious in terms of decoration. King bed, everything worked and in good repair. No mold, no peeling paint or wallpaper. Check in took less than five minutes. Room was quiet with a lake view. Perfect location just west of Union Station and within walking distance of the subway, etc. All these discount hotel room re-sellers OVERRATE their properties in terms of stars. I'd very happily stay again for that part of the city, especially at this price.

Reviews.Title: “a converted crowne plaza, and it shows”
Reviews.Author: cineluxe
