Reviews.Content: Now that I've stayed here, I think I can help resolve the huge difference between so many of the reviews here. I have stayed at many InterContinental Hotels in Europe, and this one does not measure up to even the worst day at any of them, but there is a very good reason why; it's a converted Crowne Plaza. A very old Crowne Plaza. When you enter the hotel for the first time, it's all InterContinental. Very beautiful, modern and clean, with staff who are anxious to serve. Check in was a breeze, and then I took the elevator (very nice elevator, too) to the 21st floor. I felt like I stepped into a time warp when I got off the elevator -- it was 1978 from the floor to the ceiling. All topaz, and other colors that go with topaz. When I got to my room it was more of the same. The only "InterContinental" part was the bed linens. Everything else was classic, cheap hotel. The room smelled very stale -- like a converted smoking room -- and everything was horribly disappointing. The thermostat still says Crowne Plaza. I called to request another room and was sent to the 16th floor where a bellman met me with new keys. This is a remodeled floor. It's like 50% InterContinental -- modern decor but more than a little disheveled. My room was much better, but nothing (and I mean nothing) like an InterContinental room in Europe. The smell was the same because the ancient, loud, rattling ventilation system is there for good. The 15-year old, 27-inch television had a distorted picture because the TV signal for some channels is HD squeezed into a box format. The desk chair was broken; the seat was falling through the middle. Both the wireless and ethernet internet access were abysmally slow. The bathroom had been touched up, but not gutted like it should have been after 20 or so years. In short it was a $150 per night room that I was paying $300 for. I could go on with tons of examples, but suffice it to say the hotel will disappoint anyone who has stayed at another InterContinental hotel pretty much anywhere. And at $300 per night it is horribly overpriced. If you can stay here for $100-$150, that's almost worth it. But be sure to request a remodeled room, unless you want to revisit your cheap hotel stays from the 70's.

Reviews.Title: “Five star room, one star service”
Reviews.Author: snullr
Reviews.Content: Our family of four arrived at the InterContinental to find they had, in the words of my son, â€œpulled an airline.â€� They were overbooked. No problem, we were given a free upgrade to a two story suite. The room was spacious, elegant and clean, if a bit worn. But since we were paying for a basic two-bed room, we werenâ€™t about to complain. (We figured this was the suite kept for free upgrades and suspected the others were more polished.) We did complain, repeatedly, when we turned in for the night and found the fold-out sofa (there was only one bed in the loft upstairs) had no linens. A call to housekeeping was followed by a trip to the front desk half an hour later and a second call to housekeeping twenty minutes after that. Our first call to housekeeping was made at about 11:15. At 12:40 my son was sprawled on the floor, my husband was nodding off in a chair, and I marched down to the front desk where I finally found a sympathetic staff member who delivered two sheets, one blanket, and one pillow to our room himself. He offered to hunt for another pillow, but given the hour and the excess of pillows on the bed upstairs, we declined and finally made up our bed. Granted, a convention was on that weekend, but a hotel of the supposed calibre of the InterContinental should be able to deal with the extra demands. The location is great; the rooms are fine; but until the service picks up, I recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not like an InterCon I've been too”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoMichael
Reviews.Content: I always think of InterContinental as an upscale business hotel that is less than 4 seasons, but still 4 stars. NOT TORONTO. SO many things were wrong, they should take the InteContinental name off the front. The halls had old pizza boxes and room service trays left for over 12 hours. Maid service basically consisted of making the bed and fluffing the pillows. It was hard to tell if the room had been cleaned at all. COCKROACHES in the bath room, room service that never calls back after putting you on intermittable hold, the list goes on. Sadly to make matters worse, the front desk was sullen and hardly interested in their guests, and when I filled out a lengthy comment card, I never heard a word back. I am a high status member of many airlines and hotels, including InterCon Ambassador, and I have never been more disappointed in a hotel property. Simply put: AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Appauling - what a dirty shambles”
Reviews.Author: quirky76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days on a business trip The front of house team lost all details and made me wait 50 minutes while they sorted the shambles out When I went to my floor where the room was I was met with laundry all over the floor and a desk and office chairs in the corridor The rooms when "cleaned" mearly had the pillows fluffed and bed made When complaining they refused to give any details of the GM and refused to get the duty manager - what a shambles On a positive note good location and gym facility, but I was told I couldn't go onto the swimming pool terrace unless I booked a spa treatment......... Could it get any worse ! Dont wast your time or money there are far better in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: FordyPerth
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, everything about it. The staff were so lovely on arrival and then later in the day sent us up a welcoming basket of fruit and Canadian maple syrup and with a lovely welcoming card. Our views out over the lake and of the CN Tower were amazing especially at night time, left the curtains open so we could watch the lights on the CN tower. This hotel was everything that we wanted and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: wicktipp
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed in this hotel just the past week, we were informed by the Travel agent that it was a 5 star hotel, and were looking forward to staying in one. When we got there there the lobby was very modern, and it was hard to actually find the check in desk. One of the rooms we booked was a smoking room, and the other was a non-smoking room. The smoking room was the larger of the two rooms, but could have been cleaned a bit better, the non-smoking room was condisderably smaller then the smoking room. We had a few drinks in the bar, but the attitude of the staff there was not conducive to staying there at all. You are near everything in downtown Toronto, and the majority of staff were very helpful and obliging, some need to get customer service skills. you are close to the CN tower, and there is a spa and gym in the hotel. But 5 stars it is not, more like a 3 star hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value based on Hotwire booking.”
Reviews.Author: RWATL
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for a quick weekend getaway following a business trip. Online postings tipped me off that Hotwire's 4.5 star offering for $105 per night was the Intercontinental. At this price, it was a superb value. The location is fantastic. Had I paid the regular room rate, I'm not sure I would have found it to be a great value.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Greensboro, NC / North Myrtle Beach, SC
Reviews.Title: “Not Quite 5-Star”
Reviews.Author: history_prof_2b
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental Toronto Centre has a great location near Union Station and the CN Tower in downtown Toronto. I booked this room using a discount hotel website, and paid approx. $140/night. For that price, I believe I got good value for my money. However, had I paid the regular rate of nearly $400/night for this room, I would have been greatly disappointed. Due to road construction, finding the hotel's parking entrance was tricky, but once we got inside, the amount of parking was rather plentiful (but tight for SUVs and expensive: about C$18/day). Front desk check-in was quick, but I felt that I did not receive the attention a customer paying full price would have received; I believe the front desk clerk thought I was a low-class person because I refused help with my luggage and asked the hotel to remove me from the C$1.50/day newspaper delivery service. While this may seem cheap to some, the fact is that I am a doctoral student who can't afford to be nickeled-and-dimed to death. (Fortunately, the check-out clerk was much more friendly, nearly flirtatious!) The room was quite large with very comfortable mattresses and new-appearing carpeting. Our excellent views of the CN Tower and Lake Ontario were facilitated by enormous windows. However, the furnishings appeared worn and second-rate, considering the hotel's normal price-point. Likewise, a cheap, mid-1990s-era, small RCA color TV occupied an enormous entertainment unit. The bathroom was all marble tile and quite spacious but poorly-lit. The decor of the room, and of the hotel in general, was about 10 years out-of-date. My companions and I did not use room service, nor did we use the in-room mini bar (the charges were outrageous: a candy bar or bag of M&Ms for C$4.50, a liter of bottled water for C$6, and so on). The meals at the in-hotel restaurant looked wonderful, but were greatly over our budget; the breakfast bar alone was C$21 per person. Intercontinental Toronto Centre is a great deal provided you can book online for $125-175/night. It has great views, a convenient location, and comfortable accommodations. However, it is certainly not worth the $375-400/night "regular" rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not the best accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Butski
Reviews.Content: We were expecting luxury accommodations comparable to a previous Intercontinental stay in Montreal. However, when we checked into our room, we noticed that this was the same hotel in Toronto that we stayed in 6 years ago. Back then, it was the Crowne Plraza and has since been converted to an Intercontinental. We were a little disappointed and were glad we did not pay too much for the room, which was booked through Hotwire. It was not 4.5 stars. We would rate it 3 stars at the most, and that's being generous. Rooms were not the cleanest (dusty) and the furnishings need replacement. Mattresses were very small, old TV, lamp knobs fell off, torn duvet cover. Leaky faucets and terrible dark lighting in the bathroom. Hallways smelled musty. The lobby area was attractive but we noticed that the ceiling needed epair. Internet was $9.95 for 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty room but spotty service”
Reviews.Author: flaii
Reviews.Content: The good: - Close to Union Station - Really big room, very nicely furnished - Decent workout space. The not-so-good: - Not an area with night-time eating options, as the area seemed deserted at night. - The lights were not working - turns out they were unplugged. Also, one of the lights had the bulb and socket hanging out of the fixture. I would expect the quality of the lights to be better. I had asked someone to come up to take a look at it, but it took so long I canceled the request. - I got a visit from housekeeping for extra sheets, which I did not request.

Reviews.Title: “NIce, but not THAT nice!”
Reviews.Author: vancouversurfergirl
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at this hotel, and I was expecting quite a bit as it was rated 4.5 stars on Hotwire. Once we checked in, I was glad we paid Hotwire prices as I would not have been happy paying full price for this hotel. If you do pay full price, I am guessing it would be for the location! The location was good and the bed was comfy. The room was a decent size - we just expected the room itself to be a little more luxurious and modern. The staff were also polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindyrella25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nicer part of town (compared to the Comfort Inn on Dundas where my class was held). It was a good option looking at what else was there. It is great if you are there for a convention as it is connected by sliding doors to the convention center. We stayed on the 16th floor. I would ask for a high floor room, the view was fantastic! The CN Tower was right outside our window along with the lakeshore. The pool is ok. I've seen better and the whirlpool did not work. They did say the spa and associated facilities were under renovations, so perhaps when those are done, this may be a bit nicer. I ordered room service a few times. Food is ok, but wayyyy over priced. Save yourself some money and go to Cora's a few blocks away. I must admit being a travel agent my company paid the low rate for an agent, if I had to pay full price I may have felt over charged. It is a nice place in a great location! Pictures will be posted soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rater510
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before my stay. I was expecting a lot worse. The hotel is decent. My room was on the 7th floor facing the CN tower. There was no complimentary breakfast. The room was very basic, no refrigerator and dated television. Since I was attending a conference at the convention center this made it very convenient. I would definitely stay again if attending a conference but would not stay here if on a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Krissy1983
Reviews.Content: The lobby is trendy and cool and everything you think an intercon should be. Don't expect much of the guest rooms though - they told me it was previously a holiday inn, and I believe it. The guest rooms could use some serious updating. Location to the convention center is great! This hotel is very convenient if you're attending a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing luxurious except for the prices”
Reviews.Author: prudenttrav
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ICTC while on business trip at the end of May. I got a room with a king size bed on 13th floor. I found the room to be average. It had the comforts that are expected in a hotel of this class but the room was small and the decor cold. The tub in the washroom required replacement. On the bright side of things, I had a view of CN tower and Rogers Centre and heard no noise from the trains. The bed was comfy and I loved the comforter. I enjoyed a corporate rate but if I were to pay the regular fare I would have felt like I overpaid. Breakfast was not included in the price of the room and the restaurant prices seemed to be high. All other hotel services were also on the high side. Only wireless internet was complimentary. The hotel is located close to the CN tower, but short to long walk from other major attractions. The Delta hotel seems to be more popular thanks to its more central location. Overall it was a good but far from extraordinary experience and I hope to stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pacwell
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental hotel is a great place to stay if you want to be close to restaurants, Air Canada Centre, Roger Centre, and CN tower. In fact the, the hotel is close to the CN tower, you can almost touch the structure. The hotel provides great views of either the city or the Great lakes. Make sure to stay on the higher floors as the view is spectacular. The rooms are extremely spacious and provide lots of amenities. I had some issues with cleanliness as I found some hair in the bathroom. A hotel of this nature, should not have such issues. The hotel staff were very friendly and the concierge service was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: 57Lulu
Reviews.Content: I'm trying to figure out all the positive, rave reviews of this hotel. I am staying for a convention of 15,000 attendees. There is only one restaurant for the whole hotel so there are waits for meals with no other option unless you go out of the hotel. No deli or coffee shop. The room service menu is very limited. The exercise room is small and two of the 6 pieces of equipment were broken. I'm not sure what my superior room should entail but it has a broken bathroom scale, old tv, view of the parking lot, and a remote control that doesn't work. The rate was $369 booked through my corporate travel agent. The staff is ok but haven't really problem solved. The only gift shop is a mens wear shop in the lobby. You have to go to a convenience store if you need amenities. There are restaurants within walking distance - about 4 blocks. My colleague states that she has a great room. So, beware and ask when you check in about what you are getting. Steer clear if there is a convention in town.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, if you get a discount”
Reviews.Author: StephanieinOntario
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for this hotel via Hotwire. We got the room at a discounted rate which we were happy about, since the rooms are quite pricey. We were delighted as it was rated as a 4.5 star hotel and in a great location for the events we wanted to see. The Hotel lobby is difficult to get to, as there isn't anywhere to stop or park your car to un-load. You must enter underground parking, ( signs are limited) to get down there. At that point, we decided to park our own car and skip the valet services ( Valet is underground as well) We walked through a Conference Center and then finally found the hotel. The lobby is sparse and and modern. Very little furniture. Check-in was no problem. We asked for our rooms to be next to each other. Our room looked clean and fresh. 2 double beds ( they don't have any queen beds at this hotel) Difficult when you have two children with you, but they coped. The bathroom was all very old dark green marble. Limited lighting for make-up. The tub is old and I saw some dark hair in it from the previous guest. The toiletries were nice. Plenty of towels. One housecoat. TV was small and not flat screen. Our view was limited. Right at the railroad tracks. ( the noise wasn't too bad though) Our second room- The same, but the smell from the new carpet was STRONG. It obviously just got installed, as the chemical smells were unbearable. We called down to the front desk. They sent someone up and agreed that it was a strong smell and that was it. I called again, and requested a different room. We finally got a different room a few floors up and that was nice. We were looking forward to the Pool and Spa area. The Spa was closed and the beautiful waterfall wasn't working when we got there. A Country and Western radio station was on, and there was 3 chairs around the pool, already taken, so no where to sit and watch our children swim. The Restaurant was pricey. Brunch was $40/pp. We opted to eat elsewhere and was glad we did. Lots of places to choose from. Location is great for sight-seeing, the staff were nice, but overall I wouldn't stay here if I was paying regular price. This didn't seem to fit for a 4.5 star hotel charging around $400-$450 a night for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel at an unbeatable price (thank you Priceline...)”
Reviews.Author: travelingmannyc
Reviews.Content: I was heading to Toronto for a business trip and since i had just purchased a $750 round trip ticket from Newark to Toronto on Porter Airlines, I figured I'd save my company a few bucks and try Priceline's "name your own" service. I picked the 4 star category in downtown Toronto and entered the ridiculously low price of $113. Low and behold the bid was accepted and I was booked in the Intercon on front st right by the CN tower. With fees the room was $136. I got to the hotel at about 12 30 and they checked me in w a smile, put me up on a high floor with a decent city view. the room was big, clean and well designed. no flat panel tv which just about all hotels of this quality have these days, but you can't have everything. had cookies and hot chocolate sent up to my room for $20 bucks and they were not good. all in all i have no reservations about recommending this hotel but i would not have any problem staying elsewhere next time in Toronto and absolutely no reservation about booking thru priceline again with the same parameters.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Janie_pooh
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last May while I was in Toronto for business. The hotel is an excellent location downtown and is close to all the major attractions and sights. Room was very nice and super comfortable. Would defintely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional downtown location for great price!!”
Reviews.Author: emsteph
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. In the heart of downtown Toronto at the base of the CN Tower, this is a great location at a great price ($155 Cdn). Very classy and elegant. Rooms are very clean with decent ameneties. The beds are very soft and you melt right into them. We had requested a high floor view and were given the 19th floor with a view of the CN Tower and Skydome. Really cool at night when the tower has its light show on. Quiet with no noise from hallways or outside. Thermostat controlled rooms. Came into the lobby after dinner and they had a trio of musicians playing soft jazz type music near the bar. Couldn't convince my wife to go for a drink as we all crashed into bed after a swim with the kids. Would have been a lovely atmosphere for a night cap. Did not eat dinner at the restaurant so no comment. The pool area is quiet and nice. Hot tub too. Waterfall and soft spa type music make it a relaxing swim. Even the children were quiet. Only downside is that there are no places to sit. Difficult for parents wishing to watch children while not swimming. Had to sit on the floor. A bench along the wall would suffice and is quite feasable to construct. Staff are extremely friendly. Enjoyed conversations with everyone. Bellhop was very helpful with information on hotel and city events. Parking is below hotel/convention centre at $21 for one night (24hrs). Close to all major attractions in Toronto. Definitely will return to this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: skeletoncrew
Reviews.Content: I came to Toronto for a meeting and spent one night at this hotel. I shared with a colleague and there was a bath robe and chocolates on her bed but nothing on mine. There were not enough towels and toiletries for 2 people so I had to call to get extra. Service came right away. There was a complimentary fruit basket with mineral water and maple sirup. Rooms are clean, bed is very comfortable, bathroom clean as well. Hotel is close to everything. I didn't have time to enjoy pool or rest of the amenities so I can't comment on that. My husband called and couldn't be put through because they couldn't find my name by confirmation number or by my last name. Even though it was a short stay I would stay here again thanks to hotel location and the good corporate price that I was given.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: adanac55
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Intercontinental Hotel has the best location for a hotel downtown in my mind. Our hotel faced the C.N Tower, steps from the RogersCentre (where the Toronto Blue Jays MBL Baseball team play), also a short walk from the Air Canada Centre (where the Toronto Maple Leafs NHL hockey team and Toronto Raptors Basketball team play), underground shopping (it is huge...and I mean huge the extent of the tunnels that go all the way to the Eaton Centre), steps from Union Station and major Toronto Subway trains and public transit plus a short distance to the Entertainment District for live theatre, bars, clubs, and amzing restaurants! Location to all those places were key to us. Toronto is a great city and this hotel gave us the opportunity to see lots of sites from our hotel home base. So, as you can tell, we were very pleased with the places we could visit right from our hotel room. Our stay was for December 30th and December 31st for a short New Year's Get away. We live about 1 and a quarter hour driving time from Toronto but every now and then we escape to the city. We had planned our 2 day vacation to be relaxing, entertaining in the big T.O and bring in 2008 in style and that's exactly what we got! The room....what can I say....but it was just fabulous. We ended up staying in a suite that had a bedroom with the most luxurious bed and we barely made it out of bed the next day since it was the most comfortable bed ever. The bed linens were so soft and silky and made our stay extremely romantic. We faced the C.N tower from our room and at night the tower was lit up with colourful lights that we admired from the living room just adjecent to our bedroom. We had a desk that was available for business (luckily we were not working that weekend) so it would have been perfect if we needed to do our business. There were connection cables for internet but we never needed it. The livng room had another television and bar area which was comfortable for relaxing. Keep in mind we had booked this weekend for a very well needed restful time and it fulfilled our every wish. We had a lovely view of the lake and the city of Toronto was so pretty all lit up at night. It was a quiet room and we felt it was our own little bit of paradise. There were bathrobes in the room for us to relax in and we brought our own wine, beer and snacks to enjoy our stay. There were lovely crystal wine glasses that we poured our wine into and it was just amazing to be in that setting at the hotel. We walked to restaurants nearby and found a few hidden gems. Our fav place for the afternoon was the Beer Bistro where we had our choice of beers from around the world. We also went to a cajan type place for dinner once called N'Awlins for dinner in the Entertainment District and great Blues live music. We ate at Cora's for yummy breakfast and it was very reasonable.All those places were a 10 minute walk or less. We ate at the hotel's main restaurant called Azure for New Year's Eve and had the most delicious food. There was a live band playing and although it was kind of poorly attented was very nice. Next time I think we'd stay the night at the hotel but go out to a club to have a more party type atmosphere with younger people. Don't get me wrong...the food was awesome and we ate like kings and queens but we were too full to party after....lol The reception desk staff were extremely helpful during our stay and our check in and check out were totally painless. The parking at the hotel was pricey and so we went across the road for the outdoor lot at a much lower rate. The hotel had valet and regular parking right on site. We just used that area to drop off our bags and one of us went in while the other parked the car. It seemed like a pretty safe area but you should always be careful in big cities. Nothing bad happened to our car. The pool facilities were really beautiful and the staff in the spa were very kind and helpful. It had an amazing metal art type palm tree waterfall deorating the poolside so it made it all that much nicer. We had stayed at the Yorkville Intercontinental last year and found this pool to be much nicer. Both hotels are uniquely different. This one is more modern but the Yorkville one is gorgous too. The only downfall was the men's sauna room had not been attented to in a long, long while. My boyfriend let the front desk staff know right away. The women's change room was spotless. The gym had loads of good equipment but we never saw it used durng our stay. The hotel is connected to the large conference centre called the Metro Convention Centre so if you need a place to stay right on site...this is the place. All in all it was a great stay. We booked on priceline and got it for much less than half the rate posted on the room door. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel and plan on visiting again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights for business”
Reviews.Author: GMROCKS
Reviews.Content: Checked in for a Wed-Sat stay but wrapped up business and left a day early. Impressions when you walk into this hotel is..where's the @#%$ check in?? it's too modern for it's own good with this expansive DARK lobby and too-cool-to-have-customers lobby lounge. When I did check in (9pm at night after 4hr flight and Pearson airport...) and went to my King room and saw the 2 doubles I was not impressed. called downstairs to see what they could do and was put on hold for 5 mins. went down to lobby and there was no issue getting a different room that did have a King. The room was average to good with plenty of room to move around and a decent bed. View of CN tower and Lk.Ontario was nice if that's what you're after. the bathroom was ok at best, nothing spectacular. I may stay again but unsure. If you need this location like I did then there are few other choices (avoid the Royal York).

Reviews.Title: “Boring and dingy”
Reviews.Author: sharpielvs
Reviews.Content: This hotel falls into the trap where they try to be upscale but just fall short at each turn. The rooms are dated, stained, and uninspired. There is nothing wrong with them but it's obvious that they skipped the attention to detail and there is no flair. There were some issues with cleanliness upon my arrival and the maid didn't really clean my room during my stay..just made up the bed and hung the towels. The staff all seemed to have an unwarranted attitude and seemed smug and short of advice or knowledge. Will not return as there are many options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomanded”
Reviews.Author: Deror
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for three nights at this hotel and enjoyed it very much. My whole family stayed at the hotel and loved it. We took several rooms, all were very nice, but mine was the nicest. The view from the hotel is great - the CN tower is right across from the window. The bad is huge and very comfortable, and so is the bathtub which was very wide and had a very strong current of water. There are lots of closet spaces; the bathroom is huge, clean and comfortable. There was a coffeemaker and various kinds of tea in the room, nice soaps, shampoos and conditioners, hair dryer and ironing board. I couldn't work out the television which too many channels and kept jumping from one to another. The hotel is right at the center of town, next to the CN tower (two minutes walk) and walking distance from the Eaton center (15 minutes walk) and railways station (7 minutes walk). We had dinner at the hotel (ordered in advance in a private room) which was great â€“ the room was nicely decorated for Christmas, the food was fabulous and the service great. The hotel's guest relations were very helpful and enabled us to organize everything in advance. We also has breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, which was fabulous â€“ a huge variety of foods: pancakes, omelets made on the spot, may types of seasonal and non seasonal fruits and barriers, breakfast cereals, potatoes, waffles etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, albeit business oriented”
Reviews.Author: robsinclair
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean, modern hotel. We stayed for 3 nights, our first time in Toronto and we found the hotel to be an excellent choice. We had booked on priceline for only $80 per night and so were delighted when we saw the quality of the room that we had. Everything in the hotel is very modern, from the bar and restaurant to the rooms. The room was clean and well-appointed, though the bathroom was probably the only part that is looking a little tired. The bar was nice for a post-dinner drink before bed but was otherwise pretty deserted as was the hotel restaurant. I guess maybe it gets most of its business during the week when the hotel is full of business people. The hotel is definitely oriented towards business people with its various conference facilities. This was not a problem for us, but if you're wanting elegance or character then this probably isn't the hotel for you. Location is also very good, walking distance of many sites, and bars/restaurants. Overall a very positive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: petrol1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the intercontinental Toronto centre for 3 nights in November 07. Hotel was expensive for what it was, but we were upgraded to business rooms on arrival due to being regular users of the hotel chain. Hotel is convenient for what we need it for but way to expensive for the poor condition of it. It is need a full refurbishment, soothe Hotel needs to take this in to account when setting room rates.

Reviews.Title: “not really five stars”
Reviews.Author: pearlieshell
Reviews.Content: Personally I would not rate this a five star hotel. For what you pay the room charge does not even provide you with modern basics like internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: blkjck5697
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting. Didn't really see any of the sights around the area, but noticed that you weren't that far away from the Hockey Hall of Fame, Union Station, the Rogers Centre, and the CN Tower. The room was clean, the bathroom looked dated, but clean. The bed was comfortable but not luxurious. The staff was very helpful. The Airport Express bus stops right in front of the hotel. A better alternative than taking a taxi to Pearson if it for 2 persons or less.

Reviews.Title: “Travellers Beware”
Reviews.Author: Allusive_Maiden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel (2 rooms of us) and in the past had never had any problems having large number of people in the room (we have never had to pay to register each person). Both rooms had: water damage, peeling paint or wallpaper, leaky faucets, stained carpets, loosely hinged coubhurts, the one room had mould and the AC was broken(you could see where there had been water damage under the hard wood), broken irons, faulty functioning remote, missing robes.[yes i have pictures], even the pool where the people were nice, the change rooms severely REEKED of mould, the hallway ceiling in our hall was FALLING (you could see cracks where it was failing) and the air vents were filthy, there was also no ventilation system in the bathroom. Staff in lobby were Snooty as well as the bell hops who took forever too get to our room so we gave up and took our own carts down. We were staying there under the preface that we were paying 169 a night so it would have been just shy of 400$... we ended up paying 479. . . they wanted us to pay over 600$ .. THEY tired to tell us we parked there when we did not, sent us in the wrong direction when we were leaving the parking after dropping people off, we got changed 15$ for that though we managed to to get that reserved because we were super annoyed by the lack of service and them trying to charge us for a vesicle we did not have in the parking lot (like we would stay there in the room if we owned a BMW). The Pool had mould on the ground around the couches, plants and antique wheel barrel. We had to chase down the cleaning staff to get our towels taken away and our garbage emptied. There was no notice that you are charged by the minute to make a LOCAL CALL. We requested a dry room and we were given one with alcohol and we could not use the fridge and they wanted to charge us 50$ to empty it and then another 50$ to restock it even thought we just wanted to use it for breakfast foods. We wanted to order more cups b/c we couldn't get the cleaning ladies and they wanted to charge us 75cents a glass PLUS a 10$ deposit fee, our other group had to wait till 7pm to get into their room because they didn't have their room ready (yes we booked our rooms MONTHS in advance), the bellhops gave us attitude because we wanted the carts to be left so we could pack them ourselves b/c we bought expensive things we didn't trust to anyone but ourselves to move. We will NEVER stay at that hotel again. The group said that the service there had been declining but this took the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest service, nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: MSKSTER
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel enough; I'm not sure I'd stay here again, though. I think there has got to be a better high-end hotel in the area. The rooms are nice and I loved the bed. The towels are nice enough, but there is only one robe/room. The restaurant seems empty all the time -- which for me is a bad sign, so I never ate there. I did, however, go down for a drink around 11 on a Friday night, just as they were calling last call. Only, they should have just said "we're closing" b/c before you knew it, the bartender had dropped off all the checks telling people to pay them. Then they turned the lights on. I was there exactly 3 mins after being served my $14 glass of wine. It was the most unrelaxing way to end a long day. The concierge is a joke. They are not informed about any of the going-ons in the city. Example: There was a greek festival, a beer festival, a flamenco festival, a carribbean festival, and many other outdoor things going on the weekend I was here. How come when I asked the concierge where any of those were, he hadn't heard about any of them. I asked him to look them up, and he did, but he gave me the wrong directions. The next day, I asked him to make me a reservation but he just told me to go to the restaurant and they'd probably be able to "fit me in". In short, stay here if you want to be in a nice room in a downtown location. But there isn't good food in the are and the service here is below par for an intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: TurquoiSea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we attended the Jays vs Yankees games in 2006 and 2007. In 2006 our room was on the 25th floor overlooking the lake. Beautiful room, very contemporary. 2007...We requested a similar one this year only to find rooms above the 6th floor they are $20 extra a night. Since we checked in one day early this year and one was not available, we were on the 6th floor overlooking the street. It was a larger room. Very nice. Also, they were happy to accomodate us when we asked to check in a day earlier. Parking is expensive!, but the valet attendant was very quick, efficient and gracious. Spa is beautiful, I recommend the reflexologist. THIS HOTEL IS NOT FOR KIDS! My son is 12 now so he knows to act accordingly. (We could see the staff try desperately not to cringe at the loud, demanding Yankee fans and their children who weren't on their best behavior. ) THE POOL IS PART OF THE SPA, so children were limited to one hour each day in 2006, this year the pool was closed. (I think they are trying to keep the spa atmosphere, so they can't accomodate the noisey kids) WHEN BOOKING: be aware that you can hear the trains at night when you are in a room facing the lake on floors 1-5. Great location. OUR SECRET: Have breakfast in the CN Tower Marketplace Cafe. They make Bagel/Egg sandwiches to order and very few people know they serve breakfast at a reasonable price. Purchase other breakfast, lunch and snacks in the building across the street from the hotel. (ex: Bottled water $.69 )

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Goulz
Reviews.Content: Had a 2-night stay on the first weekend of August. Location can't be beat. Central to our needs (Rogers Centre, Hockey Hall of fame) Shower pressure was good, The staff at check-in was very helpful (Thank you Kim!). Overall a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestFAN
Reviews.Content: Husband was attending conference so we stayed here because the hotel is attached to the convention center so it was the most convenient. It is also right next to the CN tower. Our room was on the 14th floor with a view of the tower and the water. The elevators are quick so ask for a high floor for views. Intercontinentals are high end Holiday Inns and I have no complaints about this one - clean, large rooms with computer on desk, nicely stocked mini-bar, welcoming fruit & cheese basket w/bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, below-par service detracted from overall experience.”
Reviews.Author: OftenContentFlyer
Reviews.Content: I have always found the intercontinental brand to be good hotels, and this was no exception. The room I had was recently renovated, and very nice. And, for a convention center hotel, I was thrilled that it was QUIET. I don't think I ever heard noise from other rooms, and the inevitable hallway door slams were few and far between. I would have to say, however, that the quality of the room was not matched by the quality of the hotel services. There was a long line at check-in, with staff appearing occasionally to glance upon the line and yet not help speed it up. The concierge recommended a restaurant on King street and got a reservation resulting in a fairly lame table. There was rarely a doorman, and the cleaning staff seemed to feel that one bar of soap was enough for both the shower and the sink. The staff at the bar was more often on break than not. There is no gift shop in the hotel. It's too bad -- I loved my room, I just which the rest of the hotel lived up to it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, has pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: rcp412
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental Toronto Centre hotel in late March, 2007. The hotel itself is in a great location, right across the street from the CN Tower, and walking distance to anything in downtown Toronto. Our room was a one bedroom suite, and on the Intercontinental site, it said that all suites had sofa beds. Ours did not, so we attempted to call the front desk, which was a long and difficult process by itself. There was no specific button for the front desk, just a service button. And whoever would answer the phone was entirely rude and unhelpful. We finally had to walk down to the front desk and the only person that was the slightest bit friendly and helpful was the general manager. In the end he gave us free food at the hotel for the entire stay. Overall the room was spacious (not exactly a suite, though) for a downtown hotel, comfortable, and nicely decorated. Room service was upscale and delicious, but the staff continued to be very unfriendly. I would consider staying here again, but might consider another downtown Toronto hotel if the price is better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: sunlvr2288
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel, you are greeted with smiling face. The lobby is grand, slick and crisp with the restaurant to the side with an open atmosphere as it blends in to the hotel lobby. The room was nicely decorated with elegant simplicity with a little splash of muted colors. The window shows a nice view of the city. When I called in to request for extra towels, the phone was answered by a very friendly attendant. In leass than 10 minutes, I heard someone knocking at the door delivering me more towels. Again the staff was very pleasant and friendly. We ordered someroom service and when it arrived, there were some errors. I called it in and the staff on the phone was appologetic and fixed the issue immediately in a very friendly manner. After checking out, we went down to pick up our car from the vallet service. Once again, we were greeted by friendly and helful staff who helped us load our luggage ijn the car. They graciously thanksed us for staying at the hotel and invited us back. That's my experience and it is fortunate I have nothing bad to say about this property for my stay in Toronto went as smooth as silk. That I will do.

Reviews.Title: “Only for an Exceptional Rate”
Reviews.Author: Fearful
Reviews.Content: We were guests of the hotel from May 30 to June 2. We booked on Hotwire and had a rate of $139.00 US. Hotwire categorizes this as a 41/2 star. It's not. We are most certainly glad we didn't pay more. We had looked forward to staying here. We have visited Toronto multiple times and although we had not stayed here, we had been to the bar and restaurant several times while previously attending conferences and conventions. We had previously stayed at the Intercontinental on Bloor Street and were most pleased with that hotel. The physical plant is lovely. The lobby is large and handsomely decorated, and the soaring atrium restaurant and bar at the front of the hotel still impresses after many years. Our room was nicely decorated in honey coloured, slightly cheap looking furnishings. We noted, however, that the elevator areas on our floor and several others were not decorated in the more contemporary style we saw on some other floors. It may be that there is a distinction in room furnishings, too. Housekeeping was OK, but there were some maintenance issues that included peeling paint in the bathroom and a piece of rag wedged in between the mirror and backspalsh. The body lotion was past date and was curdled and watery. Bedding and toweling were fine, but only one bathrobe was provided. There was no turndown or refresh service. Happily for us, there was a coffee maker. The hotel offers 24 hour room service but selections after 11:00 pm are very limited. Our biggest issue with the hotel was service. Check-in was unpleasant. Despite the fact that we are Priority Club members and had pre-registerd for a bonus offered to those staying at least 2 nights, we were advised that we were not eligible because we had only booked through Hotwire. The concierge service was the worst we've ever encountered. All those behind the desk seemed almost completely unaware of the current Toronto dining scene, bereft of suggestions, and unwilling to even look up phone numbers for restaurants to make reservations. (We provided them with them.) We were several times misinformed about closing times of restaurants, resulting in us not having a place to eat after a late theatre performance in North York. Food , drinks (the Mojito is unrecognizable), and service in the bar were not good. Our waitress on 2 occasions was surly. We were also told that last call was at 11:45, despite the fact that the hotel information book and conciege both said that the bar closes at 1:00 am. We later saw others being served at 12:30 am. The doorman was rarely at the door. There is a button on the phone in one's room that is supposed to be an "ask anything" service. We called several times. No one had an answer ... ever. Instead, we were shuffled from department to department until we gave up in frustration. The hotel is well located to Union Station, the Hockey Hall of Fame, the St. Lawrence Market, a number of good restaurants, and connects to the Convention Centre. A late check out of 2:00 pm. can be arranged. On line check- in service for airlines is complimentary at the business centre. If you can get a good rate, as we did, one can look past the problems, but this hotel most certainly does not merit paying more than $170.00.

Reviews.Title: “Not What you Expect from a Five Star”
Reviews.Author: stretchmom
Reviews.Content: We travel extensively and have certain expectations when staying at a four or five star hotel. Interncontinental in Toronto doesn't deserve its stars--this was like a three star! Our room had a layer of dust everywhere, the phone didn't work on the desk and the hotel response was "use the one on the nightstand." BTW, the phone on the nightstand worked but none of the speed dial buttons worked, like a direct call to guest services would have been nice. We asked for turn down service everyday, and every night no one came to freshen the room. The fitness centre was designed by someone who never works out so it was kind of a joke, and there is no house phone on that floor so if you need to call a room while visiting the fitness centre you need to go to another floor. I could go into more events that were annoying like the wifi that no one told us about as we struggled to get the Internet connected through a cable (no signage), and the broken phone that buzzed in the middle of the night! On the good side, the location is great! But if we went back to Toronto we would never stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but not for Kids”
Reviews.Author: Payne15
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire. And as far as hotels go it has an air of richness about it. The staff is personable and helpful while the rooms contain large bathrooms with soft beds. My only complaint and I knew this going in was that this hotel is not designed for children. It appears to be made for businessman and couples. The pool area is gorgeous but once again kids really are not welcome. They use to have restricted pool hours for kids but I think enough people complained so they got rid of those hours. Overall, a pleasant experience but if you have children stay at another place.

Reviews.Title: “Great views from the top”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: For one night at this hotel the check-in staff kindly put me in a corner room with great views over Toronto and the lake - ask if one is free when you stay here. Access to the Convention Centre next door is simple - although the Centre itself is confusing. Downtown is a few blocks away - past some interesting street characters. The room was clean and well furnished. The bathroom is smaller than most, but well equipped. I didn't try the restaurants - or the mini-bar! The Sheraton and Hilton also looked nice, but I think this Intercontinental is a good choice for Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: SE-Explorer
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Toronto Centre is a nice hotel. Huge, modern atrium-like entry space â€“ the registration is set far from the main entrance at the rear of the space with no signs, only a multi-colored painting. Figured this was the place to check due to the long lines. We had purchased a large king suite for our stay, but it was not ready at 1PM, so we went to lunch. Upon our return were showed an okay room which overlooked many rail tracks leading into the main station. Within 5 minutes we could here many rumblings and sounds of the horns of passing trains; so we knew we wouldnâ€™t be able to sleep here. We were told they would work on it. I didnâ€™t appreciate the comment about the first room, â€œweâ€™ve never received a complaint about noise in this room beforeâ€�. So, what is the number of complaints one must receive for it to be valid? I donâ€™t ask much from a room: firm bed, quiet to be able to sleep and cool also to be able to sleep. Fortunately another room was found far away from the rail tracks; this could be difficult as this hotel straddles the tracks. While the room difficulty had a happy ending, the initial contacts were a trend that was to reveal itself during our stay. Canada may look a bit like the US, people are nice, but they severely lack customer service. They just donâ€™t know how to respond when someone makes a reasonable complaint. Only when we pressed, did the situation was the issue resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: arandle
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in March 2007, and were delighted with the accommodation. Conveniently located next to the CN Tower, this harbourside hotel provided a fantastic view of Lake Ontario, and was situated across the road from the underground walkway (PATH) and the Simcoe food court. In addition, the hotel was only a 20 min walk to the Eaton shopping centre (via the PATH). The hotel itself was immaculate, with a huge lobby and polite, friendly, helpful staff (front desk, concierge and doormen). Our top floor rooms were excellent, with nice firms beds, and pillows that could be exchanged upon request. The only downside was that there was no free internet access. Overall, we loved our stay at the InterContinental Toronto Centre, and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't, under any circumstances, touch the Mini-Bar!!”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton1066
Reviews.Content: A comfortable, if somewhat 'sterile' hotel. Whoever priced the food items in the Mini Bar must surely have worked in an art gallery: $4.50 plus taxes for a TWIX bar - you have to be kidding?

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBD
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights here. The location is excellent - we walked everywhere downtown as the places we wanted to go were all within walking distance, and weather was unseasonably warm. Room was very nicely decorated and with super drapes that kept out light. Beds were comfortable. It was also very quiet. Maid service was excellent -we stayed working in the room until early afternoon and the maid still made up the room without bothering us early on. We ate only breakfast here, a very good buffet, because a group booking for some of our stay meant that the restaurant had deafening disco music on and lights off to cater for the group. There is only one restaurant, and we like it relatively quiet to have conversation. However, there is a good choice of restaurants nearby (don't go to the texas barbecue across the street). Staff friendly and helpful. Also had room service which was quick and good apart from stale rolls. Only problem was noisy restaurant in the evening which meant we could not even enjoy a quiet corner of the bar to chat with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leahy
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and i have just returned from Toronto after 10 nights at the wonderful Intercontinental on Front Street West over Christmas and New Year. The hotel is in a perfect location for tourists with Union Station(subway and streetcars) less than a minutes walk away,the CN Tower,Rogers Centre and Harbourfront are also very close by and the Eaton centre and entertainment district within easy walking distance. Our flight from the UK landed late and we had problems with our luggage so it was pretty late when we arrived at the hotel tired and stressed but we were soon in our room as check in was lightning quick,we had paid that little bit extra for a suite as we were staying for ten nights and it was certainly money well spent as the suite was huge comprising of a large sitting room with city and lake views and an equally large bedroom with city views,two spacious bathrooms topped off the accomodation. The suite was very nicely furnished with modern decor including a large working area/business centre and lots of closet/drawer space(vitally important when travelling with a woman for 10 days!!),the two mini bars were well stocked but very expensive,the hi-speed internet connection was also a bit steep and there wasnt a safe in the room but apart from these minor quibbles we were very pleased with the accomodation. We didnt use room service during our stay but we ate in the restaurant,Azure,a couple of times and the food was excellent,unlike the previous reviewer we had no problems with service in the bar,the lovely piece of glass art above the bar is a real focal point,the concierge was very helpful and she even managed to get us a couple of tickets to a sold out Maple Leafs game while we were there,overall we found all the staff in the hotel from doormen to manager very polite,helpful and courteous,housekeeping even left us a note every day thanking us for our tips. The hotel was extremely busy for the first few days of our stay as there was a convention on in the Metro centre attached to the hotel but obviously the hotel has been well soundproofed as even with a packed hotel the noise was minimal. All in all we couldnt find fault with what is a superb hotel,we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “May be my last stay at this Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: kimosabi
Reviews.Content: This was the third year in a row that my friends and I stayed at this Intercontinental hotel during the Toronto Food and Wine show. The first year it was great; last year it was ok and this year we were really disappointed. The service at checkin was very slow (more than usual). The TV in the room did not work. After several promised visits from the repair man we eventually got it working. The room finishings seemed a bit worn for an expensive hotel. I do have to tell you that the view was spectacular from the room - we had 2 large windows overlooking Lake Ontario. The room service was adequate; the food was good but expensive. The service in the bar was unbearable - we had to flag someone down to get attention. The breakfast was good but seemed to be overpriced for what you got. The final bill was messed up - the wrong credit card was charged for the room despite us providing the correct one (they used the one that our friends had used for the reservation). My husband forgot his glasses there and they were helpful in finding them and agreed to fedex to us (at our expense of course) but took 4 days longer than they said to get it to fedex (had we known, we could have made other arrangements). It was just not the experience that it used to be - the service has definitely gone down hill. I think next year we will switch back to the Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jason1975
Reviews.Content: everything about this hotel was sweet. location, rooms, pool/spa/fitness room. we loved it. only drawback was the cost of parking, which is a common problem in the downtown core of large cities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good room, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MandiM
Reviews.Content: As in previous posts, this hotel was not spectacular, but it was good. We got one of the gold-beige rooms on the 25th (highest) floor that could probably use new bedspreads and artwork. The room had a great view of the city, but the CN Tower was on the other side:-( The pool DID enforce the "no children in the WHIRLPOOL" policy, but the kids were free to go into the pool with an adult. The pool is small. At one point, there were 10 kids in the pool and no room for adults to get out of the Marco Polo game. (Seems kids come to the pool a lot between 7 and 9 pm.) The locker rooms are nice -- there is a steam room that feels great after walking all day. For our first time in Toronto, I thought the location was great. It was close to the Union Station subway. I highly recommend taking the bus from the airprot to the subway station (The 192 Airport Rocket goes directly from the airport to Kipling subway station, and you transfer at St. George Station to the Milton (yellow) line going south to Union Station. You can save yourself around $13 per person ($2.75 vs the Airport Express at $16.45). The hotel is a short two-block walk from the subway. Between the street cars and the subway, we never had to take a cab. Public transportation is $2.75 to anywhere in the city. We went all over Toronto, and the hotel was a great base to radiate from. Staff at the hotel was great. The concierge gave us umbrellas on a rainy day and was wonderful at giving directions on how to use public transit. Cleaning was great, and they are thoughtful to give you the option of clean towels or conserving natural resources and reusing the towels -- we would at home, so why not? Bedding made sleeping here great. The sheets were high thread count. The pillows were a perfect blend between soft and firm -- I'm a side sleeper. Down comforters for winter were very comfy. I recommend this hotel as good -- it's not romantic, quaint, or chic, but it is a great central location that fits the bill for a first trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at IC Toronto Centre”
Reviews.Author: WanderingMusician
Reviews.Content: I chose the IC Toronto Centre because of its close proximity to the CN Tower, where we had dinner reservations. I had a wonderful stay at the hotel. The front desk staff were very polite and attentive. I was upgraded because of my Ambassador status, and there was a lovely fruit basket waiting for my arrival. The room provided a good view of the CN Tower, although the railyard below was not very picturesque. The room was very well appointed, with an *extremely* comfortable bed. The pillow-top mattress was quite soft, as was the quilted bedcover. The 23rd floor was very quiet, despite the fact that two conventions were being held at the hotel. Both housekeeping and 24-hour room service were quick and efficient with any reqests. If I called the concierge/front desk, the phone was always answered promptly, with a "Hello, Miss Musician. What can we do for you?" There were plenty of movies to choose from on the tv (a complimentary movie came with the room), so it was easy to relax the night away. Cocktails and hors d'oeuvres on the Club Floor were excellent and tasty. There is 24-hour access to the computer and printer on the Club floor, and the only blemish was the agonizingly slow "hi-speed" connection at the Club's computer. I didn't try the hi-speed connection in our room, so unfortunately, I'm unable to make a comparison. I had a very nice stay, and will definitely return to the IC Toronto Centre during my next trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place and friendly front-desk”
Reviews.Author: kevertje
Reviews.Content: OK, we paid only 96 USD for this hotel but we didn't experience we were a 'cheap-priceline-guest' like other hotels let you experience. They gave us a room on the TOP-floor which I requested with a KING bed. When we opened the door we could smell the cigaretts of the previous guest so I went back to the front-desk and they gave me another room on the same floor (25th). The view was excellent. We were so close to the CN tower than we had problems seeing the whole tower. The hotel is close to everything, parking is easy in the convention center which costs us only 20 Canadian Dollars for 24 hours. We had an early checkin which was nice and we enjoyed the pool. We had no reason to complain except that they charge you for the internet-usage. I complained to the front-desk because the directory mentioned 'complementary internet' and after they discussed it with the manager they called me back and gave me 24 hours free internet. I really recommend this hotel to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, Convenient Convention Centre Location, OK but Smokey Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BugSea
Reviews.Content: I chose the IC because it was ajacent to the convention centre, and it was, indeed, very convenient for attending a conference there. I arrived late in the evening and was given a smoking room, despite my request for non-smoking accomodations. I was informed that chosing a non-smoking room was a request that they did not have to (and could not) honor. Despite offering to pay "any amount" to be upgraded to a different non-smoking room, I was told there was a possibility I could be moved the following day, and that an "ozonator" would be sent up to the room that would substiantially help. After 1 hour in a decent room which smelled like a cigar bar, I called the front desk to inquire where the ozonator was. The front desk person told me in an extremely condesending tone, "well, maybe I'm just ignorant, but those things don't help". When I explained that it was at the hotel's suggestion, they just transferred me to a number that rang endlessly without explanation. The ozonator arrived and was useless. The following day I stood in a 3 person line at the front desk for 20 minutes waiting to see if a new room was available, which it was (but only with double beds). Overall, the hotel lobby and public spaces were modern and nice, the rooms (at least when they don't smell like George Burns' living room) were clean, needed a bit of repair (wallpaper falling off and unexplained holes in walls), and the hotel was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssvensson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental on Saturday the 7th of October for one night. We wanted a little weekend getaway. This hotel is acurately rated a 4 and 5 star hotel. It is beautiful. The decor is very modern and upscale. The rooms were larger sized and very clean. The beds were VERY comfortable. I slept excellent. The main thing I would say is that if you are taking the family, it may not be the best family-friendly hotel in Toronto. It is more geared towards the business class, however, I did see families with children there and they were able to use the pool. There was also a kiddie pool next to the larger one. The only thing is that families with children are more limited to specific times they can use it. Other than that, the hotel is in an excellent vacation. We had a beautiful view of the waterfront and CN Tower. In fact, the hotel is only a short walk away from the CN Tower. It is also very close to the Hockey Hall of Fame, Rogers Centre, and the Hockey Arena where the MapleLeafs play. They are all within a few blocks either way of the hotel. The Eaton Centre is within walking distance several blocks away. We walked pretty much everywhere, however the train station and subway station was right next door as well. I definitely would reccommend this hotel if you have a few extra bucks to spend, it is well worth the price and the service was well. It was a very nice weekend in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk, but fabulous room and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: At check in I just about turned around and left this hotel. They claimed not to have my reservation and insisted I was likely reserved at the Bloor Street location, not this one. I politely explained that my company had the same meeting at this hotel the year before, so I was confident it was this one. After about 15 minutes of making me feel completely unwanted, they finally found my reservation but only for 2 of the 3 nights. "Lucky for me" as they told me, they had one extra room for that night and could accomodate my early arrival! I was so irritated. Thankfully, the rooms are very comfortable, clean and modern. My room was very quiet and I slept really well every night. The location is great as it is steps from my office, the King Street West area for dining, and of course the CN Tower. I ate at Azure, the hotel restaurant several times. It's a little pricey but you can't go wrong. The food was fabulous there. The Saturday morning brunch was well worth the $20.00. It's a great spot in downtown Toronto, just make sure you double confirm your reservation to avoid the surly front desk staff treating you poorly (I am even a Priority Club Member which didn't seem to matter!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service in downtown TO”
Reviews.Author: rubberducky
Reviews.Content: Who we are: A family with two small children (3 and 1 years old) with parents in their mid 30's, hubby's from TO and I'm from Vancouver. We have stayed in three other TO properties in the last two years - The Grand which was nice but too small of a room for us, Pantage Suites which was very nice and had a washer/dryer, very large suite, etc. however was a bit too pricey for us and One King West which was very nice also had a washer/dryer but was too small square footage wise and had very weird room confiigurations with huge funiture. So this time I was looking for something that had everything we wanted: a pool, walking distance to restaurants, Eaton's Centre, etc., something kinda funky and upscale but not over priced. I took a huge risk and booked our hotel on Hotwire - I chose a four star hotel for $97 a night and got the Intercontinental which I was thrilled with. The Intercontinental was actually a Crowne Plaza property before Interncontinental bought it and renovated. The outside of of the building is nothing spectacular and we actually drove right by it before "finding" it on our return down the block. The hotel is attached to the Convention Centre and the subway right beside the CN Tower. The Lobby is spectacular and the bellman was wonderfully attentive to our many packages, bags and children. Check in took a while and even though we arrived at 4:45pm our room was not ready. This was upsetting because we had been driving all day and wanted to put the kids down for a while. The hotel offered to buy us all a drink (alcoholic for the parents) at the bar - Azure. The bar was very nice and thank goodness they were buying the drinks because they were very very very expensive!! We went back in 45 minutes and the room was still not ready... arrrghhh!! I told them it would cost them two more drinks... they quite happily gave up two more drink vouchers and then got a phone call that room was actually ready. They let me keep the vouchers which was very nice and off we went. We got a room on the 16th floor facing the city (not the CN Tower side). It was very nice, roomy, had a wonderful comfy bed with lots of pillows and a duvet, mini-bar and internet hook up ($11 a day). In the room is where you can tell that not everything has been replaced i.e., door knobs/key passes, temperature controls for room, bathroom fixtures, etc. It would be nice if they did replace everything so that it all feels "new", however it would be expensive. We ate at the buffet for breakfast on Sunday morning.. it was very yummy, however a bit pricey again for my liking - $24 each I think. I must admit that I probably did eat at least $20 in Brie.. it was so good.... lol I had a massage in Victoria's Spa. The masseuse was Russian (I've forgotten her name.. ) she was lovely and sweet and gave me a wonderful massage. Again I thought the price was a bit steep - $125 for 55 minutes.. I think I'm sounding cheap now tho... lol The pool has three parts, the main pool which has a fountain/waterfall effect, a small wading pool for kids and a hot tub in which children are not allowed. We had heard that there were specificl "kids allowed" times, however this did not seem to be the case and as long as your kids are not yelling and screaming I don't think anyone would have a problem with them being there. Our kids loved the wading pool and had a great time. The locker rooms are great and there's a steam room/sauna in each. The valet parking was again pricey in my opinion... $30 a day, however they were always so nice and helpful that I really didn't mind paying... So here's my list of pros and cons: Pros: Great value for your money Hotel staff very friendly Beautiful renovation Great location Lovely pool Nice sized room Every room has a view of some type Convenient to transit Close to many restaurants on King Street Spa facilities Enticing restaurant/bar area Great bed with fabulous soft linens Lots of storage in room for clothes and "stuff" Cons: They should have your room ready by 3pm Expensive parking Old "fixtures" and bathtub/showers Slow elevators in the morning when everyone is checking out Expensive internet (it should be included in the room price) There is no back to the counter in the bathroom, it's very annoying to have to keep picking stuff up... Overall we would definitely stay there again for the right price.. it doesn't have a washer/dryer or a kitchenette but really that's all it's missing for us... Cheers, Michelle

Reviews.Title: “Just as expected”
Reviews.Author: Springbreakers2
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Toronto, it was just as we expected it to be-- Wonderful! Great place to stay, treated our family like kings, and so convenient to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise on my first visit”
Reviews.Author: Mr. Paul Kemp
Reviews.Content: I was directed to this hotel via a great deal on Hotwire and now I'm definitely considering making it my new 'home away from home' after more than 30 stays at another, The Metropolitan. The price I got was great, but this hotel would definitely be worth paying the normal rate. You can't beat the location (right on Front St. near Union Station) and everything about the place has a touch of class, but without being stuffy. The Restaurant / Bar is actually quite reasonably priced and certainly suitable to host business meetings. The food was great and there were actually some good vegetarian options (which is often too difficult to find). They've also got 24 hour room service with an actual menu for us late night types. The room I got was nothing special, but I'm assuming that was due to my Hotwire purchase. The rest of the hotel would lead me to believe that the 'full price' or renovated rooms must be quite nice. All in all an incredibly comfortable stay, and a nice surprise for someone who hates staying at new hotels. (I've had enough bad experiences that I'm more prone to stay put at an average place rather than venture out into the world.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: familyontour
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of our trip to Toronto for 2 nights. Room was spacious and extremely comfortable - even with 2 kids in tow. Location was great too - right beside the CN Tower and Skydome/Rogers Centre. We got a room on the 8th floor (club floor) through Priority Club membership which meant we had a complimentary continential breakfast every morning as well as free local calls and internet connnection. Only gripe was that, as a business hotel, it's focus is not on families and accordingly kids can only use the pool between 3pm -5pm (with max 10 kids allowed in pool at any one time). That said, we made great use of the pool during that time every day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Highly recommend this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What an excellent stay we had at the InterContinental Toronto Centre! Word of caution, there are 2 InterContinental's in the downtown Toronto area -- this review is for the one located on Front Street West (near the Rogers Centre, a/k/a Skydome). Everything went smooth from check-in to check-out. Doormen and front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was booked online through Priceline's website, got a great $deal$ by using the "name your own price" feature. The room itself was spectacular, very clean, looked new, extremely comfortable king sized bed, gorgeous 16th floor view of the lake, CN Tower, and Rogers Centre. Would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat! Highly recommended. Enjoy your future stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: inkwave17
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Toronto to attend some baseball games and got a good rate at this hotel. The location couldn't have been better, as I was able to walk to the stadium in less than 5 minutes and also be close to the subway for daytime explorations of Toronto. It is also within walking distance to the Hockey Hall of Fame, CN Tower, Toronto Islands ferry and the St Lawrence Market. The Intercontinental is also a stop for the Airport Express bus, which will get you to/from Pearson Intl in about 35-50 minutes depending on traffic. All the staff I dealt with at this hotel were very friendly and helpful, across the board from the front desk manager to the bellhop to the maid. I had a drink at the hotel bar one night, which was stylish looking, but not very busy other than your typical traveling businessman types. The room itself was spotless and comfortable with plenty of room for two occupants. The beds were a delight, with fluffy duvets and plenty of pillows. The bathroom had plenty of towels and toiletries. Although the hotel was fairly busy hosting a conference, I never heard a peep from the hallway or neighbors. All in all, I have absolutely no complaints about my stay here. While the location was a bit "financial district" rather than "cool neighborhood", it was perfect for my needs on this trip and I had no trouble reaching other parts of the city quickly and easily.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Value and Service!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorNurse
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the The Intercontinental Toronto center and both agree that this is an excellent hotel! We were able to secure a room on the 17th floor at an excellent rate via expedia for a 5 day stay. We were able to request a superior room, with a lakefront.CN Tower view 2 weeks before we arrived via telephone, and the service was first rate. the lobby is sleek, with wonderful contemporary furniture and interior decor. The room is comfortable, with a down comforter, and upscale furnishings...The amenities were definitely higher end, although not the VERY, Very best, but we felt that we got a wonderful deal, and ejoyed our stay... The staff were first rate! the concierge staff (Genevieve and Jackie) were excellent and gave wonderful recommendations for things to do and see in Toronto. Additionally, givn the central location of the hotel, we were able to buy many tickets for attractions (CN Tower tours, City bus tours, Day trips to Niagra Falls) in the hotel, and were able to avoid long lines...they went beyond the call of duty, and even when there was a scheduling snafu with one of our tours, they PERSONNALLY went with us to resolve the issue immediately...Again, FIRST Rate service from the staff... The other key bit about the hotel was its central location...2 blocks away from Union Train/subway (Called the TTC in Toronto) station, Directly on the list of stops for the airport shuttle, 10 minutes from the CN tower, and the city tour buses, and 1 block from an excellent Eastside Marios restaurant (where the appetizers are 1/2 price Sunday-Thursday and an excelent choice for food if you are on a budget!)... We enjoyed our stay immensely, and recommend this hotel highly...I travel often for business, and have stayed in many hotels that are NOT as niceas this, and a few that were better, but for the money, and the purpose of a relaxing, easy to navigate vacation, this hotel was really world class! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed, more like a three star.....”
Reviews.Author: sandraLondon_England
Reviews.Content: not a good beginning - when we arrived early friday evening no doorman or anyone to help with our luggage. We had to lug our cases to the reception desk on far side of large lobby area. Once we were checked in we had to take luggage to our room ourselves. We had a junior suite which although had good views on the 1th foor of the CNN tower and lake, was very oldfashioned. I had understood the hotel had recently been refurbished and had requested a contemporary room. It seemed like the sort of Howard Johnsons I stayed in 20 years ago. The bathroom fittings were very cheap and oldfashioned. We were very disappointed. The lobby area, bar and restaurant were quite nice and modern and did look refurbished. Buffett breakfast was good and included in our room rate. However the restaurant was virtually deserted in the evenings with no atmosphere and bad service. There is nothing in the neighbourhood and you need to get a taxi to go out to dinner. The concierge service varied - one was excellent but others not so, including one who could not recommend anywhere for lunch on the Saturday as they said nowhere was open. We have been staying in Sofitels which are excellent but unfortunately there was not one in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “This review is of the Intercontinental Toronto Center...”
Reviews.Author: IslandChief
Reviews.Content: As mentioned previously, there are two (at least?) Intercontinental Hotels in Toronto and this review is of the Toronto Center location. Being contiguous with the convention center, it is certainly a convention hotel - but a good one. The lobby and rooms are decorated in a "high-end convention hotel" style, but are clean and well maintained, and the rooms are spacious. The spa is small but more than adequate. The fitness center is a bit of a joke for a hotel of this size but I was able to find an open machine each time I was there. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy response to a problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
