Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel and enjoyed the location and facilities. On check out I used the express check out. It is now 2 weeks since I stayed there and I have not yet recieved a copy of my bill nor have either of my calls to the client rep been returned. Today I spoke to the client rep who didnt return my calls and she offered no explanation as to why the bill hadn't been sent, nor why she didnt return my calls. She did offer an insincere apology for others not looking after her calls. She was clearly disinterested in my problem and my annoyance. I've spent nearly 50 years in the customer service business and I accept that errors happen. However indifference to a customer complaint is never acceptable. They have lost a client.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week at beginning of Dec '05. Very close to CN Tower, Skydome, Air Canada Centre (you've got to take in a Leafs game), and Union Station for easy connections to rest of city. Room a bit bland but was great value so with so much to do who cares. If you're toying with going to Toronto then do it - you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “2 Tornoto Intercontinentals--loved mine”
Reviews.Author: amaja1
Reviews.Content: As you will see below, there are mixed reviews under this listing. This is because there are two Toronto Intercontinetal hotels--one in the downtown area and one in the Yorkville area. I stayed in the downtown location, and it was a very enjoyable experience. The staff was very helpful and polite. The room itself was large and nicely decorated with a good view overlooking Lake Ontario. The bathroom was very clean and well appointed, with marble counter tops and dark wood shelving. The location of the hotel was very convenient, with a subway stop about 3-4 blocks away. Also, the hotel restaurant had a great Sunday brunch. There was only one blip in service, and that was the one day they did not clean our room while we were out for the day. Otherwise, I would have rated this hotel with 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a room here for $100 US per night on Hotwire. We were very happy when we arrived to see a very modern and upscale place. This hotel is FAR nicer than the other Intercontinental in town (on bloor st) and is right next to the CN Tower. The service was excellent, our concierge recommended the most perfect restaurants (kit kat & East) and lounges (Monte Cristo & Ultra) that we were looking for. I saw that some people complained about the location of this hotel, but we found it to be perfect. It's a short walk to Queen Street and the Subway is only a block away (Union Station). So you can get to other neighborhoods and shopping very easily. Check in was easy and we asked for and got a room on the 21st floor with a view of the city, which was excellent! Truly, this was a spectacular deal and we are demanding customers who usually stay at Westin properties and/or W hotels. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others. The rooms are great. Not extraordinary, but great. Best restaurant we tried was in Yorkville, called "Sotto Sotto". Call ahead and make a rez, it's incredible! We are picky foodies from San Francisco and loved it. Toronto is alot of fun....

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rochesterian_Guy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental on Aug. 12 and 13 and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The hotel, formerly the Crowne Plaza, has been renovated and is splendid. The room was large, well appointed and clean. Had the good fortune to run into the hotel asst. front desk manager twice in the elevator who went out of her way to be solicitous and pleasant. Overall, a great hotel at $114.00 CA in a great location. You can't go wrong at the price.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the InterContinental hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just return from staying at the InterContinental hotel, August 10-15, I was very impressed with the hotel and the location of the hotel. I stayed in room 2219 which over looked the Rogers Centre, and Lake Ontario and the CN Tower, pretty much the south end. The view was just to die for each day that I woke up and was able to look out and see some of the main attractions within the city. A couple days while I was there I did see the top opened on the Rogers Centre and I was able to get plenty of pictures of that shot, a couple days was cloudy, so that was nice! The location is great, I think one is less than quarter of a mile walking distance from the CN Tower, go early though, a big tourist spot, maybe 2-3 blocks east of the train station, less than a mile or right at it, for walking down to Queens Quay and the harborfront. The entertainment district is right up the street on John R and one had plenty of restaurants to choose from each night their in town. There are always cab's right in from of the hotel for any places you may need to make a run towards. I see no need for a car if your staying at this hotel, everything is within walking distance or a short a cab ride to the location. One will save money by taking the train or the airplane. The hotel definitely had a grown up adult feel to it, very kind of darkish at night time in the lobby. The pool area was nice, small and quiet atmosphere, right next to the spa area. The pool and hot tub closed early, 8pm each night, that made it tough if one was out most of the day to get to the pool area. Overall, I think the renovations that they said took place on the hotel paid off! I would recommend this hotel to everyone, very nice, clean and friendly staff in trying to make your trip or stay a great one. I plan on coming back to stay here again myself, just for the great location if nothing else!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kindkat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this magnificent hotel for 4 nights and loved every bit of it. We stayed in room 1013 which had a fantastic view of the CN tower and marina. The room was beautifully decorated and the bed was AMAZINGLY comfortable. I came home wanting to recreate that exact bed in my own home. The newspaper was always waiting for us when we got up in the morning. The staff was very friendly and concierge was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. The gym has excellent cardio machines, each with small TV displays. Remember to bring your own headphones, however, since the spa will charge you for a pair. Gym also has weightlifting equipment and free weights, gym towels for use and a water cooler. On our last day we ate at Azure (the hotel restaurant) and partook of the superb buffet. One of the best lunch buffets I have every seen. Wonderfully fresh salads and seafood, hot dishes, cheeses, breads, and desserts. Overall, I had an extremely pleasant stay at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “It's about time...”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuruToronto
Reviews.Content: I have to say, this hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in. Traveling more than 150 days out of the year, I finally found a hotel who's doorman greet me by name before I even check in, my luggage is waiting for me in my room before I even get there and my newspaper of choice is delivered daily. Not to mention the fabulous service I received in their restaurant, Azure. The menu selection is ample and the taste is superb. I would highly recommend Azure to fellow collegues and clients. All in all, my experience was nothing less than perfect. I have now offically made the Intercontinenal my hotel of choice when staying in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of a disappointment..”
Reviews.Author: Thebestofeverything
Reviews.Content: I had heard that these chains were really popular in Europe so I expected a better than average hotel..we checked in and got a small room at the end of the hall way..a hassle considering we had luggage for a 10 day trip..the bathroom was small and dark..who can put on makeup like real lady in those dark quarters???? We were spoiled since we had, earlier, in the same trip,stayed at the Park Hyatt in Toronto, and the Lowe's Hotel Vogue in Montreal and this hotel was used as a one night layover until our flight took off the next night..the Park Hyatt could not accomodate us for that last night..However, what we found nice was the breakfast the next morning in their restaurant..what a eclectic fun menu of all countries..we loved that more than anything else..worth the breakfast if you are in that area..our room including the price of the breakfast, for 2 people, although we really did not get a bargain was $299 Canadian...go for breakfast only..you will love the beautiful spacious restaurant..by the way, the hotel was in a great walking area...

HotelInfo.Name: InterContinental Toronto Centre
HotelInfo.Address: 225 Front Street West, Toronto, Ontario M5V 2X3, Canada
